Text

Dusk — of a summer night .

And the tall walls of [the commercial heart of [an American city of perhaps 400,000 inhabitants]219-an american city of perhaps 400,000 inhabitants]218-the commercial heart of an american city of perhaps 400,000 inhabitants — such walls as in time may linger as a mere fable .

And up [the broad street]220-the broad street , now comparatively hushed , [a little band of six,—a man of about fifty , short , stout , with bushy hair protruding from under a round black felt hat]221-a little band of six,—a man of about fifty , short , stout , with bushy hair protruding from under a round black felt hat , [a most unimportant - looking person , who carried a small portable organ such as is customarily used by street preachers]222-a most unimportant - looking person , who carried a small portable organ such as is customarily used by street preachers and [singers]223-singers . And with [him]222-a most unimportant - looking person , who carried a small portable organ such as is customarily used by street preachers [a woman perhaps five years [his]222-a most unimportant - looking person , who carried a small portable organ such as is customarily used by street preachers junior]224-a woman perhaps five years his junior , taller , [not so broad , but solid of frame and vigorous , very plain in face and dress , and yet not homely]225-not so broad , but solid of frame and vigorous , very plain in face and dress , and yet not homely , leading with one hand [a small boy of seven and in the other carrying a Bible and several hymn books]226-a small boy of seven and in the other carrying a bible and several hymn books . [With these three , but walking independently behind]227-with these three , but walking independently behind , was [a girl of fifteen]228-a girl of fifteen , [a boy of twelve]229-a boy of twelve and [another girl of nine]230-another girl of nine , all following obediently , but not too enthusiastically , in the wake of the others .

It was hot , yet with a sweet languor about it all .

Crossing at right angles [the great thoroughfare on which [they]232-they walked]231-the great thoroughfare on which they walked , was a second canyon - like way , threaded by throngs and [vehicles]233-vehicles and [various lines of cars]234-various lines of cars which clanged [their]234-various lines of cars bells and made such progress as [they]234-various lines of cars might amid swiftly moving streams of traffic . Yet [the little group]235-the little group seemed unconscious of anything save a set purpose to make its way between the contending lines of traffic and [pedestrians]236-pedestrians which flowed by [them]234-various lines of cars .

Having reached [an intersection this side of [the second principal thoroughfare]238-the second principal thoroughfare]237-an intersection this side of the second principal thoroughfare — really just an alley between [two tall structures]239-two tall structures — now quite bare of life of any kind , [the man]240-the man put down the organ , which [the woman]241-the woman immediately opened , setting up a music rack upon which [she]241-the woman placed a wide flat hymn book . Then handing the Bible to [the man]240-the man , [she]241-the woman fell back in line with [him]240-the man , while [the twelve - year - old boy]243-the twelve - year - old boy put down a small camp - stool in front of the organ . [The man]240-the man — [the father]245-the father , as [he]240-the man chanced to be — looked about [him]240-the man with seeming wide - eyed assurance , and announced , without appearing to care whether [he]240-the man had any auditors or not :

" [We]2273-we will first sing a hymn of praise , so that any who may wish to acknowledge [the Lord]2274-the lord may join [us]2273-we . Will [you]246-the eldest girl , who until now had attempted to appear as unconscious and unaffected as possible oblige , [Hester]120-hester ? "[240-the man]

At this [the eldest girl , who until now had attempted to appear as unconscious and unaffected as possible]246-the eldest girl , who until now had attempted to appear as unconscious and unaffected as possible , bestowed [her]246-the eldest girl , who until now had attempted to appear as unconscious and unaffected as possible rather slim and as yet undeveloped figure upon the camp chair and turned the leaves of the hymn book , pumping the organ while [[her]246-the eldest girl , who until now had attempted to appear as unconscious and unaffected as possible mother]247-her mother observed :

" [I]247-her mother should think it might be nice to sing twenty - seven tonight—'How Sweet the Balm of [Jesus]121-jesus ' Love . ' "[247-her mother]

By this time [various homeward - bound individuals of diverse grades and walks of life]248-various homeward - bound individuals of diverse grades and walks of life , noticing [the small group disposing itself]249-the small group disposing itself in this fashion , hesitated for a moment to eye [them]248-various homeward - bound individuals of diverse grades and walks of life askance or paused to ascertain the character of [their]248-various homeward - bound individuals of diverse grades and walks of life work . This hesitancy , construed by [the man]240-the man apparently to constitute attention , however mobile , was seized upon by [him]240-the man and [he]240-the man began addressing [them]248-various homeward - bound individuals of diverse grades and walks of life as though [they]248-various homeward - bound individuals of diverse grades and walks of life were specifically here to hear [him]240-the man .

" Let [us]254-the other children all sing twenty - seven , then—'How Sweet the Balm of [Jesus]121-jesus ' Love . ' "[240-the man]

At this [the young girl]251-the young girl began to interpret the melody upon the organ , emitting a thin though correct strain , at the same time joining [her]251-the young girl rather high soprano with that of [[her]251-the young girl mother]247-her mother , together with the rather dubious baritone of [the father]245-the father . [The other children]254-the other children piped weakly along , [the boy]255-the boy and [girl]256-girl having taken hymn books from the small pile stacked upon the organ . As [they]254-the other children sang , [this nondescript and indifferent street audience]257-this nondescript and indifferent street audience gazed , held by the peculiarity of [such an unimportant - looking family publicly raising its collective voice against the vast skepticism and apathy of life]258-such an unimportant - looking family publicly raising its collective voice against the vast skepticism and apathy of life . [Some]259-some were interested or moved sympathetically by the rather tame and inadequate figure of [the girl]260-the girl at the organ , others by the impractical and materially inefficient texture of [the father , whose weak blue eyes and rather flabby but poorly - clothed figure]261-the father , whose weak blue eyes and rather flabby but poorly - clothed figure bespoke more of failure than anything else . Of [the group]262-the group [the mother]263-the mother alone stood out as having that force and determination which , however blind or erroneous , makes for self - preservation , if not success in life . [She]263-the mother , more than any of [the others]264-the others , stood up with an ignorant , yet somehow respectable air of conviction . If [you]265-you had watched [her]263-the mother , [her]263-the mother hymn book dropped to [her]263-the mother side , [her]263-the mother glance directed straight before [her]263-the mother into space , [you]265-you would have said : " Well , here is one who , whatever [her]263-the mother defects , probably does what [she]263-the mother believes as nearly as possible . "[265-you] A kind of hard , fighting faith in the wisdom and mercy of that definite overruling and watchful power which [she]263-the mother proclaimed , was written in [her]263-the mother every feature and gesture .

[she]263-the mother sang resonantly , if slightly nasally , between the towering walls of [the adjacent buildings]266-the adjacent buildings .

[The boy]255-the boy moved restlessly from one foot to the other , keeping [his]255-the boy eyes down , and for the most part only half singing . [A tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face — white skin , dark hair — [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face seemed more keenly observant and decidedly more sensitive than most of [the others]264-the others — appeared indeed to resent and even to suffer from the position in which [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face found [himself]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face . Plainly pagan rather than religious , life interested [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face , although as yet [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face was not fully aware of this . All that could be truly said of [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face now was that there was no definite appeal in all this for [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face . [He]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face was too young , [his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face mind much too responsive to phases of beauty and pleasure which had little , if anything , to do with the remote and cloudy romance which swayed the minds of [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father .

Indeed the home life of which [this boy]272-this boy found [himself]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face a part and the various contacts , material and psychic , which thus far had been [his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face , did not tend to convince [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face of the reality and force of all that [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father seemed so certainly to believe and say . Rather , [they]275-they seemed more or less troubled in [their]275-they lives , at least materially . [[His]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face father]276-his father was always reading the Bible and speaking in meeting at different places , especially in the " mission , "[276-his father] which [he]276-his father and [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face mother]270-his mother conducted not so far from this corner . At the same time , as [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face understood it , [they]275-they collected money from [various interested or charitably inclined business men here and there who appeared to believe in such philanthropic work]278-various interested or charitably inclined business men here and there who appeared to believe in such philanthropic work . Yet [the family]279-the family was always " hard up , "[282-mother] never very well clothed , and deprived of many comforts and pleasures which seemed common enough to [others]280-others . And [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face father]276-his father and [mother]282-mother were constantly proclaiming the love and mercy and care of [God]122-god for [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face and for all . Plainly there was something wrong somewhere . [He]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face could not get it all straight , but still [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face could not help respecting [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face mother]270-his mother , [a woman whose force and earnestness , as well as [her]270-his mother sweetness]284-a woman whose force and earnestness , as well as her sweetness , appealed to [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face . Despite much mission work and family cares , [she]270-his mother managed to be fairly cheerful , or at least sustaining , often declaring most emphatically " [God]122-god will provide "[270-his mother] or " [God]122-god will show the way , "[270-his mother] especially in times of too great stress about food or clothes . Yet apparently , in spite of this , as [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face and [all the other children]285-all the other children could see , [God]122-god did not show any very clear way , even though there was always an extreme necessity for [His]122-god favorable intervention in [their]285-all the other children affairs .

To - night , walking up [the great street]286-the great street with [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face sisters]287-his sisters and [brother]288-brother , [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face wished that [they]285-all the other children need not do this any more , or at least that [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face need not be a part of it . [Other boys]289-other boys did not do such things , and besides , somehow it seemed shabby and even degrading . On more than one occasion , before [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face had been taken on [the street]290-the street in this fashion , [other boys]289-other boys had called to [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face and made fun of [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face father]276-his father , because [he]276-his father was always publicly emphasizing [his]276-his father religious beliefs or convictions . Thus in [one neighborhood in which [they]285-all the other children had lived]293-one neighborhood in which they had lived , when [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face was but [a child of seven]294-a child of seven , [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face father]276-his father , having always preluded every conversation with " Praise [the Lord]2274-the lord , "[296-boys] [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face heard [boys]296-boys call " Here comes old Praise - [the - Lord Griffiths]2276-the - lord griffiths . "[296-boys] Or [they]296-boys would call out after [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face " Hey , [you]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face 're the fellow whose [sister plays the organ]2277-sister plays the organ . Is there anything else [she]270-his mother can play ? "[296-boys]

" What does [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face always want to go around saying , ' Praise [the Lord]2274-the lord ' for ? [Other people]2279-other people do n't do it . "[296-boys]

It was that old mass yearning for a likeness in all things that troubled [them]285-all the other children , and [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face . Neither [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face father]276-his father nor [[his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face mother]270-his mother was like [other people]2279-other people , because [they]285-all the other children were always making so much of religion , and now at last [they]285-all the other children were making a business of it .

On this night in [this great street]300-this great street with [its]300-this great street cars and crowds and [tall buildings]301-tall buildings , [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face felt ashamed , dragged out of normal life , to be made a show and jest of . [The handsome automobiles that sped by , [the loitering pedestrians]303-the loitering pedestrians moving off to what interests and comforts [he]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face could only surmise]302-the handsome automobiles that sped by , the loitering pedestrians moving off to what interests and comforts he could only surmise ; the gay pairs of [young people]304-young people , laughing and jesting and [the " kids]2280-the " kids "[2280-the " kids] staring , all troubled [him]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face with a sense of something different , better , more beautiful than [his]268-a tall and as yet slight figure , surmounted by an interesting head and face , or rather [their]285-all the other children life .

And now [units of this vagrom and unstable street throng]305-units of this vagrom and unstable street throng , which was forever shifting and changing about [them]305-units of this vagrom and unstable street throng , seemed to sense the psychologic error of all this in so far as [these children]306-these children were concerned , for [they]306-these children would nudge [one another]307-one another , [the more sophisticated and indifferent]308-the more sophisticated and indifferent lifting an eyebrow and smiling contemptuously , the more sympathetic or experienced commenting on the useless presence of [these children]306-these children .

" [I]310-a young clerk who had just met his girl and was escorting her toward a restaurant see [these people]2281-these people around [here]2282-here nearly every night now — two or three times a week , anyhow , "[310-a young clerk who had just met his girl and was escorting her toward a restaurant] this from [a young clerk who had just met [[his]310-a young clerk who had just met his girl and was escorting her toward a restaurant girl]311-his girl and was escorting [her]311-his girl toward [a restaurant]312-a restaurant]310-a young clerk who had just met his girl and was escorting her toward a restaurant . "[310-a young clerk who had just met his girl and was escorting her toward a restaurant]

" [That oldest boy]2283-that oldest boy do n't wanta be [here]2282-here . [He]2283-that oldest boy feels outa place , [I]313-an idler and loafer of about forty can see that . "[313-an idler and loafer of about forty] This from [an idler and loafer of about forty]313-an idler and loafer of about forty , [one of [those odd hangers - on]315-those odd hangers - on about [the commercial heart of [a city]317-a city]316-the commercial heart of a city]314-one of those odd hangers - on about the commercial heart of a city , addressing [a pausing and seemingly amiable stranger]318-a pausing and seemingly amiable stranger .

" [Yeh]2286-yeh , [I]319-the other guess that 's so , "[319-the other] [the other]319-the other assented , taking in the peculiar cast of [the boy]255-the boy 's head and face . In view of the uneasy and self - conscious expression upon the face whenever it was lifted , one might have intelligently suggested that it was a little unkind as well as idle to thus publicly force upon a temperament as yet unfitted to absorb [their]321-their import , religious and psychic services best suited to reflective temperaments of maturer years .

Yet so it was .

As for [the remainder of [the family]279-the family]322-the remainder of the family , both [the youngest girl]324-the youngest girl and [boy]325-boy were too small to really understand much of what it was all about or to care . [The eldest girl at the organ]326-the eldest girl at the organ appeared not so much to mind , as to enjoy the attention and comment [her]326-the eldest girl at the organ presence and singing evoked , for more than once , not only [strangers]327-strangers , but [[her]326-the eldest girl at the organ mother]247-her mother and [father]271-father , had assured [her]326-the eldest girl at the organ that [she]326-the eldest girl at the organ had an appealing and compelling voice , which was only partially true . It was not a good voice . [They]321-their did not really understand music . Physically , [she]326-the eldest girl at the organ was of [a pale , emasculate and unimportant structure , with no real mental force or depth]330-a pale , emasculate and unimportant structure , with no real mental force or depth , and was easily made to feel that this was an excellent field in which to distinguish [herself]326-the eldest girl at the organ and attract a little attention . As for [the parents]331-the parents , [they]331-the parents were determined upon spiritualizing [the world]332-the world as much as possible , and , once the hymn was concluded , [the father]245-the father launched into one of those hackneyed descriptions of the delights of a release , via self - realization of the mercy of [God]122-god and the love of [Christ]123-christ and the will of [God]122-god toward [sinners]334-sinners , from the burdensome cares of an evil conscience .

" [All men]2287-all men are [sinners]334-sinners in the light of [the Lord]2274-the lord , "[245-the father] [he]245-the father declared . " Unless [they]2287-all men repent , unless [they]2287-all men accept [Christ]123-christ , [His]123-christ love and forgiveness of [them]2287-all men , [they]2287-all men can never know the happiness of being spiritually whole and clean . Oh , [[my]245-the father friends]2290-my friends ! If [you]2290-my friends could but know the peace and content that comes with the knowledge , the inward understanding , that [Christ]123-christ lived and died for [you]2290-my friends and that [He]123-christ walks with [you]2290-my friends every day and hour , by light and by dark , at dawn and at dusk , to keep and strengthen [you]2290-my friends for the tasks and cares of [the world]332-the world that are ever before [you]2290-my friends . Oh , the snares and pitfalls that beset [us]2292-us all ! And then the soothing realization that [Christ]123-christ is ever with [us]2292-us , to counsel , to aid , to hearten , to bind up [our]2292-us wounds and make [us]2292-us whole ! Oh , the peace , the satisfaction , the comfort , the glory of that ! "[245-the father]

" Amen ! "[336-his wife] asseverated [[his]335-his wife]336-his wife , and [the daughter]337-the daughter , [Hester]120-hester , or [Esta]124-esta , as [she]337-the daughter was called by [the family]279-the family , moved by the need of as much public support as possible for [all of [them]339-all of them]339-all of them — echoed it after [her]337-the daughter .

[Clyde]149-clyde , [the eldest boy]340-the eldest boy , and [the two younger children]341-the two younger children merely gazed at the ground , or occasionally at [[their]341-the two younger children father]342-their father , with a feeling that possibly it was all true and important , yet somehow not as significant or inviting as some of the other things which life held . [They]339-all of them heard so much of this , and to [their]339-all of them young and eager minds life was made for something more than [street]343-street and [mission hall]344-mission hall protestations of this sort .

Finally , after a second hymn and an address by [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths , during which [she]126-mrs. griffiths took occasion to refer to the mission work jointly conducted by [them]339-all of them in [a near - by street]345-a near - by street , and [their]339-all of them services to the cause of [Christ]123-christ in general , a third hymn was indulged in , and then some tracts describing the mission rescue work being distributed , such voluntary gifts as were forthcoming were taken up by [Asa]127-asa — [the father]245-the father . The small organ was closed , the camp chair folded up and given to [Clyde]149-clyde , the Bible and hymn books picked up by [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths , and with the organ supported by a leather strap passed over the shoulder of [Griffiths]149-clyde , senior , the missionward march was taken up .

During all this time [Clyde]149-clyde was saying to [himself]149-clyde that [he]149-clyde did not wish to do this any more , that [he]149-clyde and [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents looked foolish and less than normal—"cheap "[149-clyde] was the word [he]149-clyde would have used if [he]149-clyde could have brought [himself]149-clyde to express [his]149-clyde full measure of resentment at being compelled to participate in this way — and that [he]149-clyde would not do it any more if [he]149-clyde could help . What good did it do [them]347-his parents to have [him]149-clyde along ? [His]149-clyde life should not be like this . [Other boys]289-other boys did not have to do as [he]149-clyde did . [He]149-clyde meditated now more determinedly than ever a rebellion by which [he]149-clyde would rid [himself]149-clyde of the need of going out in this way . Let [[his]149-clyde elder sister]349-his elder sister go if [she]349-his elder sister chose ; [she]349-his elder sister liked it . [[His]149-clyde younger sister]350-his younger sister and [brother]288-brother might be too young to care . But [he]149-clyde —

" [They]353-they seemed a little more attentive than usual to - night , [I]149-clyde thought , "[149-clyde] commented [Griffiths]149-clyde to [[his]149-clyde wife]336-his wife as [they]353-they walked along , the seductive quality of the summer evening air softening [him]149-clyde into a more generous interpretation of the customary indifferent spirit of [the passer - by]354-the passer - by .

" Yes ; twenty - seven took tracts to - night as against eighteen on Thursday . "[149-clyde]

" The love of [Christ]123-christ must eventually prevail , "[245-the father] comforted [the father]245-the father , as much to hearten [himself]245-the father as [[his]245-the father wife]336-his wife . " The pleasures and cares of [the world]332-the world hold a very great many , but when sorrow overtakes them , then some of these seeds will take root . "[245-the father]

" [I]149-clyde am sure of it . That is the thought which always keeps [me]149-clyde up . Sorrow and the weight of sin eventually bring some of [them]353-they to see the error of [their]353-they way . "[149-clyde]

[They]353-they now entered into [the narrow side street from which [they]353-they had emerged and walking as many as a dozen doors from the corner]357-the narrow side street from which they had emerged and walking as many as a dozen doors from the corner , entered the door of [a yellow single - story wooden building]358-a yellow single - story wooden building , the large window and the two glass panes in the central door of which had been painted a gray - white . Across both windows and the smaller panels in the double door had been painted : " [The Door of Hope]2294-the door of hope . [Bethel Independent Mission]0-bethel independent mission . Meetings Every Wednesday and Saturday night , 8 to 10 . Sundays at 11 , 3 and 8 . Everybody Welcome . "[359-the small company] Under this legend on each window were printed the words : " [God]122-god is Love , "[359-the small company] and below this again , in smaller type : " How Long Since [You]149-clyde Wrote to [Mother]128-mother ? "[359-the small company]

[The small company]359-the small company entered the yellow unprepossessing door and disappeared .

That [such a family]360-such a family , thus cursorily presented , might have a different and somewhat peculiar history could well be anticipated , and it would be true . Indeed , this one presented one of those anomalies of psychic and social reflex and motivation such as would tax the skill of not only [the psychologist]361-the psychologist but [the chemist and physicist]362-the chemist and physicist as well , to unravel . To begin with , [Asa Griffiths]127-asa , [the father]245-the father , was one of those poorly integrated and correlated organisms , the product of an environment and a religious theory , but with no guiding or mental insight of [his]127-asa own , yet sensitive and therefore highly emotional and without any practical sense whatsoever . Indeed it would be hard to make clear just how life appealed to [him]127-asa , or what the true hue of [his]127-asa emotional responses was . On the other hand , as has been indicated , [[his]127-asa wife]336-his wife was of a firmer texture but with scarcely any truer or more practical insight into anything .

The history of [this man]365-this man and [[his]127-asa wife]336-his wife is of no particular interest here save as it affected [[their]367-their boy of twelve]368-their boy of twelve , [Clyde Griffiths]149-clyde . [This youth]369-this youth , aside from a certain emotionalism and exotic sense of romance which characterized [him]369-this youth , and which [he]369-this youth took more from [[his]369-this youth father]276-his father than from [[his]369-this youth mother]270-his mother , brought a more vivid and intelligent imagination to things , and was constantly thinking of how [he]369-this youth might better [himself]369-this youth , if [he]369-this youth had a chance ; places to which [he]369-this youth might go , things [he]369-this youth might see , and how differently [he]369-this youth might live , if only this , that and the other things were true . The principal thing that troubled [Clyde]149-clyde up to [his]149-clyde fifteenth year , and for long after in retrospect , was that the calling or profession of [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents was the shabby thing that it appeared to be in the eyes of [others]280-others . For so often throughout [his]149-clyde youth in [different cities]374-different cities in which [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents had conducted a mission or spoken on [the streets]376-the streets — [Grand Rapids]1-grand rapids , [Detroit]2-detroit , [Milwaukee]3-milwaukee , [Chicago]4-chicago , lastly [Kansas City]5-kansas city — it had been obvious that [people]377-people , at least [the boys and [girls]379-girls [he]149-clyde encountered]378-the boys and girls he encountered , looked down upon [him]149-clyde and [[his]149-clyde brothers]380-his brothers and [sisters]381-sisters for being [the children of [such parents]383-such parents]382-the children of such parents . On several occasions , and much against the mood of [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , who never countenanced such exhibitions of temper , [he]149-clyde had stopped to fight with [one or another of [these boys]386-these boys]385-one or another of these boys . But always , beaten or victorious , [he]149-clyde had been conscious of the fact that the work [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents did was not satisfactory to others,—shabby , trivial . And always [he]149-clyde was thinking of what [he]149-clyde would do , once [he]149-clyde reached the place where [he]149-clyde could get away .

For [[Clyde]149-clyde 's parents]388-clyde 's parents had proved impractical in the matter of the future of [[their]388-clyde 's parents children]389-their children . [They]388-clyde 's parents did not understand the importance or the essential necessity for some form of practical or professional training for each and [every one of [[their]388-clyde 's parents young ones]391-their young ones]390-every one of their young ones . Instead , being wrapped up in the notion of evangelizing [the world]332-the world , [they]388-clyde 's parents had neglected to keep [[their]388-clyde 's parents children]389-their children in school in [any one place]394-any one place . [They]388-clyde 's parents had moved here and there , sometimes in the very midst of an advantageous school season , because of a larger and better religious field in which to work . And there were times , when , the work proving highly unprofitable and [Asa]127-asa being unable to make much money at the two things [he]127-asa most understood — gardening and canvassing for one invention or another — [they]388-clyde 's parents were quite without sufficient food or decent clothes , and [the children]395-the children could not go to [school]396-school . In the face of such situations as these , whatever [the children]395-the children might think , [Asa]127-asa and [[his]127-asa wife]336-his wife remained as optimistic as ever , or [they]388-clyde 's parents insisted to [themselves]388-clyde 's parents that [they]388-clyde 's parents were , and had unwavering faith in [the Lord]399-the lord and [His]399-the lord intention to provide .

[The combination home]400-the combination home and mission which [this family]401-this family occupied was dreary enough in most of [its]401-this family phases to discourage [the average youth]402-the average youth or [girl of any spirit]403-girl of any spirit . [It]401-this family consisted in [its]401-this family entirety of one long store floor in [an old and decidedly colorless and inartistic wooden building which was situated in that part of [Kansas City]5-kansas city which lies north of [Independence Boulevard]6-independence boulevard and west of [Troost Avenue]7-troost avenue]404-an old and decidedly colorless and inartistic wooden building which was situated in that part of kansas city which lies north of independence boulevard and west of troost avenue , [the exact street or place being called [Bickel]8-bickel]405-the exact street or place being called bickel , [a very short thoroughfare opening off [Missouri Avenue]9-missouri avenue]406-a very short thoroughfare opening off missouri avenue , [a somewhat more lengthy but no less nondescript highway]407-a somewhat more lengthy but no less nondescript highway . And [the entire neighborhood in which [it]404-an old and decidedly colorless and inartistic wooden building which was situated in that part of kansas city which lies north of independence boulevard and west of troost avenue stood]408-the entire neighborhood in which it stood was very faintly and yet not agreeably redolent of a commercial life which had long since moved farther [south , if not west]409-south , if not west . [It]410-it was some five blocks from the spot on which twice a week the open air meetings of [these religious enthusiasts]411-these religious enthusiasts and proselytizers were held .

And it was [the ground floor of [this building]413-this building]412-the ground floor of this building , looking out into [Bickel Street]10-bickel street at the front and [some dreary back yards of [equally dreary frame houses]415-equally dreary frame houses]414-some dreary back yards of equally dreary frame houses , which was divided at the front into [a hall forty by twenty - five feet in size , in which had been placed some sixty collapsible wood chairs , a lectern , a map of [Palestine]11-palestine or [the Holy Land]12-the holy land]416-a hall forty by twenty - five feet in size , in which had been placed some sixty collapsible wood chairs , a lectern , a map of palestine or the holy land , and for wall decorations some twenty - five printed but unframed mottoes which read in part .

These mighty adjurations were as silver and gold plates set in a wall of dross .

The rear forty feet of this very commonplace floor was intricately and yet neatly divided into [three small bedrooms]417-three small bedrooms , [a living room which overlooked [the backyard]419-the backyard and wooden fences of [yards no better than those at the back]420-yards no better than those at the back]418-a living room which overlooked the backyard and wooden fences of yards no better than those at the back ; also , [a combination kitchen]421-a combination kitchen and [dining room]422-dining room exactly ten feet square , and [a store room for mission tracts]423-a store room for mission tracts , hymnals , boxes , trunks and whatever else of non - immediate use , but of assumed value , which [the family]279-the family owned . [This particular small room]425-this particular small room lay immediately to the rear of [the mission hall itself]426-the mission hall itself , and into [it]426-the mission hall itself before or after speaking or at such times as a conference seemed important , both [Mr.]427-mr. and [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths were wo nt to retire — also at times to meditate or pray .

How often had [Clyde]149-clyde and [[his]149-clyde sisters]287-his sisters and [younger brother]429-younger brother seen [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother or [father]271-father , or both , in conference with [some derelict or semi - repentant soul who had come for advice or aid , most usually for aid]432-some derelict or semi - repentant soul who had come for advice or aid , most usually for aid . And here at times , when [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother 's and [father]271-father 's financial difficulties were greatest , [they]435-they were to be found thinking , or as [Asa Griffiths]127-asa was wo nt helplessly to say at times , " praying [their]435-they way out , "[127-asa] a rather ineffectual way , as [Clyde]149-clyde began to think later .

And [the whole neighborhood]436-the whole neighborhood was so dreary and run - down that [he]149-clyde hated the thought of living in [it]436-the whole neighborhood , let alone being part of a work that required constant appeals for aid , as well as constant prayer and thanksgiving to sustain it .

[Mrs. Elvira Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths before [she]126-mrs. griffiths had married [Asa]127-asa had been nothing but [an ignorant farm girl , brought up without much thought of religion of any kind]437-an ignorant farm girl , brought up without much thought of religion of any kind . But having fallen in love with [him]127-asa , [she]126-mrs. griffiths had become inoculated with the virus of Evangelism and proselytizing which dominated [him]127-asa , and had followed [him]127-asa gladly and enthusiastically in all of [his]127-asa ventures and through all of [his]127-asa vagaries . Being rather flattered by the knowledge that [she]126-mrs. griffiths could speak and sing , [her]126-mrs. griffiths ability to sway and persuade and control [people]377-people with the " word of [God]122-god , "[126-mrs. griffiths] as [she]126-mrs. griffiths saw it , [she]126-mrs. griffiths had become more or less pleased with [herself]126-mrs. griffiths on this account and so persuaded to continue .

Occasionally [a small band of [people]377-people]439-a small band of people followed [the preachers]441-the preachers to [[their]441-the preachers mission]442-their mission , or learning of [its]442-their mission existence through [their]441-the preachers street work , appeared [there]443-there later — [those odd and mentally disturbed or distrait souls who are to be found in [every place]445-every place]444-those odd and mentally disturbed or distrait souls who are to be found in every place . And it had been [Clyde]149-clyde 's compulsory duty throughout the years when [he]149-clyde could not act for [himself]149-clyde to be in attendance at these various meetings . And always [he]149-clyde had been more irritated than favorably influenced by [the types of [men]447-men and women who came [here]2282-here]446-the types of men and women who came here — mostly [men — down - and - out laborers]449-men — down - and - out laborers , [loafers]450-loafers , [drunkards]451-drunkards , [wastrels]452-wastrels , [the botched and helpless who seemed to drift in]453-the botched and helpless who seemed to drift in , because [they]446-the types of men and women who came here had no other place to go . And [they]446-the types of men and women who came here were always testifying as to how [God]122-god or [Christ]123-christ or [Divine Grace]129-divine grace had rescued [them]446-the types of men and women who came here from this or that predicament — never how [they]446-the types of men and women who came here had rescued [any one else]454-any one else . And always [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father and [mother]282-mother were saying " Amen "[282-mother] and " Glory to [God]122-god , "[282-mother] and singing hymns and afterward taking up a collection for the legitimate expenses of [the hall]457-the hall — collections which , as [he]149-clyde surmised , were little enough — barely enough to keep the various missions [they]446-the types of men and women who came here had conducted in existence .

The one thing that really interested [him]149-clyde in connection with [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents was the existence somewhere in [the east]459-the east — in [a small city called [Lycurgus]13-lycurgus , near [Utica]14-utica [he]149-clyde understood]460-a small city called lycurgus , near utica he understood — of [an uncle]461-an uncle , [a brother of [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father 's , who was plainly different from all this]462-a brother of his father 's , who was plainly different from all this . [That uncle]464-that uncle — [Samuel Griffiths]130-samuel griffiths by name — was rich . In one way and another , from casual remarks dropped by [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , [Clyde]149-clyde had heard references to certain things [this particular uncle]466-this particular uncle might do for [a person]467-a person , if [he]466-this particular uncle but would ; references to the fact that [he]466-this particular uncle was [a shrewd , hard business man]468-a shrewd , hard business man ; that [he]466-this particular uncle had [a great house]469-a great house and [a large factory in [Lycurgus]13-lycurgus]470-a large factory in lycurgus for the manufacture of collars and shirts , which employed [not less than three hundred people]471-not less than three hundred people ; that [he]466-this particular uncle had [a son]472-a son who must be about [Clyde]149-clyde 's age , and [several daughters]473-several daughters , two at least , all of whom must be , as [Clyde]149-clyde imagined , living in luxury in [Lycurgus]13-lycurgus . News of all this had apparently been brought west in some way by [people who knew [Asa]127-asa and [[his]127-asa father]276-his father and [brother]288-brother]474-people who knew asa and his father and brother . As [Clyde]149-clyde pictured [this uncle]477-this uncle , [he]466-this particular uncle must be [a kind of Croesus , living in ease and luxury there in [the east]459-the east]478-a kind of croesus , living in ease and luxury there in the east , while here in [the west]480-the west — [Kansas City]5-kansas city — [he]149-clyde and [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents and [[his]149-clyde brother]482-his brother and [sisters]381-sisters were living in the same wretched and hum - drum , hand - to - mouth state that had always characterized [their]484-their lives .

But for this — apart from anything [he]149-clyde might do for [himself]149-clyde , as [he]149-clyde early began to see — there was no remedy . For at fifteen , and even a little earlier , [Clyde]149-clyde began to understand that [his]149-clyde education , as well as [[his]149-clyde sisters]287-his sisters ' and [brother]288-brother 's , had been sadly neglected . And it would be rather hard for [him]149-clyde to overcome this handicap , seeing that [other boys]289-other boys and girls with more money and [better homes]488-better homes were being trained for special kinds of work . How was [one]489-one to get a start under such circumstances ? Already when , at the age of thirteen , fourteen and fifteen , [he]149-clyde began looking in the papers , which , being too worldly , had never been admitted to [[his]149-clyde home]490-his home , [he]149-clyde found that mostly skilled help was wanted , or [boys]296-boys to learn trades in which at the moment [he]149-clyde was not very much interested . For true to the standard of [the American youth]492-the american youth , or the general American attitude toward life , [he]149-clyde felt [himself]149-clyde above the type of labor which was purely manual . What ! Run a machine , lay bricks , learn to be [a carpenter]493-a carpenter , or [a plasterer]494-a plasterer , or [plumber]495-plumber , when [[boys]296-boys no better than [himself]149-clyde]497-boys no better than himself were [clerks]498-clerks and [[druggists]499-druggists ' assistants]500-druggists ' assistants and [bookkeepers]501-bookkeepers and [assistants]502-assistants in banks and [real estate offices]503-real estate offices and such ! Was n't it menial , as miserable as the life [he]149-clyde had thus far been leading , to wear old clothes and get up so early in the morning and do all the commonplace things [such people]504-such people had to do ?

For [Clyde]149-clyde was as vain and proud as [he]149-clyde was poor . [He]149-clyde was [one of those interesting individuals who looked upon [himself]149-clyde as a thing apart — never quite wholly and indissolubly merged with [the family of which [he]149-clyde was a member]506-the family of which he was a member , and never with any profound obligations to [those who had been responsible for [his]149-clyde coming into [the world]332-the world]507-those who had been responsible for his coming into the world]505-one of those interesting individuals who looked upon himself as a thing apart — never quite wholly and indissolubly merged with the family of which he was a member , and never with any profound obligations to those who had been responsible for his coming into the world . On the contrary , [he]149-clyde was inclined to study [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , not too sharply or bitterly , but with a very fair grasp of [their]347-his parents qualities and capabilities . And yet , with so much judgment in that direction , [he]149-clyde was never quite able — at least not until [he]149-clyde had reached [his]149-clyde sixteenth year — to formulate any policy in regard to [himself]149-clyde , and then only in a rather fumbling and tentative way .

Incidentally by that time the sex lure or appeal had begun to manifest itself and [he]149-clyde was already intensely interested and troubled by the beauty of the opposite sex , its attractions for [him]149-clyde and [his]149-clyde attraction for it . And , naturally and coincidentally , the matter of [his]149-clyde clothes and [his]149-clyde physical appearance had begun to trouble [him]149-clyde not a little — how [he]149-clyde looked and how [other boys]289-other boys looked . It was painful to [him]149-clyde now to think that [his]149-clyde clothes were not right ; that [he]149-clyde was not as handsome as [he]149-clyde might be , not as interesting . What a wretched thing it was to be born poor and not to have [any one]511-any one to do anything for [you]512-you and not to be able to do so very much for [yourself]512-you !

Casual examination of [himself]149-clyde in mirrors whenever [he]149-clyde found [them]513-them tended rather to assure [him]149-clyde that [he]149-clyde was not so bad - looking — a straight , well - cut nose , high white forehead , wavy , glossy , black hair , eyes that were black and rather melancholy at times . And yet the fact that [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family was the unhappy thing that it was , that [he]149-clyde had never had [any real friends]515-any real friends , and could not have any , as [he]149-clyde saw it , because of the work and connection of [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , was now tending more and more to induce a kind of mental depression or melancholia which promised not so well for [his]149-clyde future . It served to make [him]149-clyde rebellious and hence lethargic at times . Because of [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , and in spite of [his]149-clyde looks , which were really agreeable and more appealing than most , [he]149-clyde was inclined to misinterpret the interested looks which were cast at [him]149-clyde occasionally by [young girls in very different walks of life]518-young girls in very different walks of life from [him]149-clyde — the contemptuous and yet rather inviting way in which [they]518-young girls in very different walks of life looked to see if [he]149-clyde were interested or disinterested , brave or cowardly .

And yet , before [he]149-clyde had ever earned any money at all , [he]149-clyde had always told [himself]149-clyde that if only [he]149-clyde had a better collar , a nicer shirt , finer shoes , a good suit , a swell overcoat like [some boys]519-some boys had ! Oh , the fine clothes , [the handsome homes]520-the handsome homes , the watches , rings , pins that [some boys]519-some boys sported ; [the dandies many youths of [his]149-clyde years]522-the dandies many youths of his years already were ! [Some parents of [boys of]524-boys of [his]149-clyde years]523-some parents of boys of his years actually gave [them]523-some parents of boys of his years cars of [their]523-some parents of boys of his years own to ride in . [They]523-some parents of boys of his years were to be seen upon [the principal streets of [Kansas City]5-kansas city]525-the principal streets of kansas city flitting to and fro like flies . And [pretty girls]526-pretty girls with [them]523-some parents of boys of his years . And [he]149-clyde had nothing . And [he]149-clyde never had had .

And yet [the world]332-the world was so full of so many things to do — [so many people]528-so many people were so happy and so successful . What was [he]149-clyde to do ? Which way to turn ? What one thing to take up and master — something that would get [him]149-clyde somewhere . [He]149-clyde could not say . [He]149-clyde did not know exactly . And [these peculiar parents]529-these peculiar parents were in no way sufficiently equipped to advise [him]149-clyde .

One of the things that served to darken [Clyde]149-clyde 's mood just about the time when [he]149-clyde was seeking some practical solution for [himself]149-clyde , to say nothing of its profoundly disheartening effect on [the Griffiths family as a whole]530-the griffiths family as a whole , was the fact that [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister [Esta]124-esta , in whom [he]149-clyde took no little interest ( although [they]532-they really had very little in common ) , ran away from [home]533-home with [an actor who happened to be playing in [Kansas City]5-kansas city and who took a passing fancy for [her]124-esta]534-an actor who happened to be playing in kansas city and who took a passing fancy for her .

The truth in regard to [Esta]124-esta was that in spite of [her]124-esta guarded up - bringing , and the seeming religious and moral fervor which at times appeared to characterize [her]124-esta , [she]124-esta was just [a sensuous , weak girl who did not by any means know yet what [she]124-esta thought]535-a sensuous , weak girl who did not by any means know yet what she thought . Despite the atmosphere in which [she]124-esta moved , essentially [she]124-esta was not of it . Like [the large majority of [those who profess and daily repeat the dogmas and creeds of]537-those who profess and daily repeat the dogmas and creeds of [the world]332-the world]536-the large majority of those who profess and daily repeat the dogmas and creeds of the world , [she]124-esta had come into [her]124-esta practices and imagined attitude so insensibly from [her]124-esta earliest childhood on , that up to this time , and even later , [she]124-esta did not know the meaning of it all . For the necessity of thought had been obviated by advice and law , or " revealed "[539-they] truth , and so long as other theories or situations and impulses of an external or even internal , character did not arise to clash with these , [she]124-esta was safe enough . Once [they]539-they did , however , it was a foregone conclusion that [her]124-esta religious notions , not being grounded on any conviction or temperamental bias of [her]124-esta own , were not likely to withstand the shock . So that all the while , and not unlike [[her]124-esta brother]540-her brother [Clyde]149-clyde , [her]124-esta thoughts as well as [her]124-esta emotions were wandering here and there — to love , to comfort — to things which in the main had little , if anything , to do with any self - abnegating and self - immolating religious theory . Within [her]124-esta was a chemism of dreams which somehow counteracted all they had to say .

Yet [she]124-esta had neither [Clyde]149-clyde 's force , nor , on the other hand , [his]149-clyde resistance . [She]124-esta was in the main [a drifter , with a vague yearning toward pretty dresses , hats , shoes , ribbons and the like]541-a drifter , with a vague yearning toward pretty dresses , hats , shoes , ribbons and the like , and super - imposed above this , the religious theory or notion that [she]124-esta should not be . There were the long bright streets of a morning and afternoon after [school]396-school or of an evening . The charm of [certain girls swinging along together]543-certain girls swinging along together , arms locked , secrets a - whispering , or that of [boys]296-boys , clownish , yet revealing through [their]539-they bounding ridiculous animality the force and meaning of that chemistry and urge toward mating which lies back of all youthful thought and action . And in [herself]124-esta , as from time to time [she]124-esta observed [lovers]545-lovers or [flirtation - seekers who lingered at [street corners]547-street corners or about doorways , and who looked at [her]124-esta in a longing and seeking way , there was a stirring , a nerve plasm palpitation that spoke loudly for all the seemingly material things of life , not for the thin pleasantries of heaven]546-flirtation - seekers who lingered at street corners or about doorways , and who looked at her in a longing and seeking way , there was a stirring , a nerve plasm palpitation that spoke loudly for all the seemingly material things of life , not for the thin pleasantries of heaven .

And the glances drilled [her]124-esta like an invisible ray , for [she]124-esta was pleasing to look at and was growing more attractive hourly . And the moods in others awakened responsive moods in [her]124-esta , those rearranging chemisms upon which all the morality or immorality of [the world]332-the world is based .

And then one day , as [she]124-esta was coming [home]533-home from [school]396-school , [a youth of that plausible variety known as " masher "]2295-a youth of that plausible variety known as " masher "[2295-a youth of that plausible variety known as " masher "] engaged [her]124-esta in conversation , largely because of a look and a mood which seemed to invite it . And there was little to stay [her]124-esta , for [she]124-esta was essentially yielding , if not amorous . Yet so great had been [[her]124-esta home]551-her home drilling as to the need of modesty , circumspection , purity and the like , that on this occasion at least there was no danger of any immediate lapse . Only this attack once made , others followed , were accepted , or not so quickly fled from , and by degrees , these served to break down that wall of reserve which [[her]124-esta home training]552-her home training had served to erect . [She]124-esta became secretive and hid [her]124-esta ways from [[her]124-esta parents]553-her parents .

[Youths]131-youths occasionally walked and talked with [her]124-esta in spite of [herself]124-esta . [They]131-youths demolished that excessive shyness which had been [hers]124-esta , and which had served to put [others]280-others aside for a time at least . [She]124-esta wished for other contacts — dreamed of [some bright , gay , wonderful love of some kind , with some one]555-some bright , gay , wonderful love of some kind , with some one .

Finally , after a slow but vigorous internal growth of mood and desire , there came [this actor]556-this actor , one of [those vain , handsome , animal personalities , all clothes and airs , but no morals ( no taste , no courtesy or real tenderness even )]557-those vain , handsome , animal personalities , all clothes and airs , but no morals ( no taste , no courtesy or real tenderness even ) , but of compelling magnetism , who was able within the space of one brief week and a few meetings to completely befuddle and enmesh [her]124-esta so that [she]124-esta was really [his]556-this actor to do with as [he]556-this actor wished . And the truth was that [he]556-this actor scarcely cared for [her]124-esta at all . To [him]556-this actor , dull as [he]556-this actor was , [she]124-esta was [just another girl — fairly pretty , obviously sensuous and inexperienced , [a silly who could be taken by a few soft words — a show of seemingly sincere affection]559-a silly who could be taken by a few soft words — a show of seemingly sincere affection , talk of the opportunity of a broader , freer life on the road , in [other great cities]560-other great cities , as [[his]556-this actor wife]336-his wife]558-just another girl — fairly pretty , obviously sensuous and inexperienced , a silly who could be taken by a few soft words — a show of seemingly sincere affection , talk of the opportunity of a broader , freer life on the road , in other great cities , as his wife .

And yet [his]556-this actor words were those of [a lover who would be true forever]562-a lover who would be true forever . All [she]124-esta had to do , as [he]556-this actor explained to [her]124-esta , was to come away with [him]556-this actor and be [[his]556-this actor bride]563-his bride , at once — now . [Delay]132-delay was so vain when two such as [they]564-they had met . There was difficulty about marriage here , which [he]556-this actor could not explain — it related to [friends]565-friends — but in [St. Louis]15-st. louis [he]556-this actor had [a preacher friend who would [we]567-we d [them]568-them]566-a preacher friend who would we d them . [She]124-esta was to have new and better clothes than [she]124-esta had ever known , delicious adventures , love . [She]124-esta would travel with [him]556-this actor and see [the great world]569-the great world . [She]124-esta would never need to trouble more about anything save [him]556-this actor ; and while it was truth to [her]124-esta — the verbal surety of a genuine passion — to [him]556-this actor it was the most ancient and serviceable type of blarney , often used before and often successful .

In a single week then , at odd hours , morning , afternoon and night , this chemic witchery was accomplished .

Coming [home]533-home rather late one Saturday night in April from a walk which [he]556-this actor had taken about the business heart , in order to escape the regular Saturday night mission services , [Clyde]149-clyde found [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father worried about the whereabouts of [Esta]124-esta . [She]124-esta had played and sung as usual at this meeting . And all had seemed all right with [her]124-esta . After the meeting [she]124-esta had gone to [[her]124-esta room]573-her room , saying that [she]124-esta was not feeling very well and was going to bed early . But by eleven o'clock , when [Clyde]149-clyde returned , [[her]124-esta mother]247-her mother had chanced to look into [[her]124-esta room]573-her room and discovered that [she]124-esta was not there nor anywhere about [the place]576-the place . A certain bareness in connection with [the room]577-the room — some trinkets and dresses removed , an old and familiar suitcase gone — had first attracted [[her]124-esta mother]247-her mother 's attention . Then the house search proving that [she]124-esta was not [there]443-there , [Asa]127-asa had gone outside to look up and down [the street]290-the street . [She]124-esta sometimes walked out alone , or sat or stood in front of [the mission]581-the mission during its idle or closed hours .

This search revealing nothing , [Clyde]149-clyde and [he]149-clyde had walked to a corner , then along [Missouri Avenue]9-missouri avenue . [No Esta]124-esta . At twelve [they]582-they returned and after that , naturally , the curiosity in regard to [her]124-esta grew momentarily sharper .

At first [they]582-they assumed that [she]124-esta might have taken an unexplained walk somewhere , but as twelve - thirty , and finally one , and one - thirty , passed , and no Esta , [they]582-they were about to notify [the police]583-the police , when [Clyde]149-clyde , going into [[her]124-esta room]573-her room , saw a note pinned to the pillow of [her]124-esta small wooden bed — a missive that had escaped the eye of [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother . At once [he]149-clyde went to it , curious and comprehending , for [he]149-clyde had often wondered in what way , assuming that [he]149-clyde ever wished to depart surreptitiously , [he]149-clyde would notify [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , for [he]149-clyde knew [they]347-his parents would never countenance [his]149-clyde departure unless [they]347-his parents were permitted to supervise it in every detail . And now here was [Esta]124-esta missing , and here was undoubtedly some such communication as [he]149-clyde might have left . [He]149-clyde picked it up , eager to read it , but at that moment [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother came into [the room]577-the room and , seeing it in [his]149-clyde hand , exclaimed : " What 's that ? A note ? Is it from [her]270-his mother ? "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde surrendered it and [she]270-his mother unfolded it , reading it quickly . [He]149-clyde noted that [her]270-his mother strong broad face , always tanned a reddish brown , blanched as [she]270-his mother turned away toward [the outer room]589-the outer room . [Her]270-his mother biggish mouth was now set in a firm , straight line . [Her]270-his mother large , strong hand shook the least bit as it held the small note aloft .

" [Asa]127-asa ! "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother called , and then tramping into [the next room where [he]149-clyde was]590-the next room where he was , [his]149-clyde frizzled grayish hair curling distractedly above [his]149-clyde round head , [she]270-his mother said : " Read this . "[270-his mother]

[Clyde]149-clyde , who had followed , saw [him]149-clyde take it a little nervously in [his]149-clyde pudgy hands , [his]149-clyde lips , always weak and beginning to crinkle at the center with age , now working curiously . [Any one who had known [his]149-clyde life 's history]591-any one who had known his life 's history would have said it was the expression , slightly emphasized , with which [he]149-clyde had received most of the untoward blows of [his]149-clyde life in the past .

" Tst ! Tst ! Tst ! "[149-clyde] was the only sound [he]149-clyde made at first , a sucking sound of the tongue and palate — most weak and inadequate , it seemed to [Clyde]149-clyde . Next there was another " Tst ! Tst ! Tst ! "[149-clyde] , [his]149-clyde head beginning to shake from side to side . Then , " Now , what do [you]126-mrs. griffiths suppose could have caused [her]336-his wife to do that ? "[149-clyde] Then [he]149-clyde turned and gazed at [[his]149-clyde wife]336-his wife , who gazed blankly in return . Tst ! Tst ! "[149-clyde]

Always the more impressive , [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths now showed [herself]126-mrs. griffiths markedly different and more vital in this trying situation , a kind of irritation or dissatisfaction with life itself , along with an obvious physical distress , seeming to pass through [her]126-mrs. griffiths like a visible shadow . Once [[her]126-mrs. griffiths husband]593-her husband had gotten up , [she]126-mrs. griffiths reached out and took the note , then merely glared at it again , [her]126-mrs. griffiths face set in hard yet stricken and disturbing lines . [Her]126-mrs. griffiths manner was that of one who is intensely disquieted and dissatisfied , [one who fingers savagely at a material knot and yet can not undo it]594-one who fingers savagely at a material knot and yet can not undo it , [one who seeks restraint and freedom from complaint and yet who would complain bitterly , angrily]595-one who seeks restraint and freedom from complaint and yet who would complain bitterly , angrily . For behind [her]126-mrs. griffiths were all those years of religious work and faith , which somehow , in [her]126-mrs. griffiths poorly integrated conscience , seemed dimly to indicate that [she]126-mrs. griffiths should justly have been spared this . Where was [[her]126-mrs. griffiths God]596-her god , [[her]126-mrs. griffiths Christ]597-her christ , at this hour when this obvious evil was being done ? Why had [He]149-clyde not acted for [her]126-mrs. griffiths ? How was [He]149-clyde to explain this ? [His]149-clyde Biblical promises ! [His]149-clyde perpetual guidance ! [His]149-clyde declared mercies !

In the face of so great a calamity , it was very hard for [her]126-mrs. griffiths , as [Clyde]149-clyde could see , to get this straightened out , instantly at least . Although , as [Clyde]149-clyde had come to know , it could be done eventually , of course . For in some blind , dualistic way both [she]126-mrs. griffiths and [Asa]127-asa insisted , as do [all religionists]598-all religionists , in disassociating [God]122-god from harm and error and misery , while granting [Him]122-god nevertheless supreme control . [They]599-they would seek for something else — some malign , treacherous , deceiving power which , in the face of [God]122-god 's omniscience and omnipotence , still beguiles and betrays — and find it eventually in the error and perverseness of the human heart , which [God]122-god has made , yet which [He]122-god does not control , because [He]122-god does not want to control it .

At the moment , however , only hurt and rage were with [her]126-mrs. griffiths , and yet [her]126-mrs. griffiths lips did not twitch as did [Asa]127-asa 's , nor did [her]126-mrs. griffiths eyes show that profound distress which filled [his]127-asa . Instead [she]126-mrs. griffiths retreated a step and reexamined the letter , almost angrily , then said to [Asa]127-asa : " [She]126-mrs. griffiths 's run away with [some one]2296-some one and [she]126-mrs. griffiths does n't say — "[126-mrs. griffiths] Then [she]126-mrs. griffiths stopped suddenly , remembering the presence of [the children]395-the children — [Clyde]149-clyde , [Julia]133-julia , and [Frank]134-frank , all present and all gazing curiously , intently , unbelievingly . With [Asa]127-asa then [she]126-mrs. griffiths retired quite precipitately to [a small room back of [the mission hall]603-the mission hall]602-a small room back of the mission hall . Even [Julia]133-julia hardly gathered the full import of it . But [Clyde]149-clyde , because of [his]149-clyde larger contact with life and [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother 's statement ( " [She]270-his mother 's run away with [some one]2296-some one "[270-his mother] ) , understood well enough . " Do [you]133-julia suppose [she]270-his mother 's run away for good ? "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde asked [Julia]133-julia dubiously , the while [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents were out of [the room]577-the room , [Julia]133-julia [herself]133-julia looking so blank and strange .

" How should [I]133-julia know ? [Julia]133-julia , being colder emotionally than either [Esta]124-esta or [Clyde]149-clyde , was more considerate of [[her]133-julia parents]553-her parents in a conventional way , and hence sorrier . True , [she]133-julia did not quite gather what it meant , but [she]133-julia suspected something , for [she]133-julia had talked occasionally with [girls]379-girls , but in a very guarded and conservative way . It was dreadful . The air was thick with misery .

And as [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents talked in [[their]347-his parents little room]622-their little room , [Clyde]149-clyde brooded too , for [he]149-clyde was intensely curious about life now . What was it [Esta]124-esta had really done ? Was it , as [he]149-clyde feared and thought , one of those dreadful runaway or sexually disagreeable affairs which [the boys]623-the boys on [the streets]376-the streets and at [school]396-school were always slyly talking about ? How shameful , if that were true ! [She]124-esta might never come back . [She]124-esta had gone with [some man]626-some man . There was something wrong about that , no doubt , for [a girl]627-a girl , anyhow , for all [he]149-clyde had ever heard was that all decent contacts between [boys]296-boys and [girls]379-girls , [men]447-men and [women]631-women , led to but one thing — marriage . And now [Esta]124-esta , in addition to [their]347-his parents other troubles , had gone and done this . Certainly [this home life of [theirs]347-his parents]632-this home life of theirs was pretty dark now , and it would be darker instead of brighter because of this .

Presently [the parents]331-the parents came out , and then [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths ' face , if still set and constrained , was somehow a little different , less savage perhaps , more hopelessly resigned .

But [Asa]127-asa !

[Such a father]637-such a father , as [Clyde]149-clyde often thought , afterwards .
