[Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths paused and looked firmly and yet apologetically at [[her]126-mrs. griffiths children]641-her children . [Asa]127-asa , for [his]127-asa part , emitted another " Tst ! Tst ! Tst ! "[127-asa] and then [the children]395-the children were waved to bed .

At that , [Clyde]149-clyde , who really wanted to know what [Esta]124-esta 's letter had said , but was convinced from long experience that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother would not let [him]149-clyde know unless [she]270-his mother chose , returned to [[his]149-clyde room]644-his room again , for [he]149-clyde was tired . Why did n't [they]645-they search more if there was hope of finding [her]124-esta ? Where was [she]124-esta now — at this minute ? On [some train]646-some train somewhere ? Evidently [she]124-esta did n't want to be found . [She]124-esta was probably dissatisfied , just as [he]149-clyde was . Here [he]149-clyde was , thinking so recently of going away somewhere [himself]149-clyde , wondering how [the family]279-the family would take it , and now [she]124-esta had gone before [him]149-clyde . How would that affect [his]149-clyde point of view and action in the future ? Truly , in spite of [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father 's and [mother]282-mother 's misery , [he]149-clyde could not see that [her]124-esta going was such a calamity , not from the going point of view , at any rate . It was only another something which hinted that things were not right here . Mission work was nothing . All this religious emotion and talk was not so much either . [It]650-it had n't saved [Esta]124-esta . Evidently , like [himself]149-clyde , [she]124-esta did n't believe so much in it , either .

The effect of this particular conclusion was to cause [Clyde]149-clyde to think harder than ever about [himself]149-clyde . And the principal result of [his]149-clyde thinking was that [he]149-clyde must do something for [himself]149-clyde and soon . Up to this time the best [he]149-clyde had been able to do was to work at such odd jobs as befall [all boys]651-all boys between [their]651-all boys twelfth and fifteenth years : assisting [a man who had a paper route during the summer months of one year]652-a man who had a paper route during the summer months of one year , working in [the basement of [a five - and - ten - cent store]654-a five - and - ten - cent store]653-the basement of a five - and - ten - cent store all one summer long , and on Saturdays , for a period during the winter , opening boxes and unpacking goods , for which [he]149-clyde received the munificent sum of five dollars a week , a sum which at the time seemed almost a fortune . [He]149-clyde felt [himself]149-clyde rich and , in the face of the opposition of [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , who were opposed to the theater and motion pictures also , as being not only worldly , but sinful , [he]149-clyde could occasionally go to one or another of those — in [the gallery]656-the gallery — a form of diversion which [he]149-clyde had to conceal from [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents . Yet that did not deter [him]149-clyde . [He]149-clyde felt that [he]149-clyde had a right to go with [his]149-clyde own money ; also to take [[his]149-clyde younger brother]658-his younger brother [Frank]134-frank , who was glad enough to go with [him]149-clyde and say nothing .

Later in the same year , wishing to get out of [school]396-school because [he]149-clyde already felt [himself]149-clyde very much belated in the race , [he]149-clyde secured a place as an assistant to a soda water clerk in [one of [the cheaper drug stores of [the city]662-the city]661-the cheaper drug stores of the city , which adjoined [a theater]663-a theater and enjoyed not a little patronage of this sort]660-one of the cheaper drug stores of the city , which adjoined a theater and enjoyed not a little patronage of this sort . A sign—"Boy Wanted"—since[149-clyde] it was directly on [his]149-clyde way to [school]396-school , first interested [him]149-clyde . Later , in conversation with [the young man whose assistant [he]149-clyde was to be , and from whom [he]149-clyde was to learn the trade , assuming that [he]149-clyde was sufficiently willing and facile]665-the young man whose assistant he was to be , and from whom he was to learn the trade , assuming that he was sufficiently willing and facile , [he]149-clyde gathered that if [he]149-clyde mastered this art , [he]149-clyde might make as much as fifteen and even eighteen dollars a week . It was rumored that [[Stroud]135-stroud 's at the corner of [14th]18-14th and [Baltimore streets]23-baltimore]666-stroud 's at the corner of 14th and baltimore streets paid that much to [two of [[their]135-stroud clerks]668-their clerks]667-two of their clerks . [The particular store to which [he]149-clyde was applying]669-the particular store to which he was applying paid only twelve , the standard salary of [most places]670-most places .

But to acquire this art , as [he]149-clyde was now informed , required time and the friendly help of [an expert]671-an expert . If [he]149-clyde wished to come here and work for five to begin with — well , six , then , since [his]149-clyde face fell — [he]149-clyde might soon expect to know a great deal about the art of mixing sweet drinks and decorating a large variety of ice creams with liquid sweets , thus turning them into sundaes . For the time being apprenticeship meant washing and polishing all the machinery and implements of [this particular counter]672-this particular counter , to say nothing of opening and sweeping out [the store]673-the store at so early an hour as seven - thirty , dusting , and delivering such orders as [the owner of [this drug store]675-this drug store]674-the owner of this drug store chose to send out by [him]149-clyde . At such idle moments as [[his]149-clyde immediate superior]676-his immediate superior — [a Mr. Sieberling]136-a mr. sieberling — twenty , dashing , self - confident , talkative , was too busy to fill all the orders , [he]149-clyde might be called upon to mix such minor drinks — lemonades , Coca - Colas and the like — as the trade demanded .

Yet this interesting position , after due consultation with [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother , [he]149-clyde decided to take . For one thing , it would provide [him]149-clyde , as [he]149-clyde suspected , with all the ice - cream sodas [he]149-clyde desired , free — an advantage not to be disregarded . In [the next place]678-the next place , as [he]149-clyde saw [it]673-the store at the time , it was an open door to a trade — something which [he]149-clyde lacked . Further , and not at all disadvantageously as [he]149-clyde saw it , [this store]679-this store required [his]149-clyde presence at night as late as twelve o'clock , with certain hours off during the day to compensate for this . And this took [him]149-clyde out of [[his]149-clyde home]490-his home at night — out of [the ten - o'clock - boy class]681-the ten - o'clock - boy class at last . [They]682-they could not ask [him]149-clyde to attend any meetings save on Sunday , and not even then , since [he]149-clyde was supposed to work Sunday afternoons and evenings .

Next , [the clerk who manipulated this particular soda fountain]683-the clerk who manipulated this particular soda fountain , quite regularly received passes from [the manager of [the theater next door]685-the theater next door]684-the manager of the theater next door , and into [the lobby of which one door to [the drug store]687-the drug store]686-the lobby of which one door to the drug store gave — a most fascinating connection to [Clyde]149-clyde . It seemed so interesting to be working for [a drug store]688-a drug store thus intimately connected with [a theater]663-a theater .

And best of all , as [Clyde]149-clyde now found to [his]149-clyde pleasure , and yet despair at times , [the place]576-the place was visited , just before and after the show on matinee days , by [bevies of [girls]379-girls , single and en suite , who sat at the counter and giggled and chattered and gave [their]379-girls hair and [their]379-girls complexions last perfecting touches before the mirror]691-bevies of girls , single and en suite , who sat at the counter and giggled and chattered and gave their hair and their complexions last perfecting touches before the mirror . [And Clyde]149-clyde , callow and inexperienced in the ways of [the world]332-the world , and [those of the opposite sex]694-those of the opposite sex , was never weary of observing the beauty , the daring , the self - sufficiency and the sweetness of these , as [he]149-clyde saw [them]695-them . For the first time in [his]149-clyde life , while [he]149-clyde busied [himself]149-clyde with washing glasses , filling the ice - cream and syrup containers , arranging the lemons and oranges in the trays , [he]149-clyde had an almost uninterrupted opportunity of studying [these girls]696-these girls at close range . The wonder of [them]696-these girls ! For the most part , [they]696-these girls were so well - dressed and smart - looking — the rings , pins , furs , delightful hats , pretty shoes [they]696-these girls wore . And so often [he]149-clyde overheard [them]696-these girls discussing such interesting things — parties , dances , dinners , the shows [they]696-these girls had seen , the places in [or near [Kansas City]5-kansas city to which [they]696-these girls were soon going]697-or near kansas city to which they were soon going , the difference between the styles of this year and last , the fascination of [certain actors and [actresses]699-actresses]698-certain actors and actresses — [principally actors]700-principally actors — who were now playing or soon coming to [the city]662-the city . And to this day , in [[his]149-clyde own home]702-his own home [he]149-clyde had heard nothing of all this .

And very often one or another of [these young beauties]703-these young beauties was accompanied by [some male in evening suit , dress shirt , high hat , bow tie , white kid gloves and patent leather shoes]704-some male in evening suit , dress shirt , high hat , bow tie , white kid gloves and patent leather shoes , a costume which at that time [Clyde]149-clyde felt to be the last word in all true distinction , beauty , gallantry and bliss . To be able to wear such a suit with such ease and air ! To be able to talk to [a girl after the manner and with the sang - froid of some of these gallants]705-a girl after the manner and with the sang - froid of some of these gallants ! what a true measure of achievement ! [No good - looking girl , as it then appeared to [him]149-clyde]706-no good - looking girl , as it then appeared to him , would have anything to do with [him]149-clyde if [he]149-clyde did not possess this standard of equipment . It was plainly necessary — the thing . And once [he]149-clyde did attain it — was able to wear such clothes as these — well , then was [he]149-clyde not well set upon the path that leads to all the blisses ? All the joys of life would then most certainly be spread before [him]149-clyde . The friendly smiles ! The secret handclasps , maybe — an arm about the waist of [some one or another]707-some one or another — a kiss — a promise of marriage — and then , and then !

And all this as a revealing flash after all the years of walking through [the streets]376-the streets with [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father and [mother]282-mother to public prayer meeting , the sitting in [chapel]711-chapel and listening to [queer and nondescript individuals]712-queer and nondescript individuals — [depressing and disconcerting people]713-depressing and disconcerting people — telling how [Christ]123-christ had saved [them]714-them and what [God]122-god had done for [them]714-them . [You]715-you bet [he]149-clyde would get out of that now . [He]149-clyde would work and save [his]149-clyde money and be [somebody]716-somebody . Decidedly [this simple and yet idyllic compound of the commonplace]717-this simple and yet idyllic compound of the commonplace had all the luster and wonder of a spiritual transfiguration , the true mirage of [the lost and thirsting and seeking victim of]718-the lost and thirsting and seeking victim of [the desert]719-the desert .

However , the trouble with this particular position , as time speedily proved , was that much as it might teach [him]149-clyde of mixing drinks and how to eventually earn twelve dollars a week , it was no immediate solvent for the yearnings and ambitions that were already gnawing at [his]149-clyde vitals . For [Albert Sieberling]137-albert sieberling , [[his]149-clyde immediate superior]676-his immediate superior , was determined to keep as much of [his]149-clyde knowledge , as well as the most pleasant parts of the tasks , to [himself]149-clyde . And further [he]149-clyde was quite at one with [the druggist for whom [they]722-they worked]721-the druggist for whom they worked in thinking that [Clyde]149-clyde , in addition to assisting [him]149-clyde about [the fountain]723-the fountain , should run such errands as [the druggist]724-the druggist desired , which kept [Clyde]149-clyde industriously employed for nearly all the hours [he]149-clyde was on duty .

Consequently there was no immediate result to all this . [Clyde]149-clyde could see no way to dressing better than [he]149-clyde did . Worse , [he]149-clyde was haunted by the fact that [he]149-clyde had very little money and very few contacts and connections — so few that , outside [[his]149-clyde own home]702-his own home , [he]149-clyde was lonely and not so very much less than lonely there . The flight of [Esta]124-esta had thrown a chill over the religious work [there]443-there , and because , as yet , [she]124-esta had not returned — [the family]279-the family , as [he]149-clyde now heard , was thinking of breaking up here and moving , for want of a better idea , to [Denver]20-denver , [Colorado]21-colorado . But [Clyde]149-clyde , by now , was convinced that [he]149-clyde did not wish to accompany [them]279-the family . What was the good of it , [he]149-clyde asked [himself]149-clyde ? There would be just another mission [there]443-there , the same as this one .

[He]149-clyde had always lived at [home]533-home — in [the rooms at the rear of [the mission]581-the mission in [Bickel Street]10-bickel street]730-the rooms at the rear of the mission in bickel street , but [he]149-clyde hated it . And since [his]149-clyde eleventh year , during all of which time [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family had been residing in [Kansas City]5-kansas city , [he]149-clyde had been ashamed to bring [boy friends]733-boy friends to or near [it]443-there . For that reason [he]149-clyde had always avoided [boy friends]733-boy friends , and had walked and played very much alone — or with [[his]149-clyde brother]482-his brother and [sisters]381-sisters .

But now that [he]149-clyde was sixteen and old enough to make [his]149-clyde own way , [he]149-clyde ought to be getting out of this . And yet [he]149-clyde was earning almost nothing — not enough to live on , if [he]149-clyde were alone — and [he]149-clyde had not as yet developed sufficient skill or courage to get anything better .

Nevertheless when [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents began to talk of moving to [Denver]20-denver , and suggested that [he]149-clyde might secure work out there , never assuming for a moment that [he]149-clyde would not want to go [he]149-clyde began to throw out hints to the effect that it might [he]149-clyde better if [he]149-clyde did not . [He]149-clyde liked [Kansas City]5-kansas city . What was the use of changing ? [He]149-clyde had a job now and [he]149-clyde might get something better . But [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , bethinking [themselves]347-his parents of [Esta]124-esta and the fate that had overtaken [her]739-her , were not a little dubious as to the outcome of such early adventuring on [his]149-clyde part alone . Once [they]347-his parents were away , where would [he]149-clyde live ? With whom ? What sort of influence would enter [his]149-clyde life , who would be at hand to aid and council and guide [him]149-clyde in the straight and narrow path , as [they]347-his parents had done ? It was something to think about .

But spurred by this imminence of [Denver]20-denver , which now daily seemed to be drawing nearer , and the fact that not long after this [Mr. Sieberling]136-a mr. sieberling , owing to [his]136-a mr. sieberling too obvious gallantries in connection with the fair sex , lost [his]136-a mr. sieberling place in [the drug store]687-the drug store , and [Clyde]149-clyde came by [a new and bony and chill superior who did not seem to want [him]149-clyde as [an assistant]742-an assistant]741-a new and bony and chill superior who did not seem to want him as an assistant , [he]149-clyde decided to quit — not at once , but rather to see , on such errands as took [him]149-clyde out of [the store]673-the store , if [he]149-clyde could not find something else . It was all so lavish . Under [his]149-clyde feet was a checkered black - and - white marble floor . Above [him]149-clyde a coppered and stained and gilded ceiling . And supporting this , a veritable forest of black marble columns as highly polished as the floor — glassy smooth . And between the columns which ranged away toward three separate entrances , one right , one left and one directly forward toward [Dalrymple Avenue]25-dalrymple avenue — were lamps , statuary , rugs , palms , chairs , divans , tete - a - tetes — a prodigal display . [He]2331-the earl of landreil 's registered as [Mr. Blunt]141-mr. blunt . Can [you]815-the assistant beat that English stuff ? [They]2334-they can certainly lay on the class , eh ? "[815-the assistant]

" [You]815-the assistant said it ! "[816-his assistant] replied [[his]149-clyde assistant]816-his assistant deferentially .

[He]816-his assistant turned for the first time , glimpsing [Clyde]149-clyde , but paying no attention to [him]149-clyde . [[His]149-clyde assistant]816-his assistant came to [Clyde]149-clyde 's aid .

" [That young fella]2335-that young fella there is waiting to see [you]149-clyde , "[816-his assistant] [he]816-his assistant explained .

" [You]149-clyde want to see [me]818-the captain of the bellhops ? "[818-the captain of the bellhops] queried [the captain of [the bellhops]819-the bellhops]818-the captain of the bellhops , turning to [Clyde]149-clyde , and observing [his]149-clyde none - too - good clothes , at the same time making a comprehensive study of [him]149-clyde .

" [The gentleman in [the drug store]687-the drug store]2336-the gentleman in the drug store , "[149-clyde] began [Clyde]149-clyde , who did not quite like the looks of [the man before [him]149-clyde]820-the man before him , but was determined to present [himself]149-clyde as agreeably as possible , " was saying — that is , [he]2336-the gentleman in the drug store said that [I]149-clyde might ask [you]820-the man before him if there was any chance here for [me]149-clyde as [a bell - boy]2319-a bell - boy . [I]149-clyde 'm working now at [[Klinkle]139-mr. klinkle 's drug store at [7th]28-7th and [Brooklyn]24-brooklyn]2339-klinkle 's drug store at 7th and brooklyn , as [a helper]2340-a helper , but [I]149-clyde 'd like to get out of that and [he]2336-the gentleman in the drug store said [you]820-the man before him might — that is — [he]2336-the gentleman in the drug store thought [you]820-the man before him had a place open now . "[149-clyde] [Clyde]149-clyde was so flustered and disturbed by the cool , examining eyes of [the man before [him]149-clyde]820-the man before him that [he]149-clyde could scarcely get [his]149-clyde breath properly , and swallowed hard .

For the first time in [his]149-clyde life , it occurred to [him]149-clyde that if [he]149-clyde wanted to get on [he]149-clyde ought to insinuate [himself]149-clyde into the good graces of [people]377-people — do or say something that would make [them]377-people like [him]149-clyde . So now [he]149-clyde contrived an eager , ingratiating smile , which [he]149-clyde bestowed on [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires , and added : " If [you]140-mr. squires 'd like to give [me]149-clyde a chance , [I]149-clyde 'd try very hard and [I]149-clyde 'd be very willing . "[149-clyde]

[The man before [him]149-clyde]820-the man before him merely looked at [him]149-clyde coldly , but being the soul of craft and self - acquisitiveness in a petty way , and rather liking [anybody who had the skill and the will to be diplomatic]824-anybody who had the skill and the will to be diplomatic , [he]149-clyde now put aside an impulse to shake [his]149-clyde head negatively , and observed : " But [you]149-clyde have n't had any training in this work . "[149-clyde]

" No , [sir]2315-sir , but could n't [I]149-clyde pick it up pretty quick if [I]149-clyde tried hard ? "[149-clyde]

" Well , let [me]149-clyde see , "[149-clyde] observed the head of the bell - hops , scratching [his]149-clyde head dubiously . " [I]149-clyde have n't any time to talk to [you]149-clyde now . Come around Monday afternoon . [I]149-clyde 'll see [you]149-clyde then . "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde turned on [his]149-clyde heel and walked away .

[Clyde]149-clyde , left alone in this fashion , and not knowing just what it meant , stared , wondering . Was it really true that [he]149-clyde had been invited to come back on Monday ? Could it be possible that — [He]149-clyde turned and hurried out , thrilling from head to toe . The idea ! [He]149-clyde had asked [this man]365-this man for [a place in [the very finest hotel in [Kansas City]5-kansas city]827-the very finest hotel in kansas city]826-a place in the very finest hotel in kansas city and [he]149-clyde had asked [him]365-this man to come back and see [him]365-this man on Monday . Gee ! what would that mean ? Could it be possible that [he]149-clyde would be admitted to [such a grand world as this]828-such a grand world as this — and that so speedily ? Could it really be ?

The imaginative flights of [Clyde]149-clyde in connection with all this — [his]149-clyde dreams of what it might mean for [him]149-clyde to be connected with so glorious [an institution]829-an institution — can only be suggested . For [his]149-clyde ideas of luxury were in the main so extreme and mistaken and gauche — mere wanderings of a repressed and unsatisfied fancy , which as yet had had nothing but imaginings to feed it .

[He]149-clyde went back to [his]149-clyde old duties at [the drug - store]830-the drug - store — to [[his]149-clyde home]490-his home after hours in order to eat and sleep — but now for the balance of this Friday and Saturday and Sunday and Monday until late in the day , [he]149-clyde walked on air , really . [His]149-clyde mind was not on what [he]149-clyde was doing , and several times [[his]149-clyde superior at [the drugstore]833-the drugstore]832-his superior at the drugstore had to remind [him]149-clyde to " wake - up . "[832-his superior at the drugstore] And after hours , instead of going directly [home]533-home , [he]149-clyde walked north to [the corner of [14th]18-14th and [Baltimore]23-baltimore]835-the corner of 14th and baltimore , where stood [this great hotel]836-this great hotel , and looked at [it]836-this great hotel . There , at midnight even , before each of the three principal entrances — one facing each of [three streets]837-three streets — was [a doorman]838-a doorman in a long maroon coat with many buttons and a high - rimmed and long - visored maroon cap . And inside , behind looped and fluted French silk curtains , were the still blazing lights , [the a la carte dining - room]839-the a la carte dining - room and the American grill in [the basement]840-the basement near one corner still open . And about [them]837-three streets were [many taxis]841-many taxis and [cars]842-cars . And there was music always — from somewhere .

After surveying it all this Friday night and again on Saturday and Sunday morning , [he]149-clyde returned on Monday afternoon at the suggestion of [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires and was greeted by [that individual]843-that individual rather crustily , for by then [he]149-clyde had all but forgotten [him]843-that individual . But seeing that at the moment [he]149-clyde was actually in need of help , and being satisfied that [Clyde]149-clyde might be of service , [he]149-clyde led [him]149-clyde into [[his]149-clyde small office]844-his small office under [the stair]845-the stair , where , with a very superior manner and much actual indifference , [he]149-clyde proceeded to question [him]149-clyde as to [[his]149-clyde parentage]846-his parentage , where [he]149-clyde lived , at what [he]149-clyde had worked before and where , what [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father did for a living — a poser that for [Clyde]149-clyde , for [he]149-clyde was proud and so ashamed to admit that [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents conducted a mission and preached on [the streets]376-the streets . Instead [he]149-clyde replied ( which was true at times ) that [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father canvassed for a washing machine and [wringer company]851-wringer company — and on Sundays preached — a religious revelation , which was not at all displeasing to [this master of [boys who were inclined to be anything but home - loving and conservative]853-boys who were inclined to be anything but home - loving and conservative]852-this master of boys who were inclined to be anything but home - loving and conservative . Could [he]149-clyde bring a reference from where [he]149-clyde now was ? [He]149-clyde could .

[Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires proceeded to explain that [this hotel]791-this hotel was very strict . Too many [boys]296-boys , on account of the scenes and the show here , the contact made with undue luxury to which [they]296-boys were not accustomed — though these were not the words used by [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires — were inclined to lose [their]296-boys heads and go wrong . [He]140-mr. squires was constantly being forced to discharge [boys who , because [they]856-boys who , because they made a little extra money , did n't know how to conduct themselves made a little extra money , did n't know how to conduct [themselves]856-boys who , because they made a little extra money , did n't know how to conduct themselves]856-boys who , because they made a little extra money , did n't know how to conduct themselves . [He]140-mr. squires must have [boys who were willing , civil , prompt]857-boys who were willing , civil , prompt , courteous to [everybody]858-everybody . [They]857-boys who were willing , civil , prompt must be clean and neat about [their]857-boys who were willing , civil , prompt persons and clothes and show up promptly — on the dot — and in good condition for the work every day . And [any boy who got to thinking that because [he]859-any boy who got to thinking that because he made a little money he could flirt with anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright made a little money [he]859-any boy who got to thinking that because he made a little money he could flirt with anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright could flirt with [anybody]860-anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright]859-any boy who got to thinking that because he made a little money he could flirt with anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright , need n't think that [he]859-any boy who got to thinking that because he made a little money he could flirt with anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright would be [here]2282-here long . [He]859-any boy who got to thinking that because he made a little money he could flirt with anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright would be fired , and that promptly . [He]859-any boy who got to thinking that because he made a little money he could flirt with anybody or talk back , or go off on parties at night , and then not show up on time or too tired to be quick and bright would not tolerate any nonsense . That must be understood now , once and for all .

[Clyde]149-clyde nodded assent often and interpolated a few eager " yes , [sirs]2342-sirs "[149-clyde] and " no , [sirs]2342-sirs , "[149-clyde] and assured [him]140-mr. squires at the last that it was the furtherest thing from [his]140-mr. squires thoughts and temperament to dream of any such high crimes and misdemeanors as [he]140-mr. squires had outlined . [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires then proceeded to explain that [this hotel]791-this hotel only paid fifteen dollars a month and board — at [the servant]863-the servant 's table in [the basement]840-the basement — to [any bell - boy]865-any bell - boy at any time . But , and this information came as a most amazing revelation to [Clyde]149-clyde , [every guest for whom any of [these boys]386-these boys]866-every guest for whom any of these boys did anything — carried a bag or delivered a pitcher of water or did anything — gave [him]149-clyde a tip , and often quite a liberal one — a dime , fifteen cents , a quarter , sometimes more . And these tips , as [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires explained , taken all together , averaged from four to six dollars a day — not less and sometimes more — most amazing pay , as [Clyde]149-clyde now realized . [His]149-clyde heart gave an enormous bound and was near to suffocating [him]149-clyde at the mere mention of so large a sum . From four to six dollars ! Why , that was twenty - eight to forty - two dollars a week ! [He]149-clyde could scarcely believe it . And that in addition to the fifteen dollars a month and board . And there was no charge , as [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires now explained , for the handsome uniforms [the boys]623-the boys wore . But it might not be worn or taken out of [the place]576-the place . [His]149-clyde hours , as [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires now proceeded to explain , would be as follows : On Mondays , Wednesdays , Fridays and Sundays , [he]149-clyde was to work from six in the morning until noon , and then , with six hours off , from six in the evening until midnight . On Tuesdays , Thursdays and Saturdays , [he]149-clyde need only work from noon until six , thus giving [him]149-clyde each alternate afternoon or evening to [himself]149-clyde . But all [his]149-clyde meals were to be taken outside [his]149-clyde working hours and [he]149-clyde was to report promptly in uniform for line - up and inspection by [[his]149-clyde superior]870-his superior exactly ten minutes before the regular hours of [his]149-clyde work began at each watch .

As for some other things which were in [his]149-clyde mind at the time , [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires said nothing . There were others , as [he]149-clyde knew , who would speak for [him]149-clyde . Instead [he]149-clyde went on to add , and then quite climactically for [Clyde]149-clyde at that time , who had been sitting as [one in a daze]871-one in a daze : " [I]149-clyde suppose [you]149-clyde are ready to go to work now , are n't [you]149-clyde ? "[149-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]2315-sir , yes , [sir]2315-sir , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde replied .

In the meantime , [Clyde]149-clyde , in tow of [this new mentor]880-this new mentor , was listening to a line of information such as never previously had come to [his]149-clyde ears anywhere .

" [You]149-clyde need n't be frightened , if [you]149-clyde ai n't never worked at anything like dis before , "[881-this youth , whose last name was hegglund as clyde later learned , and who hailed from jersey city , new jersey] began [this youth , whose last name was [Hegglund]142-hegglund as [Clyde]149-clyde later learned , and who hailed from [Jersey City]29-jersey city , [New Jersey]30-new jersey]881-this youth , whose last name was hegglund as clyde later learned , and who hailed from jersey city , new jersey , [exotic lingo , gestures and all]882-exotic lingo , gestures and all . [They]883-they had entered upon [an elevator]884-an elevator labeled ' [employees]885-employees . ' " It ai n't so hard . [I]885-employees got [my]885-employees first job in [Buffalo t'ree]40-buffalo years ago and [I]885-employees never knowed a t'ing about it up to dat time . All [you]2349-you got ta do is to watch [de udders]2350-de udders an ' see how [dey]2350-de udders do , see . [Yu]145-yu get dat , do [you]2349-you ? "[885-employees]

[Clyde]149-clyde , whose education was not a little superior to that of [[his]149-clyde guide]886-his guide , commented quite sharply in [his]149-clyde own mind on the use of such words as " knowed , "[149-clyde] and " gotta"—also[149-clyde] upon " t'ing , "[149-clyde] " dat , "[149-clyde] " udders , "[149-clyde] and so on , but so grateful was [he]149-clyde for any courtesy at this time that [he]149-clyde was inclined to forgive [[his]149-clyde obviously kindly mentor]887-his obviously kindly mentor anything for [his]149-clyde geniality .

" Watch whoever 's doin' anyt'ing , at first , see , till [you]2349-you git to know , see . Dat 's de way . When de bell rings , if [you]2349-you 're at [de head of [de bench]2352-de bench]2351-de head of de bench , it 's [your]2349-you turn , see , an ' [you]2349-you jump up and go quick . [Dey]2350-de udders like [you]2349-you to be quick around here , see . An ' whenever [you]2349-you see [any one]511-any one come in de door or out of [an elevator]884-an elevator wit a bag , an ' [you]2349-you 're at [de head of [de bench]2352-de bench]2351-de head of de bench , [you]2349-you jump , wedder [de captain]2357-de captain rings de bell or calls ' front ' or not . Sometimes [he]2357-de captain 's busy or ai n't lookin ' an ' [he]2357-de captain wants [you]2349-you to do dat , see . Look sharp , cause if [you]2349-you do n't get no bags , [you]2349-you do n't get no tips , see . [Everybody]858-everybody dat has a bag or anyt'ing has to have it carried for ['em]2359-'em , unless [dey]2350-de udders wo n't let [you]2349-you have it , see .[149-clyde]

" But be sure and wait somewhere near [de]2350-de udders desk for whoever comes in until [dey]2350-de udders sign up for [a room]2360-a room , "[888-he] [he]888-he rattled on as [they]889-they ascended in [the elevator]890-the elevator . " [Most every one]2361-most every one takes [a room]2360-a room . [Den]146-den [de clerk'll]2363-de clerk'll give [you]2349-you de key an ' after dat all [you]2349-you got ta do is to carry up de bags to [de room]2364-de room . Den all [you]2349-you got ta do is to turn on de lights in [de batroom]2365-de batroom and [closet]2366-closet , if dere is one , so [dey'll]2350-de udders know where [dey]2350-de udders are , see . An ' den raise de curtains in de day time or lower 'em at night , an ' see if [dere]2350-de udders 's towels in [de room]2364-de room , so [you]2349-you can tell [de maid]2368-de maid if [dere]2350-de udders ai n't , and den if [dey]2350-de udders do n't give [you]2349-you no tip , [you]2349-you got ta go , only most times , unless [you]2349-you draw a stiff , all [you]2349-you got ta do is hang back a little — make a stall , see — fumble wit de door - key or try de transom , see . [Den]146-den , if [dey're]2350-de udders any good , [dey'll]2350-de udders hand [you]2349-you a tip . If [dey]2350-de udders do n't , [you]2349-you 're out , dat 's all , see . [You]2349-you ca n't even look as dough [you]2349-you was sore , dough — nottin ' like dat , see . Den [you]2349-you come down an ' unless [dey]2350-de udders wants ice - water or somepin , [you]2349-you 're troo , see . It 's back to de bench , quick . Dere ai n't much to it . Only [you]2349-you got ta be quick all de time , see , and not let [any one]511-any one get by [you]2349-you comin ' or goin'—dat 's de main t'ing .[888-he]

" An ' after [dey]2350-de udders give [you]2349-you [your]2349-you uniform , an ' [you]2349-you go to work , do n't forgit to give [de captain]2357-de captain a dollar after every watch before [you]2349-you leave , see — two dollars on de day [you]2349-you has two watches , and a dollar on [de]2350-de udders day [you]2349-you has one , see ? Dat 's de way it is here . [We]2371-we work togedder like dat , an ' [you]2349-you got ta do dat if [you]2349-you wanta hold [your]2349-you job . But dat 's all . After dat all de rest is [yours]2372-yours . "[149-clyde]

[Clyde]149-clyde saw .

A part of [his]149-clyde twenty - four or thirty - two dollars as [he]149-clyde figured it was going glimmering , apparently — eleven or twelve all told — but what of it ! Would there not be twelve or fifteen or even more left ? And there were [his]149-clyde meals and [his]149-clyde uniform . Kind Heaven ! What a realization of paradise ! What a consummation of luxury !

[[Mr. Hegglund]142-hegglund of [Jersey City]29-jersey city]891-mr. hegglund of jersey city escorted [him]149-clyde to [the twelfth floor]892-the twelfth floor and into [a room]2360-a room where [they]894-they found on guard [a wizened and grizzled little old man of doubtful age and temperament]895-a wizened and grizzled little old man of doubtful age and temperament , who forthwith ouffitted [Clyde]149-clyde with a suit that was so near a fit that , without further orders , it was not deemed necessary to alter it . And trying on various caps , there was one that fitted [him]149-clyde — a thing that sat most rakishly over one ear — only , as [Hegglund]142-hegglund informed [him]149-clyde , " [You]149-clyde 'll have to get dat hair of [yours]149-clyde cut . Better get it clipped behind . It 's too long . "[142-hegglund] And with that [Clyde]149-clyde [himself]149-clyde had been in mental agreement before [he]149-clyde spoke . [His]149-clyde hair certainly did not look right in the new cap . [He]149-clyde hated it now . And going [downstairs]896-downstairs , and reporting to [Mr. Whipple]148-mr. whipple , [[Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires ' assistant]897-mr. squires ' assistant , [the latter]898-the latter had said : " Very well . It fits all right , does it ? Well , then , [you]149-clyde go on [here]2282-here at six . Report at five - thirty and be here in [your]149-clyde uniform at five - forty - five for inspection . "[898-the latter]

[Whereupon Clyde]149-clyde , being advised by [Hegglund]142-hegglund to go then and there to get [his]149-clyde uniform and take it to [the dressing - room in [the basement]840-the basement]899-the dressing - room in the basement , and get [his]149-clyde locker from [the locker - man]901-the locker - man , [he]149-clyde did so , and then hurried most nervously out — first to get a hair - cut and afterwards to report to [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family on [his]149-clyde great luck .

[He]149-clyde was to be [a bell - boy in [the great Hotel Green - Davidson]904-the great hotel green - davidson]903-a bell - boy in the great hotel green - davidson . [He]149-clyde was to wear a uniform and a handsome one . [He]149-clyde was to make — but [he]149-clyde did not tell [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother at first what [he]149-clyde was to make , truly — but more than eleven or twelve at first , anyhow , [he]149-clyde guessed — [he]149-clyde could not be sure . For now , all at once , [he]149-clyde saw economic independence ahead for [himself]149-clyde , if not for [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family , and [he]149-clyde did not care to complicate it with any claims which a confession as to [his]149-clyde real salary would most certainly inspire . But [he]149-clyde did say that [he]149-clyde was to have [his]149-clyde meals free — because that meant eating away from [home]533-home , which was what [he]149-clyde wished . And in addition [he]149-clyde was to live and move always in the glorious atmosphere of [this hotel]791-this hotel — not to have to go [home]533-home ever before twelve , if [he]149-clyde did not wish — to have good clothes — interesting company , maybe — a good time , gee !

And as [he]149-clyde hurried on about [his]149-clyde various errands now , it occurred to [him]149-clyde as a final and shrewd and delicious thought that [he]149-clyde need not go [home]533-home on such nights as [he]149-clyde wished to go to [a theater]663-a theater or anything like that . [He]149-clyde could just stay down - [town]912-town and say [he]149-clyde had to work . And that with free meals and good clothes — think of that !

The mere thought of all this was so astonishing and entrancing that [he]149-clyde could not bring [himself]149-clyde to think of it too much . [He]149-clyde must wait and see . [He]149-clyde must wait and see just how much [he]149-clyde would make here in this perfectly marvelous - marvelous realm .

And as conditions stood , the extraordinary economic and social inexperience of [the Griffiths]913-the griffiths — [Asa]127-asa and [Elvira]126-mrs. griffiths — dovetailed all too neatly with [his]149-clyde dreams . For neither [Asa]127-asa nor [Elvira]126-mrs. griffiths had the least knowledge of the actual character of the work upon which [he]149-clyde was about to enter , scarcely any more than [he]149-clyde did , or what it might mean to [him]149-clyde morally , imaginatively , financially , or in any other way . For [neither of [them]913-the griffiths]914-neither of them had ever stopped in [a hotel]915-a hotel above the fourth class in all [their]913-the griffiths days . [Neither one]916-neither one had ever eaten in [a restaurant of a class that catered to other than [individuals of [their]918-individuals of their own low financial level own low financial level]918-individuals of their own low financial level]917-a restaurant of a class that catered to other than individuals of their own low financial level . That there could be any other forms of work or contact than those involved in carrying the bags of [guests]919-guests to and from the door of [a hotel]915-a hotel to [[its]915-a hotel office]921-its office , and back again , for [a boy of [Clyde]149-clyde 's years and temperament]922-a boy of clyde 's years and temperament , never occurred to [them]913-the griffiths . And it was naively assumed by [both]923-both that the pay for such work must of necessity be very small anywhere , say five or six dollars a week , and so actually below [Clyde]149-clyde 's deserts and [his]149-clyde years .

And in view of this , [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths , who was more practical than [[her]126-mrs. griffiths husband]593-her husband at all times , and who was intensely interested in [Clyde]149-clyde 's economic welfare , as well as that of [[her]126-mrs. griffiths other children]925-her other children , was actually wondering why [Clyde]149-clyde should of a sudden become so enthusiastic about changing to this new situation , which , according to [his]149-clyde own story , involved longer hours and not so very much more pay , if any . To be sure , [he]149-clyde had already suggested that it might lead to some superior position in [the hotel]769-the hotel , some clerkship or other , but [he]149-clyde did not know when that would be , and the other had promised rather definite fulfillment somewhat earlier — as to money , anyhow .

But seeing [him]149-clyde rush in on Monday afternoon and announce that [he]149-clyde had secured [the place]576-the place and that forthwith [he]149-clyde must change [his]149-clyde tie and collar and get [his]149-clyde hair cut and go back and report , [she]126-mrs. griffiths felt better about it . For never before had [she]126-mrs. griffiths seen [him]149-clyde so enthusiastic about anything , and it was something to have [him]149-clyde more content with [himself]149-clyde — not so moody , as [he]149-clyde was at times .

Yet , the hours which [he]149-clyde began to maintain now — from six in the morning until midnight — with only an occasional early return on such evenings as [he]149-clyde chose to come [home]533-home when [he]149-clyde was not working — and when [he]149-clyde troubled to explain that [he]149-clyde had been let off a little early — together with a certain eager and restless manner — a desire to be out and away from [[his]149-clyde home]490-his home at nearly all such moments as [he]149-clyde was not in bed or dressing or undressing , puzzled [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [Asa]127-asa , also . [The hotel]769-the hotel ! [The hotel]769-the hotel ! [He]149-clyde must always hurry off to [the hotel]769-the hotel , and all that [he]149-clyde had to report was that [he]149-clyde liked it ever so much , and that [he]149-clyde was doing all right , [he]149-clyde thought . It was nicer work than working around [a soda fountain]934-a soda fountain , and [he]149-clyde might be making more money pretty soon — [he]149-clyde could n't tell — but as for more than that [he]149-clyde either would n't or could n't say .

And all the time [the Griffiths]127-asa — [father]271-father and [mother]282-mother — were feeling that because of the affair in connection with [Esta]124-esta , [they]937-they should really be moving away from [Kansas City]5-kansas city — should go to [Denver]20-denver . And now more than ever , [Clyde]149-clyde was insisting that [he]149-clyde did not want to leave [Kansas City]5-kansas city . [They]937-they might go , but [he]149-clyde had a pretty good job now and wanted to stick to it . And if [they]937-they left , [he]149-clyde could get [a room]2360-a room somewhere — and would be all right — a thought which did not appeal to [them]937-they at all .

But in the meantime what an enormous change in [Clyde]149-clyde 's life . Beginning with that first evening , when at 5:45 , [he]149-clyde appeared before [Mr. Whipple]148-mr. whipple , [[his]149-clyde immediate superior]676-his immediate superior , and was approved — not only because of the fit of [his]149-clyde new uniform , but for [his]149-clyde general appearance — the world for [him]149-clyde had changed entirely . Lined up with seven others in [[the servants]940-the servants ' hall]941-the servants ' hall , immediately behind [the general offices in [the lobby]776-the lobby]942-the general offices in the lobby , and inspected by [Mr. Whipple]148-mr. whipple , [the squad of eight]944-the squad of eight marched at the stroke of six through a door that gave into [the lobby]776-the lobby on the other side of the staircase from where stood [[Mr. Whipple]148-mr. whipple 's desk]946-mr. whipple 's desk , then about and in front of [the general registration office]947-the general registration office to the long bench on the other side . The soft brown carpet under [his]149-clyde feet ; the soft , cream - tinted walls ; the snow - white bowl lights in the ceiling — all seemed to [him]149-clyde parts of a perfection and a social superiority which was almost unbelievable — so remote from all that [he]149-clyde had ever known .

[Clyde]149-clyde took the dime and the package , not knowing quite what to think . The garters must be seventy - five cents — [he]149-clyde said so . Hence only twenty - five cents need to be returned to [the man]240-the man . Then the dime was [his]149-clyde . And now , maybe — would [the man]240-the man really give [him]149-clyde another tip ?

[He]149-clyde hurried back into [the hotel]769-the hotel and up to [the elevators]879-the elevators . The strains of a string orchestra somewhere were filling [the lobby]776-the lobby with delightful sounds . [People]377-people were moving here and there — so well - dressed , so much at ease , so very different from most of [the people in [the streets]376-the streets]1007-the people in the streets or anywhere , as [he]149-clyde saw it .

An elevator door flew open . [Various guests]1009-various guests entered . " Back , [eh]2409-eh , "[240-the man] [he]240-the man called .

" [He]240-the man 's [a damned robber]2411-a damned robber , but [you]149-clyde can keep the change , just the same , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde replied , handing [him]240-the man the quarter and closing the door . [Clyde]149-clyde stood there , quite spellbound for the fraction of a second . " Thirty - five cents"—he[149-clyde] thought—"thirty - five cents . "[149-clyde] And for one little short errand . Could that really be the way things went here ? It could n't be , really . It was n't possible — not always .

And then , [his]149-clyde feet sinking in the soft nap of the carpet , [his]149-clyde hand in one pocket clutching the money , [he]149-clyde felt as if [he]149-clyde could squeal or laugh out loud . Why , thirty - five cents — and for a little service like that . [This man]365-this man had given [him]149-clyde a quarter and the other a dime and [he]149-clyde had n't done anything at all .

[He]149-clyde hurried from [the car]974-the car at the bottom — the strains of the orchestra once more fascinated [him]149-clyde , the wonder of [so well - dressed a throng]1018-so well - dressed a throng thrilling [him]149-clyde — and made [his]149-clyde way to the bench from which [he]149-clyde had first departed .

And following this [he]149-clyde had been called to carry the three bags and two umbrellas of [an aged farmer]1019-an aged farmer - like couple , who had engaged [[a parlor]1020-a parlor , [bedroom]1022-bedroom and bath on [the fifth floor]1023-the fifth floor]1021-a parlor , bedroom and bath on the fifth floor . En route [they]1019-an aged farmer kept looking at [him]149-clyde , as [he]149-clyde could see , but said nothing . "[1025-the middle - aged and rather awkward husband]

" But here , [young man]2419-young man , "[1030-the elder] went on [the elder]1030-the elder , laying off [his]149-clyde overcoat and fishing in [his]149-clyde trousers pocket . " [You]2419-young man go down and get [me]1030-the elder three or four evening papers if there are that many and a pitcher of ice - water , and [I]1030-the elder 'll give [you]2419-young man fifteen cents when [you]2419-young man get back . "[1030-the elder]

" [This hotel]791-this hotel 's better'n [the one in [Omaha]34-omaha]2421-the one in omaha , [Pa]2422-pa , "[1031-the wife] added [the wife]1031-the wife sententiously . " [It]791-this hotel 's got nicer carpets and curtains . "[1031-the wife]

And as green as [Clyde]149-clyde was , [he]149-clyde could not help smiling secretly . Openly , however , [he]149-clyde preserved a masklike solemnity , seemingly effacing all facial evidence of thought , and took the change and went out . And in a few moments [he]149-clyde was back with the ice - water and all the evening papers and departed smilingly with [his]149-clyde fifteen cents .

But this , in itself , was but a beginning in so far as this particular evening was concerned , for [he]149-clyde was scarcely seated upon the bench again , before [he]149-clyde was called to [room 529]1032-room 529 , only to be sent to the bar for drinks — two ginger ales and two syphons of soda — and this by [a group of smartly - dressed young men and girls who were laughing and chattering in [the room]577-the room]1033-a group of smartly - dressed young men and girls who were laughing and chattering in the room , one of whom opened the door just wide enough to instruct [him]149-clyde as to what was wanted . But because of a mirror over the mantel , [he]149-clyde could see [the party]1035-the party and [one pretty girl in a white suit and cap]1036-one pretty girl in a white suit and cap , sitting on the edge of a chair in which reclined [a young man who had [his]1037-a young man who had his arm about her arm about [her]1036-one pretty girl in a white suit and cap]1037-a young man who had his arm about her .

[Clyde]149-clyde stared , even while pretending not to . And in [his]149-clyde state of mind , this sight was like looking through the gates of [Paradise]35-paradise . Here were [young fellows]1038-young fellows and girls in [this room]1039-this room , not so much older than [himself]149-clyde , laughing and talking and drinking even — not ice - cream sodas and the like , but such drinks no doubt as [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father were always speaking against as leading to destruction , and apparently nothing was thought of it .

[He]149-clyde bustled down to [the bar]1042-the bar , and having secured the drinks and a charge slip , returned — and was paid — a dollar and a half for the drinks and a quarter for [himself]149-clyde . And once more [he]149-clyde had a glimpse of the appealing scene . Only now [one of [the couples]1044-the couples]1043-one of the couples was dancing to a tune sung and whistled by [the other two]1045-the other two .

But what interested [him]149-clyde as much as the visits to and glimpses of [individuals]1046-individuals in [the different rooms]1047-the different rooms , was the moving panorama of [the main lobby]1048-the main lobby — the character of [the clerks behind the main desk]1049-the clerks behind the main desk — [room clerk]1050-room clerk , [key clerk]1051-key clerk , [mail clerk]1052-mail clerk , [cashier]1053-cashier and [assistant cashier]1054-assistant cashier . And the various stands about [the place]576-the place — flower stand , news stand , cigar stand , [telegraph office]1056-telegraph office , [taxicab office]1057-taxicab office , and all manned by [individuals who seemed to [him]149-clyde curiously filled with the atmosphere of [this place]1059-this place]1058-individuals who seemed to him curiously filled with the atmosphere of this place . And then around and between all these walking or sitting were [such imposing men]1060-such imposing men and [women]631-women , [young men]1062-young men and [girls]379-girls all so fashionably dressed , [all so ruddy and contented looking]1064-all so ruddy and contented looking . And [the cars or other vehicles in which some of [them]1065-the cars or other vehicles in which some of them]1065-the cars or other vehicles in which some of them appeared about dinner time and later . It was possible for [him]149-clyde to see [them]1065-the cars or other vehicles in which some of them in the flare of the lights outside . The wraps , furs , and other belongings in which [they]1065-the cars or other vehicles in which some of them appeared , or which were often carried by [these other boys]1066-these other boys and [himself]149-clyde across [the great lobby]1067-the great lobby and into [the cars]1068-the cars or [the dining - room]1069-the dining - room or [the several elevators]1070-the several elevators . And [they]1065-the cars or other vehicles in which some of them were always of such gorgeous textures , as [Clyde]149-clyde saw [them]1065-the cars or other vehicles in which some of them . Such grandeur . This , then , most certainly was what it meant to be rich , to be [a person of consequence]1071-a person of consequence in [the world]332-the world — to have money . It meant that [you]1073-you did what [you]1073-you pleased . That [other people , like [himself]149-clyde]1074-other people , like himself , waited upon [you]1073-you . That [you]1073-you possessed all of these luxuries . That [you]1073-you went how , where and when [you]1073-you pleased .

And so , of all the influences which might have come to [Clyde]149-clyde at this time , either as an aid or an injury to [his]149-clyde development , perhaps the most dangerous for [him]149-clyde , considering [his]149-clyde temperament , was this same Green - Davidson , than which no more materially affected or gaudy a realm could have been found anywhere between [the two great American mountain ranges]1075-the two great american mountain ranges . [[Its]1076-its darkened and cushioned tea - room]1077-its darkened and cushioned tea - room , so somber and yet tinted so gayly with colored lights , was an ideal rendezvous , not only for [such inexperienced and eager flappers of the period who were to be taken by a show of luxury]1078-such inexperienced and eager flappers of the period who were to be taken by a show of luxury , but also for [those more experienced and perhaps a little faded beauties]1079-those more experienced and perhaps a little faded beauties , who had a thought for [their]1079-those more experienced and perhaps a little faded beauties complexions and the advantages of dim and uncertain lights . Also , like [most hotels of]1080-most hotels of [its]1076-its kind , [it]1076-its was frequented by [a certain type of eager and ambitious male of not certain age or station in life]1081-a certain type of eager and ambitious male of not certain age or station in life , who counted upon [his]1081-a certain type of eager and ambitious male of not certain age or station in life appearance [here]2282-here at least once , if not twice a day , at certain brisk and interesting hours , to establish for [himself]1081-a certain type of eager and ambitious male of not certain age or station in life the reputation of man - about - [town]912-town , or rounder , or [man of wealth , or taste , or attractiveness , or all]1084-man of wealth , or taste , or attractiveness , or all .

And it was not long after [Clyde]149-clyde had begun to work [here]2282-here that [he]149-clyde was informed by [these peculiar boys with whom [he]149-clyde was associated]1086-these peculiar boys with whom he was associated , one or more of whom was constantly seated with [him]149-clyde upon the " hop - bench , "[1086-these peculiar boys with whom he was associated] as [they]1086-these peculiar boys with whom he was associated called it , as to the evidence and presence even here — it was not long before various examples of the phenomena were pointed out to [him]149-clyde — of [a certain type of social pervert]1087-a certain type of social pervert , morally disarranged and socially taboo , who sought to arrest and interest [boys of]524-boys of [their]1079-those more experienced and perhaps a little faded beauties type , in order to come into some form of illicit relationship with [them]1079-those more experienced and perhaps a little faded beauties , which at first [Clyde]149-clyde could not grasp . The mere thought of it made [him]149-clyde ill . And yet [some of [these boys]386-these boys]1089-some of these boys , as [he]149-clyde was now informed — [a certain youth in particular , who was not on the same watch]1091-a certain youth in particular , who was not on the same watch with [him]149-clyde at this time — were supposed to be of [the mind that " fell for it]2423-the mind that " fell for it , "[1092-the other youths] as one of [the other youths]1092-the other youths phrased it .

And the talk and the palaver that went on in [the lobby]776-the lobby and [the grill]1094-the grill , to say nothing of [the restaurants]1095-the restaurants and [rooms]1096-rooms , were sufficient to convince [any inexperienced and none - too - discerning mind]1097-any inexperienced and none - too - discerning mind that the chief business of life for [any one with a little money or social position]1098-any one with a little money or social position was to attend a theater , a ball - game in season , or to dance , motor , entertain [friends]565-friends at dinner , or to travel to [New York]36-new york , [Europe]37-europe , [Chicago]4-chicago , [California]38-california . And there had been in the lives of [most of [these boys]386-these boys]1100-most of these boys such a lack of anything that approached comfort or taste , let alone luxury , that not unlike [Clyde]149-clyde , [they]1100-most of these boys were inclined to not only exaggerate the import of all that [they]1100-most of these boys saw , but to see in this sudden transition an opportunity to partake of it all . Who were [these people]2281-these people with money , and what had [they]1100-most of these boys done that [they]1100-most of these boys should enjoy so much luxury , where [others as good seemingly]1103-others as good seemingly as [themselves]1100-most of these boys had nothing ? And wherein did [these latter]1104-these latter differ so greatly from [the successful]1105-the successful ? [Clyde]149-clyde could not see . Yet these thoughts flashed through the minds of [every one of [these boys]386-these boys]1106-every one of these boys .

At the same time the admiration , to say nothing of the private overtures of [a certain type of woman or girl , who inhibited perhaps by the social milieu in which [she]1108-a certain type of woman or girl , who inhibited perhaps by the social milieu in which she found herself found [herself]1108-a certain type of woman or girl , who inhibited perhaps by the social milieu in which she found herself]1108-a certain type of woman or girl , who inhibited perhaps by the social milieu in which she found herself , but having means , could invade such [a region as this]1109-a region as this , and by wiles and smiles and the money [she]1108-a certain type of woman or girl , who inhibited perhaps by the social milieu in which she found herself possessed , ingratiate [herself]1108-a certain type of woman or girl , who inhibited perhaps by the social milieu in which she found herself into the favor of [some of the more attractive of [these young men here]1111-these young men here]1110-some of the more attractive of these young men here , was much commented upon .

This same Ratterer , who was short and stocky but good - looking and smiling , was so smooth and bland and generally agreeable that [Clyde]149-clyde was instantly drawn to [him]149-clyde and wished to know [him]149-clyde better . And [Ratterer]152-ratterer reciprocated that feeling , for [he]149-clyde had the notion that [Clyde]149-clyde was innocent and inexperienced and that [he]149-clyde would like to do some little thing for [him]149-clyde if [he]149-clyde could .

The conversation was interrupted by a service call , and never resumed about [this particular woman]1115-this particular woman , but the effect on [Clyde]149-clyde was sharp . [The woman]241-the woman was pleasing to look upon and exceedingly well - groomed , [her]241-the woman skin clear , [her]241-the woman eyes bright . Could what [Ratterer]152-ratterer had been telling [him]149-clyde really be true ? [She]241-the woman was so pretty . [He]149-clyde sat and gazed , a vision of something which [he]149-clyde did not care to acknowledge even to [himself]149-clyde tingling the roots of [his]149-clyde hair .

And then the temperaments and the philosophy of [these boys]386-these boys — [Kinsella]154-kinsella , short and thick and smooth - faced and a little dull , as [Clyde]149-clyde saw it , but good - looking and virile , and reported to be [a wizard at gambling]1118-a wizard at gambling , who , throughout the first three days at such times as other matters were not taking [his]149-clyde attention , had been good enough to continue [Hegglund]142-hegglund 's instructions in part . [He]1119-he was [a more suave , better spoken youth than [Hegglund]142-hegglund]1120-a more suave , better spoken youth than hegglund , though not so attractive as [Ratterer]152-ratterer , [Clyde]149-clyde thought , without [the latter]898-the latter 's sympathetic outlook , as [Clyde]149-clyde saw it .

And again , there was [Doyle]155-doyle — [Eddie]155-doyle — whom [Clyde]149-clyde found intensely interesting from the first , and of whom [he]149-clyde was not a little jealous , because [he]155-doyle was so very good - looking , so trim of figure , easy and graceful of gesture , and with so soft and pleasing a voice . [He]149-clyde went about with an indescribable air which seemed to ingratiate [him]149-clyde instantly with all with whom [he]149-clyde came in contact — [the clerks behind the counter no less than [the strangers who entered and asked this]1123-the strangers who entered and asked this or that question of [him]149-clyde]1122-the clerks behind the counter no less than the strangers who entered and asked this or that question of him . [His]149-clyde shoes and collar were so clean and trim , and [his]149-clyde hair cut and brushed and oiled after a fashion which would have become [a moving - picture actor]1124-a moving - picture actor . From the first [Clyde]149-clyde was utterly fascinated by [his]149-clyde taste in the matter of dress — the neatest of brown suits , caps , with ties and socks to match . [He]149-clyde should wear a brown - belted coat just like that . [He]149-clyde should have a brown cap . And a suit as well cut and attractive .

Similarly , a not unrelated and yet different effect was produced by [that same youth who had first introduced [Clyde]149-clyde to the work here]1125-that same youth who had first introduced clyde to the work here — [Hegglund]142-hegglund — who was [one of [the older and more experienced bell - hops]1127-the older and more experienced bell - hops , and of considerable influence with [the others]264-the others because of [his]142-hegglund genial and devil - may - care attitude toward everything , outside the exact line of [his]142-hegglund hotel duties]1126-one of the older and more experienced bell - hops , and of considerable influence with the others because of his genial and devil - may - care attitude toward everything , outside the exact line of his hotel duties . [Hegglund]142-hegglund was neither as schooled nor as attractive as some of the others , yet by reason of a most avid and dynamic disposition — plus a liberality where money and pleasure were concerned , and a courage , strength and daring which neither [Doyle]155-doyle nor [Ratterer]152-ratterer nor [Kinsella]154-kinsella could match — a strength and daring almost entirely divested of reason at times — [he]142-hegglund interested and charmed [Clyde]149-clyde immensely . As [he]142-hegglund [himself]142-hegglund related to [Clyde]149-clyde , after a time , [he]149-clyde was [the son of [a Swedish journeyman baker who some years before in [Jersey City]29-jersey city]1130-a swedish journeyman baker who some years before in jersey city had deserted [[his]1130-a swedish journeyman baker who some years before in jersey city mother]270-his mother]1129-the son of a swedish journeyman baker who some years before in jersey city had deserted his mother and left [her]270-his mother to make [her]270-his mother way as best [she]270-his mother could . In consequence neither [Oscar]142-hegglund nor [[his]142-hegglund sister]531-his sister [Martha]156-martha had had any too much education or decent social experience of any kind . On the contrary , at the age of fourteen [he]142-hegglund had left [Jersey City]29-jersey city in [a box car]1133-a box car and had been making [his]142-hegglund way ever since as best [he]142-hegglund could . And like [Clyde]149-clyde , also , [he]142-hegglund was insanely eager for all the pleasures which [he]142-hegglund had imagined [he]142-hegglund saw swirling around [him]142-hegglund , and was for prosecuting adventures in every direction , lacking , however , the nervous fear of consequence which characterized [Clyde]149-clyde . Also [he]142-hegglund had [a friend]1134-a friend , [a youth by the name of Sparser , somewhat older than [himself]142-hegglund , who was chauffeur to [a wealthy citizen of [Kansas City]5-kansas city , and who occasionally managed to purloin [a car]1137-a car and so accommodate [Hegglund]142-hegglund in the matter of brief outings here and there]1136-a wealthy citizen of kansas city , and who occasionally managed to purloin a car and so accommodate hegglund in the matter of brief outings here and there ; which courtesy , unconventional and dishonest though it might be , still caused [Hegglund]142-hegglund to feel that [he]142-hegglund was [a wonderful fellow]1138-a wonderful fellow and of much more importance than [some of [these others]1140-these others]1139-some of these others]1135-a youth by the name of sparser , somewhat older than himself , who was chauffeur to a wealthy citizen of kansas city , and who occasionally managed to purloin a car and so accommodate hegglund in the matter of brief outings here and there ; which courtesy , unconventional and dishonest though it might be , still caused hegglund to feel that he was a wonderful fellow and of much more importance than some of these others , and to lend [him]142-hegglund in [their]1139-some of these others eyes a luster which had little of the reality which it suggested to [them]1139-some of these others .

Not being as attractive as [Doyle]155-doyle , it was not so easy for [him]142-hegglund to win the attention of [girls]379-girls , and those [he]142-hegglund did succeed in interesting were not of the same charm or import by any means . For this reason [Hegglund]142-hegglund liked [Clyde]149-clyde , almost from the very first , sensing in [him]149-clyde perhaps [a pleased and willing auditor]1142-a pleased and willing auditor .

So , finding [Clyde]149-clyde on the bench beside [him]142-hegglund from time to time , [he]142-hegglund had proceeded to continue [his]142-hegglund instructions . [Kansas City]5-kansas city was [a fine place to be]1143-a fine place to be if [you]1144-you knew how to live . [He]142-hegglund had worked in [other cities]1145-other cities — [Buffalo]40-buffalo , [Cleveland]41-cleveland , [Detroit]2-detroit , [St. Louis]15-st. louis — before [he]142-hegglund came [here]2282-here , but [he]142-hegglund had not liked any of [them]1145-other cities any better , principally — which was a fact which [he]142-hegglund did not trouble to point out at the time — because [he]142-hegglund had not done as well in those places as [he]142-hegglund had [here]2282-here . [He]142-hegglund had been [a dishwasher]1148-a dishwasher , [car - cleaner]1149-car - cleaner , [plumber 's helper]1150-plumber 's helper and several other things before finally , in [Buffalo]40-buffalo , [he]142-hegglund had been inducted into the hotel business . But here :

" Say — de tips in [dis hotel]2434-dis hotel is as big as [you]2435-you 'll git anywhere , [I]1154-i know dat . An ' when [your]2435-you work 's troo , [your]2435-you time 's [your]2435-you own . [Dese fellows]2443-dese fellows [here]2282-here are [good sports]2445-good sports , all o ' [dem]2446-dem .
