[He]1154-i gave [Clyde]149-clyde the impression that [these youths]1155-these youths were [all the best of friends]1156-all the best of friends — close — all but [Doyle]155-doyle , who was a little standoffish , but not coldly so . " [He]155-doyle 's got too many [women]631-women chasin ' [him]155-doyle , dat 's all . "[155-doyle] Also that [they]1155-these youths went here and there together on occasion — to [a dance hall]1157-a dance hall , a dinner , [a certain gambling joint]1158-a certain gambling joint down near [the river]1159-the river , a certain pleasure resort—"Kate [Sweeney's"—where]157-sweeney's"—where[379-girls] were some peaches of [girls]379-girls — and so on and so forth , a world of such information as had never previously been poured into [Clyde]149-clyde 's ear , and that set [him]149-clyde meditating , dreaming , doubting , worrying and questioning as to the wisdom , charm , delight to be found in all this — also the permissibility of it in so far as [he]149-clyde was concerned . For had [he]149-clyde not been otherwise instructed in regard to all this all [his]149-clyde life long ? There was a great thrill and yet a great question involved in all to which [he]149-clyde was now listening so attentively .

Again there was [Thomas Ratterer]158-ratterer , who was of a type which at first glance , [one]489-one would have said , could scarcely prove either inimical or dangerous to [any of [the others]264-the others]1162-any of the others . [He]158-ratterer was not more than five feet four , plump , with black hair and olive skin , and with an eye that was as limpid as water and as genial as could be . [He]158-ratterer , too , as [Clyde]149-clyde learned after a time , was of [a nondescript family]1164-a nondescript family , and so had profited by no social or financial advantages of any kind . But [he]149-clyde had a way , and was liked by [all of [these youths]1155-these youths]1165-all of these youths — so much so that [he]149-clyde was consulted about nearly everything . [A native of [Wichita]42-wichita]1167-a native of wichita , recently moved to [Kansas City]5-kansas city , [he]149-clyde and [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister were [the principal support of [a widowed mother]1170-a widowed mother]1169-the principal support of a widowed mother . During [their]1165-all of these youths earlier and formative years , [both]923-both had seen [[their]1165-all of these youths very good - natured and sympathetic mother , of whom [they]1165-all of these youths were honestly fond , spurned and abused by [a faithless husband]1173-a faithless husband]1172-their very good - natured and sympathetic mother , of whom they were honestly fond , spurned and abused by a faithless husband . There had been times when [they]1165-all of these youths were quite without food . On more than one occasion [they]1165-all of these youths had been ejected for non - payment of rent . None too continuously [Tommy]158-ratterer and [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister had been maintained in [various public schools]1175-various public schools . Finally , at the age of fourteen [he]149-clyde had decamped to [Kansas City]5-kansas city , where [he]149-clyde had secured different odd jobs , until [he]149-clyde succeeded in connecting [himself]149-clyde with [the Green - Davidson]44-the green - davidson , and was later joined by [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and sister who had removed from [Wichita]42-wichita to [Kansas City]5-kansas city to be with [him]149-clyde .

But even more than by the luxury of [the hotel]769-the hotel or [these youths]1155-these youths , whom swiftly and yet surely [he]149-clyde was beginning to decipher , [Clyde]149-clyde was impressed by the downpour of small change that was tumbling in upon [him]149-clyde and making a small lump in [his]149-clyde right - hand pants pocket — dimes , nickels , quarters and half - dollars even , which increased and increased even on the first day until by nine o'clock [he]149-clyde already had over four dollars in [his]149-clyde pocket , and by twelve , at which hour [he]149-clyde went off duty , [he]149-clyde had over six and a half — as much as previously [he]149-clyde had earned in a week .

And of all this , as [he]149-clyde then knew , [he]149-clyde need only hand [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires one — no more , [Hegglund]142-hegglund had said — and the rest , five dollars and a half , for one evening 's interesting — yes , delightful and fascinating — work , belonged to [himself]149-clyde . [He]149-clyde could scarcely believe it . It seemed fantastic , Aladdinish , really . Nevertheless , at twelve , exactly , of that first day a gong had sounded somewhere — a shuffle of feet had been heard and [three boys]1179-three boys had appeared — one to take [Barnes]150-mr. barnes ' place at the desk , [the other two]1045-the other two to answer calls . And at the command of [Barnes]150-mr. barnes , [the eight who were present]1181-the eight who were present were ordered to rise , right dress and march away . And in [the hall outside]1182-the hall outside , and just as [he]149-clyde was leaving , [Clyde]149-clyde approached [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires and handed [him]140-mr. squires a dollar in silver . " That 's right , "[140-mr. squires] [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires remarked . No more . Then , [Clyde]149-clyde , along with [the others]264-the others , descended to [[his]149-clyde locker]1184-his locker , changed [his]149-clyde clothes and walked out into [the darkened streets]1185-the darkened streets , a sense of luck and a sense of responsibility as to future luck so thrilling [him]149-clyde as to make [him]149-clyde rather tremulous — giddy , even .

To think that now , at last , [he]149-clyde actually had such a place . To think that [he]149-clyde could earn this much every day , maybe . [He]149-clyde began to walk toward [[his]149-clyde home]490-his home , [his]149-clyde first thought being that [he]149-clyde must sleep well and so be fit for [his]149-clyde duties in the morning . But thinking that [he]149-clyde would not need to return to [the hotel]769-the hotel before 11:30 the next day , [he]149-clyde wandered into [an all - night beanery]1188-an all - night beanery to have a cup of coffee and some pie . And now all [he]149-clyde was thinking was that [he]149-clyde would only need to work from noon until six , when [he]149-clyde should be free until the following morning at six . And then [he]149-clyde would make more money . A lot of it to spend on [himself]149-clyde .

The thing that most interested [Clyde]149-clyde at first was how , if at all , [he]149-clyde was to keep the major portion of all this money [he]149-clyde was making for [himself]149-clyde . For ever since [he]149-clyde had been working and earning money , it had been assumed that [he]149-clyde would contribute a fair portion of all that [he]149-clyde received — at least three - fourths of the smaller salaries [he]149-clyde had received up to this time — toward the upkeep of [the home]1189-the home . But now , if [he]149-clyde announced that [he]149-clyde was receiving at least twenty - five dollars a week and more — and this entirely apart from the salary of fifteen a month and board — [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents would assuredly expect [him]149-clyde to pay ten or twelve .

But so long had [he]149-clyde been haunted by the desire to make [himself]149-clyde as attractive looking as [any other well - dressed boy]1191-any other well - dressed boy that , now that [he]149-clyde had the opportunity , [he]149-clyde could not resist the temptation to equip [himself]149-clyde first and as speedily as possible . Accordingly , [he]149-clyde decided to say to [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother that all of the tips [he]149-clyde received aggregated no more than a dollar a day . And , in order to give [himself]149-clyde greater freedom of action in the matter of disposing of [his]149-clyde spare time , [he]149-clyde announced that frequently , in addition to the long hours demanded of [him]149-clyde every other day , [he]149-clyde was expected to take the place of [other boys who were sick or set to doing other things]1193-other boys who were sick or set to doing other things . And also , [he]149-clyde explained that [the management]1194-the management demanded of [all boys]651-all boys that [they]651-all boys look well outside as well as inside [the hotel]769-the hotel . [He]149-clyde could not long be seen coming to [the hotel]769-the hotel in the clothes that [he]149-clyde now wore . [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires , [he]149-clyde said , had hinted as much . But , as if to soften the blow , [one of [the boys at [the hotel]769-the hotel]1199-the boys at the hotel]1198-one of the boys at the hotel had told [him]149-clyde of [a place where [he]149-clyde could procure quite all the things that [he]149-clyde needed on time]1201-a place where he could procure quite all the things that he needed on time .

And so unsophisticated was [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother in these matters that [she]270-his mother believed [him]149-clyde .

But that was not all . [He]149-clyde was now daily in contact with [a type of youth who , because of [his]149-clyde larger experience with [the world]332-the world and with the luxuries and vices of such a life as this]1203-a type of youth who , because of his larger experience with the world and with the luxuries and vices of such a life as this , had already been inducted into certain forms of libertinism and vice even which up to this time were entirely foreign to [Clyde]149-clyde 's knowledge and set [him]149-clyde agape with wonder and at first with even a timorous distaste . Thus , as [Hegglund]142-hegglund had pointed out , [a certain percentage of [this group , of which [Clyde]149-clyde was now one]1206-this group , of which clyde was now one]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one , made common cause in connection with quite regular adventures which usually followed [their]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one monthly pay night . These adventures , according to [their]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one moods and [their]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one cash at the time , led [them]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one usually either to [one of [two rather famous and not too respectable all - night restaurants]1208-two rather famous and not too respectable all - night restaurants]1207-one of two rather famous and not too respectable all - night restaurants . In [groups]1209-groups , as [he]149-clyde gathered by degrees from hearing [them]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one talk , [they]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one were pleased to indulge in occasional late showy suppers with drinks , after which [they]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one were wo nt to go to either [some flashy dance hall of [the downtown]1211-the downtown section]1210-some flashy dance hall of the downtown section to pick up [a girl]627-a girl , or that failing as a source of group interest , to visit some notorious — or as [they]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one would have deemed it reputed — brothel , very frequently camouflaged as [a boarding house]1213-a boarding house , where for much less than the amount of cash in [their]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one possession [they]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one could , as [they]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one often boasted , " have [any girl in [the house]2453-the house]2452-any girl in the house . "[1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one] And here , of course , because of [their]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one known youth , ignorance , liberality , and uniform geniality and good looks , [they]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one were made much of , as a rule , being made most welcome by [the various madames and girls of these places who sought , for commercial reasons of course , to interest [them]1205-a certain percentage of this group , of which clyde was now one to come again]1214-the various madames and girls of these places who sought , for commercial reasons of course , to interest them to come again .

And so starved had been [Clyde]149-clyde 's life up to this time and so eager was [he]149-clyde for almost any form of pleasure , that from the first [he]149-clyde listened with all too eager ears to any account of anything that spelled adventure or pleasure . Not that [he]149-clyde approved of these types of adventures . As a matter of fact at first it offended and depressed [him]149-clyde , seeing as [he]149-clyde did that it ran counter to all [he]149-clyde had heard and been told to believe these many years . Nevertheless so sharp a change and relief from the dreary and repressed work in which [he]149-clyde had been brought up was it , that [he]149-clyde could not help thinking of all this with an itch for the variety and color it seemed to suggest . [He]149-clyde listened sympathetically and eagerly , even while at times [he]149-clyde was mentally disapproving of what [he]149-clyde heard . And seeing [him]149-clyde so sympathetic and genial , first one and then [another of [these youths]1155-these youths]1215-another of these youths made overtures to [him]149-clyde to go here , there or [the other place]1217-the other place — to a show , [a restaurant]312-a restaurant , [one of [[their]1155-these youths homes]1220-their homes]1219-one of their homes , where a card game might be indulged in by two or three of [them]1155-these youths , or even to one of [the shameless houses]1221-the shameless houses , contact with which [Clyde]149-clyde at first resolutely refused . But by degrees , becoming familiar with [Hegglund]142-hegglund and [Ratterer]158-ratterer , both of whom [he]149-clyde liked very much , and being invited by [them]1155-these youths to a joy - night supper — a " blow - out "[158-ratterer] as [they]1155-these youths termed it , at [Frissell's]160-frissell's — [he]149-clyde decided to go .

" There 's going to be another one of [our]1155-these youths montly blow - outs to - morrow night , [Clyde]149-clyde , around at [Frissell 's]43-frissell 's , "[158-ratterer] [Ratterer]158-ratterer had said to [him]149-clyde . " Do n't [you]149-clyde want to come along ? [You]149-clyde have n't been yet . "[158-ratterer]

By this time , [Clyde]149-clyde , having acclimated [himself]149-clyde to this caloric atmosphere , was by no means as dubious as [he]149-clyde was at first . For by now , in imitation of [Doyle]155-doyle , whom [he]149-clyde had studied most carefully and to great advantage , [he]149-clyde had outfitted [himself]149-clyde with a new brown suit , cap , overcoat , socks , stickpin and shoes as near like those of [[his]149-clyde mentor]1222-his mentor as possible . And [the costume]1223-the costume became [him]149-clyde well — excellently well — so much so that [he]149-clyde was far more attractive than [he]149-clyde had ever been in [his]149-clyde life , and now , not only [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents , but [[his]149-clyde younger brother]658-his younger brother and [sister]1226-sister , were not a little astonished and even amazed by the change .

How could [Clyde]149-clyde have come by all this grandeur so speedily ? How much could all this that [he]149-clyde wore now have cost ? Was [he]149-clyde not hypothecating more of [his]149-clyde future earnings for this temporary grandeur than was really wise ? [He]149-clyde might need it in the future . [The other children]254-the other children needed things , too . And was the moral and spiritual atmosphere of [a place that made [him]149-clyde work such long hours and kept [him]149-clyde out so late every day]1228-a place that made him work such long hours and kept him out so late every day , and for so little pay , just the place to work ?

To all of which , [he]149-clyde had replied , rather artfully for [him]149-clyde , that it was all for the best , [he]149-clyde was not working too hard . [His]149-clyde clothes were not too fine , by any means — [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother should see [some of [the other boys]1231-the other boys]1230-some of the other boys . [He]149-clyde was not spending too much money . And , anyhow , [he]149-clyde had a long while in which to pay for all [he]149-clyde had bought .

But now , as to this supper . That was a different matter , even to [him]149-clyde . How , [he]149-clyde asked [himself]149-clyde , in case the thing lasted until very late as was expected , could [he]149-clyde explain to [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father [his]149-clyde remaining out so very late . [Ratterer]158-ratterer had said it might last until three or four , anyhow , although [he]158-ratterer might go , of course , any time , but how would that look , deserting [the crowd]1234-the crowd ? And yet hang it all , [most of [them]1231-the other boys]1235-most of them did not live at [home]533-home as [he]158-ratterer did , or if [they]1235-most of them did like [Ratterer]158-ratterer , [they]1235-most of them had [parents who did n't mind what [they]1235-most of them did]1237-parents who did n't mind what they did . Still , a late supper like that — was it wise ? [All these boys]1238-all these boys drank and thought nothing of it — [Hegglund]142-hegglund , [Ratterer]158-ratterer , [Kinsella]154-kinsella , [Shiel]161-shiel . It must be silly for [him]158-ratterer to think that there was so much danger in drinking a little , as [they]1238-all these boys did on these occasions . On the other hand it was true that [he]158-ratterer need not drink unless [he]158-ratterer wanted to . [He]158-ratterer could go , and if anything was said at [home]533-home , [he]158-ratterer would say that [he]158-ratterer had to work late . What difference did it make if [he]158-ratterer stayed out late once in a while ? Was n't [he]158-ratterer [a man]1240-a man now ? Was n't [he]158-ratterer making more money than [any one else in the family]1241-any one else in the family ? And could n't [he]158-ratterer begin to do as [he]158-ratterer pleased ?

[He]158-ratterer began to sense the delight of personal freedom — to sniff the air of personal and delicious romance — and [he]158-ratterer was not to be held back by any suggestion which [[his]158-ratterer mother]270-his mother could now make .

And so the interesting dinner , with [Clyde]149-clyde attending , came to pass . And it was partaken of at [Frissell 's]43-frissell 's , as [Ratterer]158-ratterer had said . And by now [Clyde]149-clyde , having come to be on genial terms with [all of [these youths]1155-these youths]1165-all of these youths , was in the gayest of moods about it all . Think of [his]149-clyde new state in life , anyhow . Only a few weeks ago [he]149-clyde was all alone , not [a boy friend]1245-a boy friend , scarcely [a boy acquaintance in [the world]332-the world]1246-a boy acquaintance in the world ! And here [he]149-clyde was , so soon after , going to this fine dinner with [this interesting group]1248-this interesting group .

And true to the illusions of youth , [the place]576-the place appeared far more interesting than [it]576-the place really was . [It]576-the place was little more than [an excellent chop - house of [the older American order]1251-the older american order]1250-an excellent chop - house of the older american order . [Its]576-the place walls were hung thick with signed pictures of [actors]1252-actors and [actresses]699-actresses , together with playbills of various periods . And because of the general excellence of the food , to say nothing of the geniality of [[its]576-the place present manager]1254-its present manager , [it]576-the place had become the hangout of [passing actors]1255-passing actors , [politicians]1256-politicians , [local business men]1257-local business men , and after [them]1258-them , the generality of [followers who are always drawn by that which presents something a little different to that with which]1259-followers who are always drawn by that which presents something a little different to that with which [they]1259-followers who are always drawn by that which presents something a little different to that with which are familiar .

And [these boys]386-these boys , having heard at one time and another from [cab and taxi drivers]1261-cab and taxi drivers that this was one of [the best places in [town]912-town]1262-the best places in town , fixed upon [it]576-the place for [their]386-these boys monthly dinners . Single plates of anything cost from sixty cents to a dollar . Coffee and tea were served in pots only . [You]1264-you could get anything [you]1264-you wanted to drink . To the left of [the main room]1265-the main room as [you]1264-you went in was [a darker and low - ceilinged room with a fireplace , to which only [men]447-men resorted and sat and smoked , and read papers after dinner]1266-a darker and low - ceilinged room with a fireplace , to which only men resorted and sat and smoked , and read papers after dinner , and it was for [this room]1039-this room that [these youths]1155-these youths reserved [their]1155-these youths greatest admiration . And [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Hegglund]142-hegglund , to whom by now [Clyde]149-clyde had become very much attached , as well as [most of [the others]264-the others]1272-most of the others , were satisfied that there was not another place in [all [Kansas City]5-kansas city that was really as good]1274-all kansas city that was really as good .

And so this day , having drawn [their]1155-these youths pay at noon , and being off at six for the night , [they]1155-these youths gathered outside [the hotel]769-the hotel at the corner nearest [the drug store at which [Clyde]149-clyde had originally applied for work]1276-the drug store at which clyde had originally applied for work , and were off in a happy , noisy frame of mind — [Hegglund]142-hegglund , [Ratterer]158-ratterer , [Paul Shiel]161-shiel , [Davis Higby]162-higby , [another youth]1277-another youth , [Arthur Kinsella]154-kinsella and [Clyde]149-clyde .

[They]1279-they had now turned two corners , crossed [two different streets]1280-two different streets and , in group formation , were making [their]1279-they way through the main door of [Frissell 's]43-frissell 's , which gave in on the reflection of lights upon china and silverware and faces , and the buzz and clatter of [a dinner crowd]1281-a dinner crowd . [They]1279-they made [their]1279-they way to a group of tables which faced a leather wall - seat . " Now , [me]142-hegglund for [a good old Manhattan]2484-a good old manhattan , to begin wit ' , "[142-hegglund] exclaimed [Hegglund]142-hegglund avidly , looking about on [the crowd in [the room]577-the room]1285-the crowd in the room and feeling that now indeed [he]142-hegglund was [a person]467-a person . And similarly , [Arthur Kinsella]154-kinsella , once [he]142-hegglund was in [here]2282-here , seemed to perk up and take heart of [his]142-hegglund present glory . " Who , [me]149-clyde ? Oh , [me]149-clyde , "[149-clyde] exclaimed [Clyde]149-clyde , not a little disturbed by this inquiry , for up to now — this very hour , in fact — [he]149-clyde had never touched anything stronger than coffee or ice - cream soda . [He]149-clyde had been not a little taken back by the brisk and sophisticated way in which [these youths]1155-these youths ordered cocktails and whisky . Surely [he]149-clyde could not go so far as that , and yet , so well had [he]149-clyde known long before this , from the conversation of [these youths]1155-these youths , that on such occasions as this [they]1155-these youths did drink , that [he]149-clyde did not see how [he]149-clyde could very well hold back . What would [they]1155-these youths think of [him]149-clyde if [he]149-clyde did n't drink something ? For ever since [he]149-clyde had been among [them]1155-these youths , [he]149-clyde had been trying to appear as much of [a man of [the world]332-the world]1297-a man of the world as [they]1155-these youths were . And yet back of [him]149-clyde , as [he]149-clyde could plainly feel , lay all of the years in which [he]149-clyde had been drilled in the " horrors "[1297-a man of the world] of drink and evil companionship . And even though in [his]149-clyde heart this long while [he]149-clyde had secretly rebelled against nearly all the texts and maxims to which [[his]149-clyde parents]347-his parents were always alluding , deeply resenting really as worthless and pointless [the ragamuffin crew of wasters]1300-the ragamuffin crew of wasters and failures whom [they]1155-these youths were always seeking to save , still , now [he]149-clyde was inclined to think and hesitate . Should [he]149-clyde or should [he]149-clyde not drink ?

For the fraction of an instant only , while all these things in [him]149-clyde now spoke , [he]149-clyde hesitated , then added : " Why , [I]149-clyde , oh — [I]149-clyde think [I]149-clyde 'll take Rhine wine and seltzer , too . "[149-clyde] It was the easiest and safest thing to say , as [he]149-clyde saw it . Already the rather temperate and even innocuous character of Rhine wine and seltzer had been emphasized by [Hegglund]142-hegglund and [all the others]1301-all the others . And yet [Ratterer]158-ratterer was taking it — a thing which made [his]158-ratterer choice less conspicuous and , as [he]158-ratterer felt , less ridiculous .

" [That joint]2492-that joint , "[149-clyde] thought [Clyde]149-clyde on hearing it . And [he]149-clyde would be expected — could [he]149-clyde — would [he]149-clyde ?

For the first time in [his]149-clyde life now , [he]149-clyde found [himself]149-clyde confronted by a choice as to [his]149-clyde desire for the more accurate knowledge of the one great fascinating mystery that had for so long confronted and fascinated and baffled and yet frightened [him]149-clyde a little . For , despite all [his]149-clyde many thoughts in regard to all this and [women in general]1308-women in general , [he]149-clyde had never been in contact with any one of [them]1309-them in this way . And now — now —

All of a sudden [he]149-clyde felt faint thrills of hot and cold racing up and down [his]149-clyde back and all over [him]149-clyde . [His]149-clyde hands and face grew hot and then became moist — then [his]149-clyde cheeks and forehead flamed . [He]149-clyde could feel them . Strange , swift , enticing and yet disturbing thoughts raced in and out of [his]149-clyde consciousness . [His]149-clyde hair tingled and [he]149-clyde saw pictures — bacchanalian scenes — which swiftly , and yet in vain , [he]149-clyde sought to put out of [his]149-clyde mind . [They]1310-they would keep coming back . And [he]149-clyde wanted [them]1310-they to come back . Yet [he]149-clyde did not . And through it all [he]149-clyde was now a little afraid . [Pshaw]46-pshaw ! Had [he]149-clyde no courage at all ? [These other fellows]1311-these other fellows were not disturbed by the prospects of what was before [them]1311-these other fellows . [They]1311-these other fellows were very gay . And so the dinner proceeded . And it was nearly eleven before [they]1320-they had exhausted the various matters of interest to [them]1320-they — stories of past affairs , past jobs , past feats of daring . And by then [Clyde]149-clyde had had considerable time to meditate on [all of [these youths]1155-these youths]1165-all of these youths — and [he]149-clyde was inclined to think that [he]149-clyde was not nearly as green as [they]1320-they thought , or if so , at least shrewder than most of [them]1320-they — of a better mentality , really . For had [he]149-clyde not already heard that the most dreadful of diseases were occasionally contracted in just such places — and that [men]447-men died miserable deaths later because of low vices begun in this fashion ? [He]149-clyde could hear [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother lecturing concerning all this — yet with scarcely any direct knowledge of any kind . [One]489-one could feel it in [this dark street]1353-this dark street . The very fleshly sumptuousness of most of these figures , dull and unromantic as might be the brains that directed [them]1370-nine girls of varying ages and looks , interested [him]149-clyde for the time being . After all , here was beauty of a gross , fleshly character , revealed and purchasable . And there were no difficulties of mood or inhibitions to overcome in connection with [any of [these girls]696-these girls]1373-any of these girls . [One of [them]696-these girls]1375-one of them , [a quite pretty brunette in a black and red costume with a band of red ribbon across [her]1375-one of them forehead]1376-a quite pretty brunette in a black and red costume with a band of red ribbon across her forehead , seemed to be decidedly at [home]533-home with [Higby]162-higby , for already [she]1375-one of them was dancing with [him]162-higby in [the back room]1378-the back room to a jazz melody most irrationally hammered out upon the piano .

The effect of this adventure on [Clyde]149-clyde was such as might have been expected in connection with one so new and strange to such [a world as this]1428-a world as this . In spite of all that deep and urgent curiosity and desire that had eventually led [him]149-clyde to [that place]1429-that place and caused [him]149-clyde to yield , still , because of the moral precepts with which [he]149-clyde had so long been familiar , and also because of the nervous esthetic inhibitions which were characteristic of [him]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde could not but look back upon all this as decidedly degrading and sinful . [[His]149-clyde parents]347-his parents were probably right when [they]347-his parents preached that this was all low and shameful . And yet this whole adventure and [the world]332-the world in which it was laid , once it was all over , was lit with a kind of gross , pagan beauty or vulgar charm for [him]149-clyde . And until other and more interesting things had partially effaced it , [he]149-clyde could not help thinking back upon it with considerable interest and pleasure , even .

In addition [he]149-clyde kept telling [himself]149-clyde that now , having as much money as [he]149-clyde was making , [he]149-clyde could go and do about as [he]149-clyde pleased . [He]149-clyde need not go [there]443-there any more if [he]149-clyde did not want to , but [he]149-clyde could go to [other places that might not be as low , maybe — more refined]1433-other places that might not be as low , maybe — more refined . [He]149-clyde would n't want to go with [a crowd like that]1434-a crowd like that again . [He]149-clyde would rather have just [one girl]1435-one girl somewhere if [he]149-clyde could find [her]1435-one girl — [a girl such as those with whom [he]149-clyde had seen [Sieberling]136-a mr. sieberling and [Doyle]155-doyle associate]1436-a girl such as those with whom he had seen sieberling and doyle associate . And so , despite all of [his]149-clyde troublesome thoughts of the night before , [he]149-clyde was thus won quickly over to this new source of pleasure if not its primary setting . [He]149-clyde must find [a free pagan girl of [his]149-clyde own]1437-a free pagan girl of his own somewhere if [he]149-clyde could , like [Doyle]155-doyle , and spend [his]149-clyde money on [her]1435-one girl . And [he]149-clyde could scarcely wait until opportunity should provide [him]149-clyde with the means of gratifying [himself]149-clyde in this way .

But more interesting and more to [his]149-clyde purpose at the time was the fact that both [Hegglund]142-hegglund and [Ratterer]158-ratterer , in spite of , or possibly because of , a secret sense of superiority which [they]1438-they detected in [Clyde]149-clyde , were inclined to look upon [him]149-clyde with no little interest and to court [him]149-clyde and to include [him]149-clyde among all [their]1438-they thoughts of affairs and pleasures . Indeed , shortly after [his]149-clyde first adventure , [Ratterer]158-ratterer invited [him]149-clyde to come to [[his]158-ratterer home]490-his home , where , as [Clyde]149-clyde most quickly came to see , was a life very different from [his]149-clyde own . At [the Griffiths]130-samuel griffiths ' all was so solemn and reserved , the still moods of [those who feel the pressure of dogma and conviction]1440-those who feel the pressure of dogma and conviction . In [[Ratterer]158-ratterer 's home]1441-ratterer 's home , the reverse of this was nearly true . [The mother]263-the mother and sister with whom [he]158-ratterer lived , while [not without some moral although no particular religious convictions]1443-not without some moral although no particular religious convictions , were inclined to view life with a great deal of generosity or , as [a moralist]1444-a moralist would have seen it , laxity . There had never been any keen moral or characterful direction there at all . And so it was that [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [[his]158-ratterer sister]531-his sister [Louise]173-louise , who was two years younger than [himself]158-ratterer , now did about as [they]1446-they pleased , and without thinking very much about it . But [[his]158-ratterer sister]531-his sister chanced to be shrewd or individual enough not to wish to cast [herself]531-his sister away on just any one .

The interesting part of all this was that [Clyde]149-clyde , in spite of a certain strain of refinement which caused [him]149-clyde to look askance at most of this , was still fascinated by the crude picture of life and liberty which it offered . Among such as these , at least , [he]149-clyde could go , do , be as [he]149-clyde had never gone or done or been before . And particularly was [he]149-clyde pleased and enlightened — or rather dubiously liberated — in connection with [his]149-clyde nervousness and uncertainty in regard to [his]149-clyde charm or fascination for [girls of [his]149-clyde own years]1448-girls of his own years . For up to this very time , and in spite of [his]149-clyde recent first visit to [the erotic temple to which [Hegglund]142-hegglund and [the others]264-the others had led [him]149-clyde]1449-the erotic temple to which hegglund and the others had led him , [he]149-clyde was still convinced that [he]149-clyde had no skill with or charm where [girls]379-girls were concerned . [Their]379-girls mere proximity or approach was sufficient to cause [him]149-clyde to recede mentally , to chill or palpitate nervously , and to lose what little natural skill [he]149-clyde had for conversation or poised banter such as [other youths]1452-other youths possessed . But now , in [his]149-clyde visits to [the home of [Ratterer]158-ratterer]1453-the home of ratterer , as [he]149-clyde soon discovered , [he]149-clyde was to have ample opportunity to test whether this shyness and uncertainty could be overcome .

For [it]1453-the home of ratterer was a center for [the friends of [Ratterer]158-ratterer]1454-the friends of ratterer and [[his]158-ratterer sister]531-his sister , who were more or less of one mood in regard to life . Dancing , card - playing , love - making rather open and unashamed , went on there . Indeed , up to this time , [Clyde]149-clyde would not have imagined that [a parent]1456-a parent like [Mrs. Ratterer]152-ratterer could have been as lackadaisical or indifferent as [she]152-ratterer was , apparently , to conduct and morals generally . [He]149-clyde would not have imagined that [any mother]1457-any mother would have countenanced the easy camaraderie that existed between the sexes in [[Mrs. Ratterer]152-ratterer 's home]1458-mrs. ratterer 's home .

And very soon , because of several cordial invitations which were extended to [him]149-clyde by [Ratterer]152-ratterer , [he]149-clyde found [himself]149-clyde part and parcel of [this group]1459-this group — a group which from one point of view — the ideas held by [[its]1459-this group members]1460-its members , the rather wretched English [they]1460-its members spoke — [he]149-clyde looked down upon . From another point of view — the freedom [they]1460-its members possessed , the zest with which [they]1460-its members managed to contrive social activities and exchanges — [he]149-clyde was drawn to [them]1460-its members . Because , for the first time , these permitted [him]149-clyde , if [he]149-clyde chose , to have [a girl of [his]149-clyde own]1461-a girl of his own , if only [he]149-clyde could summon the courage . And this , owing to the well - meant ministrations of [Ratterer]152-ratterer and [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister and [[their]1460-its members friends]1463-their friends , [he]149-clyde soon sought to accomplish . Indeed the thing began on the occasion of [his]149-clyde first visit to [the Ratterers]1464-the ratterers .

[Louise]173-louise worked in [a dry - goods store]1465-a dry - goods store and often came [home]533-home a little late for dinner . On this occasion [she]173-louise did not appear until seven , and the eating of the family meal was postponed accordingly . In the meantime , [two girl friends of [Louise]173-louise]1467-two girl friends of louise arrived to consult [her]173-louise in connection with something , and finding [her]173-louise delayed , and [Ratterer]152-ratterer and [Clyde]149-clyde there , [they]1467-two girl friends of louise made [themselves]1467-two girl friends of louise at [home]533-home , rather impressed and interested by [Clyde]149-clyde and [his]149-clyde new finery . And now the thought of being near [her]174-hortense , being able to dance with [her]174-hortense again , drew [him]149-clyde so greatly that , despite the fact that [three youths]1505-three youths , among [them]1505-three youths that same [Bert Gettler]179-bert gettler , appeared on the scene to escort [them]1505-three youths , and although [he]149-clyde and [Ratterer]158-ratterer had previously agreed to go to [a theater]663-a theater together , [he]149-clyde could not help showing how much [he]149-clyde would prefer to follow [those others]1507-those others — so much so that [Ratterer]158-ratterer finally agreed to abandon the theater idea . The party proved nothing more than one of those ebullitions of the youthful mating period . [The house of [Kittie Keane]177-kittie keane]1510-the house of kittie keane was little more than [a cottage in [a poor street under bare December trees]1512-a poor street under bare december trees]1511-a cottage in a poor street under bare december trees . But to [Clyde]149-clyde , because of the passion for a pretty face that was suddenly lit in [him]149-clyde , it had the color and the form and gayety of romance itself . And [the young girls]1513-the young girls and boys that [he]149-clyde met [there]443-there — [girls]379-girls and [boys of the Ratterer]1516-boys of the ratterer , [Hegglund]142-hegglund , [Hortense stripe]174-hortense — were still of the very substance and texture of that energy , ease and forwardness which [he]149-clyde would have given [his]149-clyde soul to possess . And curiously enough , in spite of a certain nervousness on [his]149-clyde part , [he]149-clyde was by reason of [[his]149-clyde new companions]1517-his new companions made an integral part of the gayeties .

And on this occasion [he]149-clyde was destined to view a type of [girl]256-girl and [youth]1519-youth in action such as previously it had not been [his]149-clyde fortune or misfortune , as [you]1520-you will , to see . There was , for instance , a type of sensual dancing which [Louise]173-louise and [Hortense]174-hortense and [Greta]175-greta indulged in with the greatest nonchalance and assurance . At the same time , [many of [these youths]1155-these youths]1521-many of these youths carried whisky in a hip flask , from which [they]1521-many of these youths not only drank [themselves]1521-many of these youths , but gave [others]280-others to drink — [boys]296-boys and [girls]379-girls indiscriminately .

And the general hilarity for this reason being not a little added to , [they]1155-these youths fell into more intimate relations — spooning with [one and another]1526-one and another — [Hortense]174-hortense and [Louise]173-louise and [Greta]175-greta included . Also to quarreling at times . And it appeared to be nothing out of the ordinary , as [Clyde]149-clyde saw , for [one youth]1527-one youth or another to embrace [a girl behind a door]1528-a girl behind a door , to hold [her]1528-a girl behind a door on [his]149-clyde lap in a chair in some secluded corner , to lie with [her]1528-a girl behind a door on a sofa , whispering intimate and unquestionably welcome things to [her]1528-a girl behind a door . And this for a time so discouraged and at the same time incensed [him]149-clyde that [he]149-clyde felt [he]149-clyde could not and would not have anything more to do with [her]174-hortense — [she]174-hortense was too cheap , vulgar , inconsiderate .

At the same time , having partaken of the various drinks offered [him]149-clyde — so as not to seem less worldly wise than the others — until brought to a state of courage and daring not ordinarily characteristic of [him]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde ventured to half plead with and at the same time half reproach [her]174-hortense for [her]174-hortense too lax conduct .
