' [He]189-mr. beck knew [he]189-mr. beck was bluffing and that [I]149-clyde did , too . [I]149-clyde had to laugh . An ' [I]149-clyde saw [him]189-mr. beck laughin ' with [Mr. Scott]192-mr. scott about two minutes later . But , gee , [I]149-clyde certainly do pull some raw stuff around there at times . "[149-clyde]

By then [she]1576-her and [Clyde]149-clyde , with scarcely a word on [his]149-clyde part , and much to [his]149-clyde ease and relief , had reached [[Frissell]43-frissell 's 's]1577-frissell 's . And for the first time in [his]149-clyde life [he]149-clyde had the satisfaction of escorting [a girl]627-a girl to a table in such a place . Now [he]149-clyde really was beginning to have a few experiences worthy of the name . [He]149-clyde was quite on edge with the romance of it . Because of [her]1576-her very high estimate of [herself]1576-her , [her]1576-her very emphatic picture of [herself]1576-her as one who was intimate with [so many youths]1579-so many youths and [girls who were having a good time]1580-girls who were having a good time , [he]149-clyde felt that up to this hour [he]149-clyde had not lived at all . Swiftly [he]149-clyde thought of the different things [she]1576-her had told [him]149-clyde — [Burkett]187-burkett 's on the Big Blue , skating and dancing on the ice — [Charlie Trone]194-charlie trone — [the young tobacco clerk with whom [she]1576-her had had the engagement for to - night]1581-the young tobacco clerk with whom she had had the engagement for to - night — [Mr. Beck]189-mr. beck at [the store]673-the store who was so struck on [her]1576-her that [he]189-mr. beck could n't bring [himself]189-mr. beck to fire [her]1576-her . And as [he]149-clyde saw [her]1576-her order whatever [she]1576-her liked , without any thought of [his]149-clyde purse , [he]149-clyde contemplated quickly [her]1576-her face , figure , the shape of [her]1576-her hands , so suggestive always of the delicacy or roundness of the arm , the swell of [her]1576-her bust , already very pronounced , the curve of [her]1576-her eyebrows , the rounded appeal of [her]1576-her smooth cheeks and chin . There was something also about the tone of [her]1576-her voice , unctuous , smooth , which somehow appealed to and disturbed [him]149-clyde . To [him]149-clyde it was delicious . [Gee]153-gee , if [he]149-clyde could only have [such a girl]1583-such a girl all for [himself]149-clyde !

And in [here]2282-here , as without , [she]1576-her clattered on about [herself]1576-her , not at all impressed , apparently , by the fact that [she]1576-her was dining [here]2282-here , [a place that to [him]149-clyde]1586-a place that to him had seemed quite remarkable . When [she]1576-her was not looking at [herself]1576-her in a mirror , [she]1576-her was studying the bill of fare and deciding what [she]1576-her liked — lamb with mint jelly — no omelette , no beef — oh , yes , filet of mignon with mushrooms . [She]1576-her finally compromised on that with celery and cauliflower . And [she]1576-her would like a cocktail . Oh , yes , [Clyde]149-clyde had heard [Hegglund]142-hegglund say that no meal was worth anything without a few drinks , so now [he]142-hegglund had mildly suggested a cocktail . And having secured that and a second , [she]1576-her seemed warmer and gayer and more gossipy than ever .

But all the while , as [Clyde]149-clyde noticed , [her]1576-her attitude in so far as [he]149-clyde was concerned was rather distant — impersonal . If for so much as a moment , [he]149-clyde ventured to veer the conversation ever so slightly to [themselves]1587-themselves , [his]149-clyde deep personal interest in [her]1576-her , whether [she]1576-her was really very deeply concerned about [any other youth]1588-any other youth , [she]1576-her threw [him]149-clyde off by announcing that [she]1576-her liked [all the boys]1589-all the boys , really . [They]1589-all the boys were all so lovely — so nice to [her]1576-her . [They]1589-all the boys had to be . When [they]1589-all the boys were n't , [she]1576-her did n't have anything more to do with [them]1589-all the boys . [She]1576-her " tied a can to [them]1589-all the boys , "[1576-her] as [she]1576-her once expressed it . [Her]1576-her quick eyes clicked and [she]1576-her tossed [her]1576-her head defiantly .

And [Clyde]149-clyde was captivated by all this . [Her]1576-her gestures , [her]1576-her poses , moues and attitudes were sensuous and suggestive . [She]1576-her seemed to like to tease , promise , lay [herself]1576-her open to certain charges and conclusions and then to withhold and pretend that there was nothing to all of this — that [she]1576-her was very unconscious of anything save the most reserved thoughts in regard to [herself]1576-her . In the main , [Clyde]149-clyde was thrilled and nourished by this mere proximity to [her]1576-her . It was torture , and yet a sweet kind of torture . [He]149-clyde was full of the most tantalizing thoughts about how wonderful it would be if only [he]149-clyde were permitted to hold [her]1576-her close , kiss [her]1576-her mouth , bite [her]1576-her , even . To cover [her]1576-her mouth with [his]149-clyde ! To smother [her]1576-her with kisses ! To crush and pet [her]1576-her pretty figure ! [She]1576-her would look at [him]149-clyde at moments with deliberate , swimming eyes , and [he]149-clyde actually felt a little sick and weak — almost nauseated . [His]149-clyde one dream was that by some process , either of charm or money , [he]149-clyde could make [himself]149-clyde interesting to [her]1576-her .

And yet after going with [her]1576-her to [the theater]2576-the theater and taking [her]1576-her [home]533-home again , [he]149-clyde could not see that [he]149-clyde had made any noticeable progress . For throughout the performance of " The Corsair "[52-libby 's] at [Libby]52-libby 's 's , [Hortense]174-hortense , who , because of [her]174-hortense uncertain interest in [him]149-clyde was really interested in the play , talked of nothing but similar shows [she]174-hortense had seen , as well as of [actors]1252-actors and [actresses]699-actresses and what [she]174-hortense thought of [them]1594-them , and what [particular youth]1595-particular youth had taken [her]174-hortense . And [Clyde]149-clyde , instead of leading [her]1576-her in wit and defiance and matching [her]1576-her experiences with [his]149-clyde own , was compelled to content [himself]149-clyde with approving of [her]1576-her .

And all the time [she]1576-her was thinking that [she]1576-her had made another real conquest . And because [she]1576-her was no longer virtuous , and [she]1576-her was convinced that [he]149-clyde had some little money to spend , and could be made to spend it on [her]1576-her , [she]1576-her conceived the notion of being sufficiently agreeable — nothing more — to hold [him]149-clyde , keep [him]149-clyde attentive , if possible , while at the same time [she]1576-her went [her]1576-her own way , enjoying [herself]1576-her as much as possible with [others]280-others and getting [Clyde]149-clyde to buy and do such things for [her]1576-her as might fill gaps — when [she]1576-her was not sufficiently or amusingly enough engaged elsewhere .

For a period of four months at least this was exactly the way it worked out . After meeting [her]1576-her in this fashion , [he]149-clyde was devoting not an inconsiderable portion of [his]149-clyde free time to attempting to interest [her]1576-her to the point where [she]1576-her would take as much interest in [him]149-clyde as [she]1576-her appeared to take in [others]280-others . At the same time [he]149-clyde could not tell whether [she]1576-her could be made to entertain a singular affection for [any one]511-any one . Nor could [he]149-clyde believe that there was only [an innocent camaraderie]1599-an innocent camaraderie involved in all this . Yet [she]1576-her was so enticing that [he]149-clyde was deliriously moved by the thought that if [his]149-clyde worst suspicions were true , [she]1576-her might ultimately favor [him]149-clyde . So captivated was [he]149-clyde by this savor of sensuality and varietism that was about [her]1576-her , the stigmata of desire manifest in [her]1576-her gestures , moods , voice , the way [she]1576-her dressed , that [he]149-clyde could not think of relinquishing [her]1576-her .

Rather , [he]149-clyde foolishly ran after [her]1576-her . And seeing this , [she]1576-her put [him]149-clyde off , at times evaded [him]149-clyde , compelled [him]149-clyde to content [himself]149-clyde with little more than the crumbs of [her]1576-her company , while at the same time favoring [him]149-clyde with descriptions or pictures of other activities and contacts which made [him]149-clyde feel as though [he]149-clyde could no longer endure to merely trail [her]1576-her in this fashion . It was then [he]149-clyde would announce to [himself]149-clyde in anger that [he]149-clyde was not going to see [her]1576-her any more . [She]1576-her was no good to [him]149-clyde , really . But on seeing [her]1576-her again , a cold indifference in everything [she]1576-her said and did , [his]149-clyde courage failed [him]149-clyde and [he]149-clyde could not think of severing the tie .

[She]1576-her was not at all backward at the same time in speaking of things that [she]1576-her needed or would like to have — little things , at first — a new powder puff , a lip stick , a box of powder or a bottle of perfume . Later , and without having yielded anything more to [Clyde]149-clyde than a few elusive and evasive endearments — intimate and languorous reclinings in [his]149-clyde arms which promised much but always came to nothing — [she]1576-her made so bold as to indicate to [him]149-clyde at different times and in different ways , purses , blouses , slippers , stockings , a hat , which [she]1576-her would like to buy if only [she]1576-her had the money . And [he]149-clyde , in order to hold [her]1576-her favor and properly ingratiate [himself]149-clyde , proceeded to buy them , though at times and because of some other developments in connection with [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family , it pressed [him]149-clyde hard to do so . And yet , as [he]149-clyde was beginning to see toward the end of the fourth month , [he]149-clyde was apparently little farther advanced in [her]1576-her favor than [he]149-clyde had been in the beginning . In short , [he]149-clyde was conducting a feverish and almost painful pursuit without any definite promise of reward .

In the meantime , in so far as [his]149-clyde home ties went , the irritations and the depressions which were almost inextricably involved with membership in [the Griffiths family]1601-the griffiths family were not different from what [they]1602-they had ever been . For , following the disappearance of [Esta]124-esta , there had settled a period of dejection which still endured . Only , in so far as [Clyde]149-clyde was concerned , it was complicated with a mystery which was tantalizing and something more — irritating ; for when it came to anything which related to sex in [the Griffiths family]1601-the griffiths family , [no parents]1604-no parents could possibly have been more squeamish .

And especially did this apply to the mystery which had now surrounded [Esta]124-esta for some time . [She]124-esta had gone . [She]124-esta had not returned . And so far as [Clyde]149-clyde and [the others]264-the others knew , no word of any kind had been received from [her]124-esta . However , [Clyde]149-clyde had noted that after the first few weeks of [her]124-esta absence , during which time both [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father had been most intensely wrought up and troubled , worrying greatly as to [her]124-esta whereabouts and why [she]124-esta did not write , suddenly [they]1602-they had ceased [their]1602-they worries , and had become very much more resigned — at least not so tortured by a situation that previously had seemed to offer no hope whatsoever . [He]149-clyde could not explain it . It was quite noticeable , and yet nothing was said . And then one day a little later , [Clyde]149-clyde had occasion to note that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother was in communication with [some one]2296-some one by mail — something rare for [her]270-his mother . For so few were [her]270-his mother social or business connections that [she]270-his mother rarely received or wrote a letter .

One day , however , very shortly after [he]149-clyde had connected [himself]149-clyde with [the Green - Davidson]44-the green - davidson , [he]149-clyde had come in rather earlier than usual in the afternoon and found [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother bending over a letter which evidently had just arrived and which appeared to interest [her]270-his mother greatly . Also it seemed to be connected with something which required concealment . For , on seeing [him]149-clyde , [she]270-his mother stopped reading at once , and , flustered and apparently nervous , arose and put the letter away without commenting in any way upon what [she]270-his mother had been doing . But [Clyde]149-clyde for some reason , intuition perhaps , had the thought that it might be from [Esta]124-esta . [He]149-clyde was not sure . And [he]149-clyde was too far away to detect the character of the handwriting . But whatever it was , [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother said nothing afterwards concerning it . [She]270-his mother looked as though [she]270-his mother did not want [him]149-clyde to inquire , and so reserved were [their]1612-their relations that [he]149-clyde would not have thought of inquiring . [He]149-clyde merely wondered , and then dismissed it partially , but not entirely , from [his]149-clyde mind .

A month or five weeks after this , and just about the time that [he]149-clyde was becoming comparatively well - schooled in [his]149-clyde work at [the Green - Davidson]765-the green - davidson , and was beginning to interest [himself]149-clyde in [Hortense Briggs]174-hortense , [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother came to [him]149-clyde one afternoon with a very peculiar proposition for [her]270-his mother . Without explaining what it was for , or indicating directly that now [she]270-his mother felt that [he]149-clyde might be in a better position to help [her]270-his mother , [she]270-his mother called [him]149-clyde into [the mission hall]603-the mission hall when [he]149-clyde came in from work and , looking at [him]149-clyde rather fixedly and nervously for [her]270-his mother , said : " [You]149-clyde would n't know , [Clyde]149-clyde , would [you]149-clyde , how [I]270-his mother could raise a hundred dollars right away ? "[270-his mother]

[Clyde]149-clyde was so astonished that [he]149-clyde could scarcely believe [his]149-clyde ears , for only a few weeks before the mere mention of any sum above four or five dollars in connection with [him]149-clyde would have been preposterous . [[His]149-clyde mother]270-his mother knew that . Yet here [she]270-his mother was asking [him]149-clyde and apparently assuming that [he]149-clyde might be able to assist [her]270-his mother in this way . And rightly , for both [his]149-clyde clothes and [his]149-clyde general air had indicated a period of better days for [him]149-clyde .

At the same time [his]149-clyde first thought was , of course , that [she]270-his mother had observed [his]149-clyde clothes and goings - on and was convinced that [he]149-clyde was deceiving [her]270-his mother about the amount [he]149-clyde earned . And in part this was true , only so changed was [Clyde]149-clyde 's manner of late , that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother had been compelled to take a very different attitude toward [him]149-clyde and was beginning to be not a little dubious as to [her]270-his mother further control over [him]149-clyde . Recently , or since [he]149-clyde had secured this latest place , for some reason [he]149-clyde had seemed to [her]270-his mother to have grown wiser , more assured , less dubious of [himself]149-clyde , inclined to go [his]149-clyde own way and keep [his]149-clyde own counsel . And while this had troubled [her]270-his mother not a little in one sense , it rather pleased [her]270-his mother in another . For to see [Clyde]149-clyde , who had always seemed because of [his]149-clyde sensitiveness and unrest so much of a problem to [her]270-his mother , developing in this very interesting way was something ; though at times , and in view of [his]149-clyde very recent finery , [she]270-his mother had been wondering and troubled as to the nature of the company [he]149-clyde might be keeping . But since [his]149-clyde hours were so long and so absorbing , and whatever money [he]149-clyde made appeared to be going into clothes , [she]270-his mother felt that [she]270-his mother had no real reason to complain . [Her]270-his mother one other thought was that perhaps [he]149-clyde was beginning to act a little selfish — to think too much of [his]149-clyde own comfort — and yet in the face of [his]149-clyde long deprivations [she]270-his mother could not very well begrudge [him]149-clyde any temporary pleasure , either .

[Clyde]149-clyde , not being sure of [her]270-his mother real attitude , merely looked at [her]270-his mother and exclaimed : " Why , where would [I]149-clyde get a hundred dollars , [Ma]183-ma ? "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde had visions of [his]149-clyde new - found source of wealth being dissipated by such unheard of and inexplicable demands as this , and distress and distrust at once showed on [his]149-clyde countenance .

" [I]126-mrs. griffiths did n't expect that [you]149-clyde could get it all for [me]126-mrs. griffiths , "[126-mrs. griffiths] [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths suggested tactfully . " [I]126-mrs. griffiths have a plan to raise the most of it , [I]126-mrs. griffiths think . But [I]126-mrs. griffiths did want [you]149-clyde to help [me]126-mrs. griffiths try to think how [I]126-mrs. griffiths would raise the rest . [I]126-mrs. griffiths did n't want to go to [[your]149-clyde father]2598-your father with this if [I]126-mrs. griffiths could help it , and [you]149-clyde 're getting old enough now to be of some help . "[126-mrs. griffiths] [She]126-mrs. griffiths looked at [Clyde]149-clyde approvingly and interestedly enough . " [[Your]149-clyde father]2598-your father is such a poor hand at business , "[126-mrs. griffiths] [she]126-mrs. griffiths went on , " and [he]2598-your father gets so worried at times . "[126-mrs. griffiths]

[She]126-mrs. griffiths passed a large and weary hand over [her]126-mrs. griffiths face and [Clyde]149-clyde was moved by [her]126-mrs. griffiths predicament , whatever it was . At the same time , apart from whether [he]149-clyde was willing to part with so much or not , or had it to give , [he]149-clyde was decidedly curious about what all this was for . A hundred dollars ! Gee whiz !

After a moment or two , [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother added : " [I]270-his mother 'll tell [you]149-clyde what [I]270-his mother 've been thinking . [I]270-his mother must have a hundred dollars , but [I]270-his mother ca n't tell [you]149-clyde for what now , [you]149-clyde nor [any one]511-any one , and [you]149-clyde must n't ask [me]270-his mother . There 's an old gold watch of [[your]149-clyde father]2598-your father 's in [my]270-his mother desk and a solid gold ring and pin of mine . Those things ought to be worth twenty - five dollars at least , if they were sold or pawned . Then there is that set of solid silver knives and forks and that silver platter and pitcher in there"—Clyde[270-his mother] knew the keepsakes well—"that platter alone is worth twenty - five dollars . [I]149-clyde believe [they]2602-they ought to bring at least twenty or twenty - five together . [I]149-clyde was thinking if [I]149-clyde could get [you]149-clyde to go to [some good pawnshop]2603-some good pawnshop with [them]2602-they down near where [you]149-clyde work , and then if [you]149-clyde would let [me]149-clyde have five more a week for a while "[149-clyde] ( [Clyde]149-clyde 's countenance fell)—"I could get [a friend of mine]2571-a friend of mine — [Mr. Murch]196-mr. murch who comes [here]2282-here , [you]149-clyde know — to advance [me]1619-me enough to make up the hundred , and then [I]1619-me could pay [him]196-mr. murch back out of what [you]149-clyde pay [me]1619-me . [I]1619-me have about ten dollars [myself]1619-me . "[1619-me]

[She]1619-me looked at [Clyde]149-clyde as much as to say : " Now , surely , [you]149-clyde wo n't desert [me]1619-me in [my]1619-me hour of trouble , "[1619-me] and [Clyde]149-clyde relaxed , in spite of the fact that [he]149-clyde had been counting upon using quite all that [he]149-clyde earned for [himself]149-clyde . In fact , [he]149-clyde agreed to take the trinkets to [the pawnshop]1620-the pawnshop , and to advance [her]1619-me five more for the time being until the difference between whatever the trinkets brought and one hundred dollars was made up . And yet in spite of [himself]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde could not help resenting this extra strain , for it had only been a very short time that [he]149-clyde had been earning so much . And here was [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother demanding more and more , as [he]149-clyde saw it — ten dollars a week now . Always something wrong , thought [Clyde]149-clyde , always something needed , and with no assurance that there would not be more such demands later .

[He]149-clyde took the trinkets , carried them to [the most presentable pawnshop [he]149-clyde could find]1622-the most presentable pawnshop he could find , and being offered forty - five dollars for the lot , took it . This , with [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother 's ten , would make fifty - five , and with forty - five [she]1619-me could borrow from [Mr. Murch]196-mr. murch , would make a hundred . Only now , as [he]149-clyde saw , it would mean that for nine weeks [he]149-clyde would have to give [her]1619-me ten dollars instead of five . And that , in view of [his]149-clyde present aspirations to dress , live and enjoy [himself]149-clyde in a way entirely different from what [he]149-clyde previously considered necessary , was by no means a pleasure to contemplate . Nevertheless [he]149-clyde decided to do it . After all [he]149-clyde owed [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother something . [She]270-his mother had made many sacrifices for [him]149-clyde and [the others]264-the others in days past and [he]149-clyde could not afford to be too selfish . It was not decent .

But the most enduring thought that now came to [him]149-clyde was that if [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father were going to look to [him]149-clyde for financial aid , [they]1628-they should be willing to show [him]149-clyde more consideration than had previously been shown [him]149-clyde . For one thing [he]149-clyde ought to be allowed to come and go with more freedom , in so far as [his]149-clyde night hours were concerned . And at the same time [he]149-clyde was clothing [himself]149-clyde and eating [his]149-clyde meals at [the hotel]769-the hotel , and that was no small item , as [he]149-clyde saw it .

However , there was another problem that had soon arisen and it was this . Not so long after the matter of the hundred dollars , [he]149-clyde encountered [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother in [Montrose Street]56-montrose street , [one of the poorest streets which ran north from [Bickel]8-bickel]1631-one of the poorest streets which ran north from bickel , and which consisted entirely of two unbroken lines of [wooden houses]1632-wooden houses and [two - story flats]1633-two - story flats and [many unfurnished apartments]1634-many unfurnished apartments . Even [the Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths , poor as [they]1635-they were , would have felt [themselves]1635-they demeaned by the thought of having to dwell in [such a street]1636-such a street . [[His]149-clyde mother]270-his mother was coming down the front steps of [one of [the less tatterdemalion houses of this row]1639-the less tatterdemalion houses of this row]1638-one of the less tatterdemalion houses of this row , a lower front window of which carried a very conspicuous card which read " [Furnished Rooms]2606-furnished rooms . "[270-his mother] And then , without turning or seeing [Clyde]149-clyde across [the street]290-the street , [she]270-his mother proceeded to [another house a few doors away , which also carried a furnished rooms]1641-another house a few doors away , which also carried a furnished rooms card and , after surveying the exterior interestedly , mounted the steps and rang the bell .

[Clyde]149-clyde 's first impression was that [she]270-his mother was seeking the whereabouts of [some individual in whom [she]270-his mother was interested and of whose address [she]270-his mother was not certain]1642-some individual in whom she was interested and of whose address she was not certain . But crossing over to [her]270-his mother at about the moment [the proprietress of [the house]2453-the house]1643-the proprietress of the house put [her]1643-the proprietress of the house head out of the door , [he]149-clyde heard [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother say : " [You]149-clyde have a room for rent ? "[1643-the proprietress of the house] " Yes . "[270-his mother] " Has it a bath ? "[126-mrs. griffiths] " No , but there 's a bath on [the second floor]2503-the second floor . "[1643-the proprietress of the house] " How much is it a week ? "[270-his mother] " Four dollars . "[270-his mother] " Could [I]1643-the proprietress of the house see it ? "[1643-the proprietress of the house] " Yes , just step in . "[270-his mother]

[Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths appeared to hesitate while [Clyde]149-clyde stood below , not twenty - five feet away , and looked up at [her]270-his mother , waiting for [her]270-his mother to turn and recognize [him]149-clyde . But [she]270-his mother stepped in without turning . And [Clyde]149-clyde gazed after [her]270-his mother curiously , for while it was by no means inconceivable that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother might be looking for [a room]2360-a room for some one , yet why should [she]270-his mother be looking for it in [this street]1648-this street when as a rule [she]270-his mother usually dealt with [the Salvation Army]57-the salvation army or [the Young Women]197-the young women 's Christian Association . [His]149-clyde first impulse was to wait and inquire of [her]270-his mother what [she]270-his mother was doing [here]2282-here , but being interested in several errands of [his]149-clyde own , [he]149-clyde went on .

That night , returning to [[his]149-clyde own home]702-his own home to dress and seeing [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother in [the kitchen]2582-the kitchen , [he]149-clyde said to [her]270-his mother : " [I]149-clyde saw [you]270-his mother this morning , [Ma]183-ma , in [Montrose Street]56-montrose street . "[149-clyde]

" Yes , "[270-his mother] [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother replied , after a moment , but not before [he]149-clyde had noticed that [she]270-his mother had started suddenly as though taken aback by this information . [She]270-his mother was paring potatoes and looked at [him]149-clyde curiously . " Well , what of it ? "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother added , calmly , but flushing just the same — a thing decidedly unusual in connection with [her]270-his mother where [he]149-clyde was concerned . Indeed , that start of surprise interested and arrested [Clyde]149-clyde .

" [You]270-his mother were going into [a house]2608-a house [there]443-there — looking for [a furnished room]2610-a furnished room , [I]270-his mother guess . "[270-his mother]

" Yes , [I]126-mrs. griffiths was , "[126-mrs. griffiths] replied [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths , simply enough now . " [I]270-his mother need a room for [some one who is sick and has n't much money]2611-some one who is sick and has n't much money , but it 's not so easy to find either . "[270-his mother] [She]270-his mother turned away as though [she]270-his mother were not disposed to discuss this any more , and [Clyde]149-clyde , while sensing [her]270-his mother mood , apparently , could not resist adding : " Gee , that 's not much of [a street]2612-a street to have [a room in]2613-a room in . "[149-clyde] [His]149-clyde new work at [the Green - Davidson]44-the green - davidson had already caused [him]149-clyde to think differently of how [one]489-one should live — [any one]511-any one . [She]270-his mother did not answer [him]149-clyde and [he]149-clyde went to [[his]149-clyde room]644-his room to change [his]149-clyde clothes .

A month or so after this , coming east on [Missouri Avenue]9-missouri avenue late one evening , [he]149-clyde again saw [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother in the near distance coming west . In the light of [one of [the small stores]1659-the small stores which ranged in a row on [this street]1648-this street]1658-one of the small stores which ranged in a row on this street , [he]149-clyde saw that [she]270-his mother was carrying a rather heavy old - fashioned bag , which had long been about [the house]2453-the house but had never been much used by [any one]511-any one . On sight of [him]149-clyde approaching ( as [he]149-clyde afterwards decided ) [she]270-his mother had stopped suddenly and turned into [a hallway of [a three - story brick apartment building]1664-a three - story brick apartment building]1663-a hallway of a three - story brick apartment building , and when [he]149-clyde came up to [it]1663-a hallway of a three - story brick apartment building , [he]149-clyde found the outside door was shut . [He]149-clyde opened it , and saw a flight of steps dimly lit , up which [she]270-his mother might have gone . However , [he]149-clyde did not trouble to investigate , for [he]149-clyde was uncertain , once [he]149-clyde reached [this place]1059-this place , whether [she]270-his mother had gone to call on some one or not , it had all happened so quickly . But waiting at the next corner , [he]149-clyde finally saw [her]270-his mother come out again . And then to [his]149-clyde increasing curiosity , [she]270-his mother appeared to look cautiously about before proceeding as before . It was this that caused [him]149-clyde to think that [she]270-his mother must have been endeavoring to conceal [herself]270-his mother from [him]149-clyde . But why ?

[His]149-clyde first impulse was to turn and follow [her]270-his mother , so interested was [he]149-clyde by [her]270-his mother strange movements . But [he]149-clyde decided later that if [she]270-his mother did not want [him]149-clyde to know what [she]270-his mother was doing , perhaps it was best that [he]149-clyde should not . At the same time [he]149-clyde was made intensely curious by this evasive gesture . Why should [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother not wish [him]149-clyde to see [her]270-his mother carrying a bag anywhere ? Evasion and concealment formed no part of [her]270-his mother real disposition ( so different from [his]149-clyde own ) . Almost instantly [his]149-clyde mind proceeded to join this coincidence with the time [he]149-clyde had seen [her]270-his mother descending the steps of [the rooming house in [Montrose Street]56-montrose street]1667-the rooming house in montrose street , together with the business of the letter [he]149-clyde had found [her]270-his mother reading , and the money [she]270-his mother had been compelled to raise — the hundred dollars . Where could [she]270-his mother be going ? What was [she]270-his mother hiding ?

[He]149-clyde speculated on all this , but [he]149-clyde could not decide whether it had any definite connection with [him]149-clyde or [any member of [the family]279-the family]1668-any member of the family until about a week later , when , passing along [Eleventh]59-eleventh near [Baltimore]23-baltimore , [he]149-clyde thought [he]149-clyde saw [Esta]124-esta , or at least [a girl so much like [her]124-esta]1670-a girl so much like her that [she]124-esta would be taken for [her]124-esta anywhere . [She]124-esta had the same height , and [she]124-esta was moving along as [Esta]124-esta used to walk . Only , now [he]149-clyde thought as [he]149-clyde saw [her]124-esta , [she]124-esta looked older . Yet , so quickly had [she]124-esta come and gone in the mass of [people]377-people that [he]149-clyde had not been able to make sure . It was only a glance , but on the strength of it , [he]149-clyde had turned and sought to catch up with [her]124-esta , but upon reaching the spot [she]124-esta was gone . So convinced was [he]149-clyde , however , that [he]149-clyde had seen [her]124-esta that [he]149-clyde went straight [home]533-home , and , encountering [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother in [the mission]581-the mission , announced that [he]149-clyde was positive [he]149-clyde had seen [Esta]124-esta . [She]124-esta must be back in [Kansas City]5-kansas city again . [He]149-clyde could have sworn to it . [He]149-clyde had seen [her]124-esta near [Eleventh]59-eleventh and [Baltimore]23-baltimore , or thought [he]149-clyde had . Had [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother heard anything from [her]124-esta ?

And then curiously enough [he]149-clyde observed that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother 's manner was not exactly what [he]149-clyde thought it should have been under the circumstances . [His]149-clyde own attitude had been one of commingled astonishment , pleasure , curiosity and sympathy because of the sudden disappearance and now sudden reappearance of [Esta]124-esta . Could it be that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother had used that hundred dollars to bring [her]124-esta back ? The thought had come to [him]149-clyde — why or from where , [he]149-clyde could not say . [He]149-clyde wondered . But if so , why had [she]124-esta not returned to [[her]124-esta home]551-her home , at least to notify [the family]279-the family of [her]124-esta presence here ?

[He]149-clyde expected [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother would be as astonished and puzzled as [he]149-clyde was — quick and curious for details . Instead , [she]270-his mother appeared to [him]149-clyde to be obviously confused and taken aback by this information , as though [she]270-his mother was hearing about something that [she]270-his mother already knew and was puzzled as to just what [her]270-his mother attitude should be .

" Oh , did [you]149-clyde ? Where ? Just now , [you]149-clyde say ? At [Eleventh]59-eleventh and [Baltimore]23-baltimore ? Well , is n't that strange ? [I]270-his mother must speak to [Asa]127-asa about this . It 's strange that [she]270-his mother would n't come here if [she]270-his mother is back . "[270-his mother] [Her]270-his mother eyes , as [he]149-clyde saw , instead of looking astonished , looked puzzled , disturbed . [Her]270-his mother mouth , always the case when [she]270-his mother was a little embarrassed and disconcerted , worked oddly — not only the lips but the jaw itself .

" Well , well , "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother added , after a pause . " That is strange . Perhaps it was just [some one who looked like [her]270-his mother]2614-some one who looked like her . "[270-his mother]

But [Clyde]149-clyde , watching [her]270-his mother out of the corner of [his]149-clyde eye , could not believe that [she]270-his mother was as astonished as [she]270-his mother pretended . And , thereafter , [Asa]127-asa coming in , and [Clyde]149-clyde not having as yet departed for [the hotel]769-the hotel , [he]149-clyde heard [them]1682-them discussing the matter in some strangely inattentive and unillumined way , as if it was not quite as startling as it had seemed to [him]149-clyde . And for some time [he]149-clyde was not called in to explain what [he]149-clyde had seen .

And then , as if purposely to solve this mystery for [him]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde encountered [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother one day passing along [Spruce Street]60-spruce street , this time carrying a small basket on [her]270-his mother arm . [She]270-his mother had , as [he]149-clyde had noticed of late , taken to going out regularly mornings and afternoons or evenings . On this occasion , and long before [she]270-his mother had had an opportunity to see [him]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde had discerned [her]270-his mother peculiarly heavy figure draped in the old brown coat which [she]270-his mother always wore , and had turned into [Myrkel Street]61-myrkel street and waited for [her]270-his mother to pass , [a convenient news stand offering [him]149-clyde shelter]1684-a convenient news stand offering him shelter . Once [she]270-his mother had passed , [he]149-clyde dropped behind [her]270-his mother , allowing [her]270-his mother to precede [him]149-clyde by half a block . And at [Dalrymple]62-dalrymple , [she]270-his mother crossed to [Beaudry]63-beaudry , which was really [a continuation of [Spruce]64-spruce]1685-a continuation of spruce , but not so ugly . [The houses]1686-the houses were quite old — [quondam residences of an earlier day]1687-quondam residences of an earlier day , but now turned into boarding and [rooming houses]1688-rooming houses . Into [one of these]1689-one of these [he]149-clyde saw [her]270-his mother enter and disappear , but before doing so [she]270-his mother looked inquiringly about [her]270-his mother .

After [she]270-his mother had entered , [Clyde]149-clyde approached [the house]2453-the house and studied [it]2453-the house with great interest . What was [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother doing in [there]443-there ? Who was it [she]270-his mother was going to see ? [He]149-clyde could scarcely have explained [his]149-clyde intense curiosity to [himself]149-clyde , and yet , since having thought that [he]149-clyde had seen [Esta]124-esta on [the street]290-the street , [he]149-clyde had an unconvinced feeling that it might have something to do with [her]270-his mother . There were the letters , the one hundred dollars , [the furnished room in [Montrose Street]56-montrose street]1694-the furnished room in montrose street .

Diagonally across the way from [the house in [Beaudry Street]65-beaudry street]1695-the house in beaudry street there was a large - trunked tree , leafless now in the winter wind , and near it a telegraph pole , close enough to make a joint shadow with it . And behind these [he]149-clyde was able to stand unseen , and from this vantage point to observe the several windows , side and front and ground and second floor . Through one of the front windows above , [he]149-clyde saw [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother moving about as though [she]270-his mother were quite at [home]533-home [there]443-there . And a moment later , to [his]149-clyde astonishment [he]149-clyde saw [Esta]124-esta come to one of [their]1699-their two windows and put a package down on the sill . [She]124-esta appeared to have on only a light dressing gown or a wrap drawn about [her]124-esta shoulders . [He]149-clyde was not mistaken this time . [He]149-clyde actually started as [he]149-clyde realized that it was [she]124-esta , also that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother was in [there]443-there with [her]124-esta . And yet what had [she]124-esta done that [she]124-esta must come back and hide away in this manner ? Had [[her]124-esta husband]593-her husband , [the man [she]124-esta had run away with]1703-the man she had run away with , deserted [her]124-esta ?

[He]149-clyde was so intensely curious that [he]149-clyde decided to wait a while outside here to see if [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother might not come out , and then [he]149-clyde [himself]149-clyde would call on [Esta]124-esta . [He]149-clyde wanted so much to see [her]124-esta again — to know what this mystery was all about . [He]149-clyde waited , thinking how [he]149-clyde had always liked [Esta]124-esta and how strange it was that [she]124-esta should be [here]2282-here , hiding away in this mysterious way .

After an hour , [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother came out , [her]270-his mother basket apparently empty , for [she]270-his mother held it lightly in [her]270-his mother hand . And just as before , [she]270-his mother looked cautiously about [her]270-his mother , [her]270-his mother face wearing that same stolid and yet care - stamped expression which it always wore these days — a cross between an uplifting faith and a troublesome doubt .

[Clyde]149-clyde watched [her]270-his mother as [she]270-his mother proceeded to walk south on [Beaudry Street]65-beaudry street toward [the Mission]581-the mission . After [she]270-his mother was well out of sight , [he]149-clyde turned and entered [the house]2453-the house . Inside , as [he]149-clyde had surmised , [he]149-clyde found a collection of [furnished rooms]2606-furnished rooms , name plates some of which bore the names of [the roomers pasted upon them]1710-the roomers pasted upon them . Since [he]149-clyde knew that [the southeast front room [upstairs]1712-upstairs contained [Esta]124-esta]1711-the southeast front room upstairs contained esta , [he]149-clyde proceeded there and knocked . And true enough , a light footstep responded within , and presently , after some little delay which seemed to suggest some quick preparation within , the door opened slightly and [Esta]124-esta peeped out — quizzically at first , then with a little cry of astonishment and some confusion . For , as inquiry and caution disappeared , [she]124-esta realized that [she]124-esta was looking at [Clyde]149-clyde . At once [she]124-esta opened the door wide .

" Why , [Clyde]149-clyde , "[124-esta] [she]124-esta called . " How did [you]149-clyde come to find [me]124-esta ? [I]124-esta was just thinking of [you]149-clyde . "[124-esta]

[Clyde]149-clyde at once put [his]149-clyde arms around [her]124-esta and kissed [her]124-esta . At the same time [he]149-clyde realized , and with a slight sense of shock and dissatisfaction , that [she]124-esta was considerably changed . [She]124-esta was thinner — paler — [her]124-esta eyes almost sunken , and not any better dressed than when [he]149-clyde had seen [her]124-esta last . [She]124-esta appeared nervous and depressed . One of the first thoughts that came to [him]149-clyde now was where [[her]124-esta husband]593-her husband was . Why was n't [he]593-her husband [here]2282-here ? What had become of [him]593-her husband ? As [he]149-clyde looked about and at [her]124-esta , [he]149-clyde noticed that [Esta]124-esta 's look was one of confusion and uncertainty , not unmixed with a little satisfaction at seeing [him]593-her husband . [Her]124-esta mouth was partly open because of a desire to smile and to welcome [him]593-her husband , but [her]124-esta eyes showed that [she]124-esta was contending with a problem .

" [I]124-esta did n't expect [you]149-clyde here , "[124-esta] [she]124-esta added , quickly , the moment [he]149-clyde released [her]124-esta . " [You]149-clyde did n't see — "[124-esta] Then [she]124-esta paused , catching [herself]124-esta at the brink of some information which evidently [she]124-esta did n't wish to impart .

" Yes , [I]149-clyde did , too — [I]149-clyde saw [Ma]183-ma , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde replied . " That 's how [I]149-clyde came to know [you]183-ma were [here]2282-here . [I]149-clyde saw [her]183-ma coming out just now and [I]149-clyde saw [you]183-ma up here through the window . "[149-clyde] ( [He]149-clyde did not care to confess that [he]149-clyde had been following and watching [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother for an hour . ) " But when did [you]183-ma get back ? "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde went on . " It 's a wonder [you]183-ma would n't let the rest of [us]2616-us know something about [you]183-ma . Gee , [you]183-ma 're [a dandy]2617-a dandy , [you]183-ma are — going away and staying months and never letting [any one of [us]2616-us]2618-any one of us know anything . [You]183-ma might have written [me]149-clyde a little something , anyhow . [We]2616-us always got along pretty well , did n't [we]2616-us ? "[149-clyde]

[His]149-clyde glance was quizzical , curious , imperative . [She]270-his mother , for [her]270-his mother part , felt recessive and thence evasive — uncertain , quite , what to think or say or tell .

[She]270-his mother uttered : " [I]270-his mother could n't think who it might be . [No one]964-no one comes here . But , [my]270-his mother , how nice [you]183-ma look , [Clyde]149-clyde . [You]183-ma 've got such nice clothes , now . And [you]183-ma 're getting taller . [Mamma]198-mamma was telling [me]270-his mother [you]183-ma are working at [the Green - Davidson]765-the green - davidson . "[270-his mother]

[She]270-his mother looked at [him]149-clyde admiringly and [he]149-clyde was properly impressed by [her]270-his mother notice of [him]149-clyde . At the same time [he]149-clyde could not get [his]149-clyde mind off [her]270-his mother condition . [He]149-clyde could not cease looking at [her]270-his mother face , [her]270-his mother eyes , [her]270-his mother thin - fat body . And as [he]149-clyde looked at [her]270-his mother waist and [her]270-his mother gaunt face , [he]149-clyde came to a very keen realization that all was not well with [her]270-his mother . [She]270-his mother was going to have [a child]1716-a child . And hence the thought recurred to [him]149-clyde — where was [[her]270-his mother husband]593-her husband — or at any rate , [the man [she]270-his mother had eloped with]1718-the man she had eloped with . [Her]270-his mother original note , according to [[her]270-his mother mother]247-her mother , had said that [she]270-his mother was going to get married . Yet now [he]149-clyde sensed quite clearly that [she]270-his mother was not married . [She]270-his mother was deserted , left in [this miserable room]1720-this miserable room here alone . [He]149-clyde saw it , felt it , understood it .

And [he]149-clyde thought at once that this was typical of all that seemed to occur in [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family . Here [he]149-clyde was just getting a start , trying to be [somebody]716-somebody and get along in [the world]332-the world and have a good time . And here was [Esta]124-esta , after [her]124-esta first venture in the direction of doing something for [herself]124-esta , coming to such a finish as this . It made [him]149-clyde a little sick and resentful .

" How long have [you]124-esta been back , [Esta]124-esta ? "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde repeated dubiously , scarcely knowing just what to say now , for now that [he]149-clyde was here and [she]124-esta was as [she]124-esta was [he]149-clyde began to scent expense , trouble , distress and to wish almost that [he]149-clyde had not been so curious . Why need [he]149-clyde have been ? It could only mean that [he]149-clyde must help .

" Oh , not so very long , [Clyde]149-clyde . About a month , now , [I]149-clyde guess . Not more than that . "[149-clyde]

" [I]149-clyde thought so . [I]149-clyde saw [you]124-esta up on [Eleventh]59-eleventh near [Baltimore]23-baltimore about a month ago , did n't [I]149-clyde ? Sure [I]149-clyde did , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde added a little less joyously — a change that [Esta]124-esta noted . At the same time [she]124-esta nodded [her]124-esta head affirmatively . " [I]124-esta knew [I]124-esta did . [I]124-esta told [Ma]183-ma so at the time , but [she]183-ma did n't seem to think so . [She]183-ma was n't as surprised as [I]124-esta thought [she]183-ma would be , though . [I]124-esta know why , now . [She]183-ma acted as though [she]183-ma did n't want [me]124-esta to tell [her]183-ma about it either . But [I]124-esta knew [I]124-esta was n't wrong . "[124-esta] [He]149-clyde stared at [Esta]124-esta oddly , quite proud of [his]149-clyde prescience in this case . [He]149-clyde paused though , not knowing quite what else to say and wondering whether what [he]149-clyde had just said was of any sense or import . It did n't seem to suggest any real aid for [her]124-esta .

And [she]124-esta , not quite knowing how to pass over the nature of [her]124-esta condition , or to confess it , either , was puzzled what to say . Something had to be done . For [Clyde]149-clyde could see for [himself]149-clyde that [her]124-esta predicament was dreadful . [She]124-esta could scarcely bear the look of [his]149-clyde inquiring eyes . And more to extricate [herself]124-esta than [[her]124-esta mother]247-her mother , [she]124-esta finally observed , " [Poor Mamma]198-mamma . [You]149-clyde must n't think it strange of [her]124-esta , [Clyde]149-clyde . [She]124-esta does n't know what to do , [you]149-clyde see , really . It 's all [my]124-esta fault , of course . If [I]124-esta had n't run away , [I]124-esta would n't have caused [her]124-esta all this trouble . [She]124-esta has so little to do with and [she]124-esta 's always had such a hard time . "[124-esta] [She]124-esta turned [her]124-esta back to [him]149-clyde suddenly , and [her]124-esta shoulders began to tremble and [her]124-esta sides to heave . [She]124-esta put [her]124-esta hands to [her]124-esta face and bent [her]124-esta head low — and then [he]149-clyde knew that [she]124-esta was silently crying .

" Oh , come now , [sis]2621-sis , "[149-clyde] exclaimed [Clyde]149-clyde , drawing near to [her]124-esta instantly and feeling intensely sorry for [her]124-esta at the moment . " What 's the matter ? What do [you]124-esta want to cry for ? Did n't [that man that [you]124-esta went away with]2622-that man that you went away with marry [you]124-esta ? "[149-clyde]

[She]124-esta shook [her]124-esta head negatively and sobbed the more . And in that instant there came to [Clyde]149-clyde the real psychological as well as sociological and biological import of [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister 's condition . [She]124-esta was in trouble , pregnant — and with no money and [no husband]1726-no husband . That was why [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother had been looking for [a room]2360-a room . That was why [she]124-esta had tried to borrow a hundred dollars from [him]149-clyde . [She]124-esta was ashamed of [Esta]124-esta and [her]124-esta condition . [She]124-esta was ashamed of not only what [people outside the family]1729-people outside the family would think , but of what [he]149-clyde and [Julia]133-julia and [Frank]134-frank might think — the effect of [Esta]124-esta 's condition upon [them]1729-people outside the family perhaps — because it was not right , unmoral , as [people]377-people saw it . And for that reason [she]124-esta had been trying to conceal it , telling stories about it — a most amazing and difficult thing for [her]124-esta , no doubt . And yet , because of poor luck , [she]124-esta had n't succeeded very well .

And now [he]149-clyde was again confused and puzzled , not only by [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister 's condition and what it meant to [him]149-clyde and [the other members of [the family]279-the family here in [Kansas City]5-kansas city]1732-the other members of the family here in kansas city , but also by [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother 's disturbed and somewhat unmoral attitude in regard to deception in this instance . [She]124-esta had evaded if not actually deceived [him]149-clyde in regard to all this , for [she]124-esta knew [Esta]124-esta was here all the time . At the same time [he]149-clyde was not inclined to be too unsympathetic in that respect toward [her]124-esta — far from it . For such deception in such an instance had to be , no doubt , even where [people]377-people were as religious and truthful as [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother , or so [he]149-clyde thought . [You]1737-you could n't just let [people]377-people know . [He]149-clyde certainly would n't want to let [people]377-people know about [Esta]124-esta , if [he]149-clyde could help it . Was n't the general state of [[his]149-clyde family]514-his family low enough , as it was ? And so , now [he]149-clyde stood , staring and puzzled the while [Esta]124-esta cried . And [she]124-esta realizing that [he]149-clyde was puzzled and ashamed , because of [her]124-esta , cried the more .

" Gee , that is tough , "[149-clyde] said [Clyde]149-clyde , troubled , and yet fairly sympathetic after a time . " [You]124-esta would n't have run away with [him]149-clyde unless [you]124-esta cared for [him]149-clyde though — would [you]124-esta ? "[149-clyde] ( [He]149-clyde was thinking of [himself]149-clyde and [Hortense Briggs]174-hortense . ) " [I]149-clyde 'm sorry for [you]124-esta , [Ess]199-ess . " Oh , [I]124-esta know , "[124-esta] sobbed [Esta]124-esta , " but [I]124-esta 've been so foolish . And [I]124-esta 've had such a hard time . And now [I]124-esta 've brought all this trouble on [Mamma]198-mamma and all of [you]124-esta . "[124-esta] [She]124-esta choked and hushed a moment . " [He]149-clyde went off and left [me]124-esta in [a hotel in [Pittsburgh]66-pittsburgh]2625-a hotel in pittsburgh without any money , "[124-esta] [she]124-esta added . " And if it had n't been for [Mamma]198-mamma , [I]124-esta do n't know what [I]124-esta would have done . [She]198-mamma sent [me]124-esta a hundred dollars when [I]124-esta wrote [her]198-mamma . [I]124-esta was ashamed to . But [I]124-esta did n't know what else to do there toward the last , when [I]124-esta began feeling so bad . "[124-esta]

[She]124-esta began to cry again ; and [Clyde]149-clyde , realizing all that [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother had done and sought to do to assist [her]124-esta , felt almost as sorry now for [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother as [he]149-clyde did for [Esta]124-esta — more so , for [Esta]124-esta had [[her]124-esta mother]247-her mother to look after [her]124-esta and [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother had [almost no one to help [her]124-esta]1745-almost no one to help her .

" [I]124-esta ca n't work yet , because [I]124-esta wo n't be able to for a while , "[124-esta] [she]124-esta went on . "[124-esta] [Her]124-esta eyes filled and [she]124-esta began to choke again . " And [I]124-esta 've been so foolish . "[124-esta]

And [Clyde]149-clyde felt for the moment as though [he]149-clyde could cry too . For life was so strange , so hard at times . See how it had treated [him]149-clyde all these years . [He]149-clyde had had nothing until recently and always wanted to run away . But [Esta]124-esta had done so , and see what had befallen [her]124-esta . And somehow [he]149-clyde recalled [her]124-esta between the tall walls of [the big buildings here in [the business district]1747-the business district]1746-the big buildings here in the business district , sitting at [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father 's little street organ and singing and looking so innocent and good . [Gee]153-gee , life was tough . What a rough world it was anyhow . How queer things went !

[He]149-clyde looked at [her]124-esta and [the room]577-the room , and finally , telling [her]124-esta that [she]124-esta would n't be left alone , and that [he]149-clyde would come again , only [she]124-esta must n't tell [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother [he]149-clyde had been [there]443-there , and that if [she]124-esta needed anything [she]124-esta could call on [him]149-clyde although [he]149-clyde was n't making so very much , either — and then went out . And then , walking toward [the hotel]769-the hotel to go to work , [he]149-clyde kept dwelling on the thought of how miserable it all was — how sorry [he]149-clyde was that [he]149-clyde had followed [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother , for then [he]149-clyde might not have known . But even so , it would have come out . [[His]149-clyde mother]270-his mother could not have concealed it from [him]149-clyde indefinitely . But this , well , this was [[his]149-clyde own sister]1763-his own sister . [A man]1240-a man had thought so little of [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister as that . That was not so bad . Besides there was [his]149-clyde own love affair , [Hortense]174-hortense , and pleasures . There must be some way out for [Esta]124-esta . Gee !

The result of all this on [Clyde]149-clyde was to cause [him]149-clyde to think more specifically on the problem of the sexes than [he]149-clyde ever had before , and by no means in any orthodox way . For while [he]149-clyde condemned [[[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister 's lover]1775-his sister 's lover for thus ruthlessly deserting [her]1775-his sister 's lover , still [he]149-clyde was not willing to hold [her]1775-his sister 's lover entirely blameless by any means . [She]1775-his sister 's lover had gone off with [him]149-clyde . As [he]149-clyde now learned from [her]1775-his sister 's lover , [he]149-clyde had been in [the city]662-the city for a week the year before [she]1775-his sister 's lover ran away with [him]149-clyde , and it was then that [he]149-clyde had introduced [himself]149-clyde to [her]1775-his sister 's lover . The following year when [he]149-clyde returned for two weeks , it was [she]1775-his sister 's lover who looked [him]149-clyde up , or so [Clyde]149-clyde suspected , at any rate . And in view of [his]149-clyde own interest in and mood regarding [Hortense Briggs]174-hortense , it was not for [him]149-clyde to say that there was anything wrong with the sex relation in itself .

Rather , as [he]149-clyde saw it now , the difficulty lay , not in the deed itself , but in the consequences which followed upon not thinking or not knowing . For had [Esta]124-esta known more of [the man in whom [she]124-esta was interested]1777-the man in whom she was interested , more of what such a relationship with [him]149-clyde meant , [she]124-esta would not be in [her]124-esta present pathetic plight . Certainly [such girls as [Hortense Briggs]174-hortense]1778-such girls as hortense briggs , [Greta]175-greta and [Louise]173-louise , would never have allowed [themselves]1778-such girls as hortense briggs to be put in any such position as [Esta]124-esta . Or would [they]1778-such girls as hortense briggs ? [They]1778-such girls as hortense briggs were too shrewd . And by contrast with [them]1778-such girls as hortense briggs in [his]149-clyde mind , at least at this time , [she]124-esta suffered . [She]124-esta ought , as [he]149-clyde saw it , to have been able to manage better . And so , by degrees , [his]149-clyde attitude toward [her]124-esta hardened in some measure , though [his]149-clyde feeling was not one of indifference either .

But the one influence that was affecting and troubling and changing [him]149-clyde now was [his]149-clyde infatuation for [Hortense Briggs]174-hortense — than which no more agitating influence could have come to a youth of [his]149-clyde years and temperament . [She]124-esta seemed , after [his]149-clyde few contacts with [her]124-esta , to be really the perfect realization of all that [he]149-clyde had previously wished for in [a girl]627-a girl . [She]124-esta was so bright , vain , engaging , and so truly pretty . [Her]124-esta eyes , as they seemed to [him]149-clyde , had a kind of dancing fire in them . [She]124-esta had a most entrancing way of pursing and parting [her]124-esta lips and at the same time looking straightly and indifferently before [her]124-esta , as though [she]124-esta were not thinking of [him]149-clyde , which to [him]149-clyde was both flame and fever . It caused [him]149-clyde , actually , to feel weak and dizzy , at times , cruelly seared in [his]149-clyde veins with minute and wriggling threads of fire , and this could only be described as conscious lust , a torturesome and yet unescapable thing which yet in [her]124-esta case [he]149-clyde was unable to prosecute beyond embracing and kissing , a form of reserve and respect in regard to [her]124-esta which [she]124-esta really resented in the very youths in whom [she]124-esta sought to inspire it . [The type of boy for whom [she]124-esta really cared and was always seeking]1780-the type of boy for whom she really cared and was always seeking was one who could sweep away all such psuedo - ingenuousness and superiorities in [her]124-esta and force [her]124-esta , even against [herself]124-esta , to yield to [him]149-clyde .

In fact [she]124-esta was constantly wavering between actual like and dislike of [him]149-clyde . And in consequence , [he]149-clyde was in constant doubt as to where [he]149-clyde stood , a state which was very much relished by [her]124-esta and yet which was never permitted to become so fixed in [his]149-clyde mind as to cause [him]149-clyde to give [her]124-esta up entirely . After some party or dinner or theater to which [she]124-esta had permitted [him]149-clyde to take [her]124-esta , and throughout which [he]149-clyde had been particularly tactful — not too assertive — [she]124-esta could be as yielding and enticing in [her]124-esta mood as [the most ambitious lover]1781-the most ambitious lover would have liked . And this might last until the evening was nearly over , when suddenly , and at [her]124-esta own door or [the room or house of [some girl with whom [she]124-esta was spending the night]1783-some girl with whom she was spending the night]1782-the room or house of some girl with whom she was spending the night , [she]124-esta would turn , and without rhyme or reason , endeavor to dismiss [him]149-clyde with a mere handclasp or a thinly flavored embrace or kiss . At such times , if [Clyde]149-clyde was foolish enough to endeavor to force [her]124-esta to yield the favors [he]149-clyde craved , [she]124-esta would turn on [him]149-clyde with the fury of a spiteful cat , would tear [herself]124-esta away , developing for the moment , seemingly , an intense mood of opposition which [she]124-esta could scarcely have explained to [herself]124-esta . Its chief mental content appeared to be one of opposition to being compelled by [him]149-clyde to do anything . And , because of [his]149-clyde infatuation and [his]149-clyde weak overtures due to [his]149-clyde inordinate fear of losing [her]124-esta , [he]149-clyde would be forced to depart , usually in a dark and despondent mood .

But so keen was [her]124-esta attraction for [him]149-clyde that [he]149-clyde could not long remain away , but must be going about to where most likely [he]149-clyde would encounter [her]124-esta . Indeed , for the most part these days , and in spite of the peculiar climax which had eventuated in connection with [Esta]124-esta , [he]149-clyde lived in a keen , sweet and sensual dream in regard to [her]124-esta . If only [she]124-esta would really come to care for [him]149-clyde . At night , in [his]149-clyde bed at [home]533-home , [he]149-clyde would lie and think of [her]124-esta — [her]124-esta face — the expressions of [her]124-esta mouth and eyes , the lines of [her]124-esta figure , the motions of [her]124-esta body in walking or dancing — and [she]124-esta would flicker before [him]149-clyde as upon a screen . In [his]149-clyde dreams , [he]149-clyde found [her]124-esta deliciously near [him]149-clyde , pressing against [him]149-clyde — [her]124-esta delightful body all [his]149-clyde — and then in the moment of crisis , when seemingly [she]124-esta was about to yield [herself]124-esta to [him]149-clyde completely , [he]149-clyde would awake to find [her]124-esta vanished — an illusion only .

Yet there were several things in connection with [her]124-esta which seemed to bode success for [him]149-clyde . In the first place , like [himself]149-clyde , [she]124-esta was part of [a poor family]1785-a poor family — [the daughter of [a machinist]1787-a machinist and [[his]1787-a machinist wife]336-his wife , who up to this very time had achieved little more than a bare living . From [her]124-esta childhood [she]124-esta had had nothing , only such gew - gaws and fripperies as [she]124-esta could secure for [herself]124-esta by [her]124-esta wits]1786-the daughter of a machinist and his wife , who up to this very time had achieved little more than a bare living . from her childhood she had had nothing , only such gew - gaws and fripperies as she could secure for herself by her wits . And so low had been [her]124-esta social state until very recently that [she]124-esta had not been able to come in contact with anything better than [butcher]1789-butcher and [baker boys]1790-baker boys — [the rather commonplace urchins and small job aspirants of [her]124-esta vicinity]1791-the rather commonplace urchins and small job aspirants of her vicinity . Yet even [here]2282-here [she]124-esta had early realized that [she]124-esta could and should capitalize [her]124-esta looks and charm — and had . Not a few of these had even gone so far as to steal in order to get money to entertain [her]124-esta .

After reaching the age where [she]124-esta was old enough to go to work , and thus coming in contact with [the type of [boy]325-boy and man in whom [she]124-esta was now interested]1793-the type of boy and man in whom she was now interested , [she]124-esta was beginning to see that without yielding [herself]124-esta too much , but in acting discreetly , [she]124-esta could win a more interesting equipment than [she]124-esta had before . Only , so truly sensual and pleasure - loving was [she]124-esta that [she]124-esta was by no means always willing to divorce [her]124-esta self - advantages from [her]124-esta pleasures . On the contrary , [she]124-esta was often troubled by a desire to like those whom [she]124-esta sought to use , and per contra , not to obligate [herself]124-esta to [those whom [she]124-esta could not like]1795-those whom she could not like .

In [Clyde]149-clyde 's case , liking [him]149-clyde but a little , [she]124-esta still could not resist the desire to use [him]149-clyde . [She]124-esta liked [his]149-clyde willingness to buy [her]124-esta any little thing in which [she]124-esta appeared interested — a bag , a scarf , a purse , a pair of gloves — anything that [she]124-esta could reasonably ask or take without obligating [herself]124-esta too much . And yet from the first , in [her]124-esta smart , tricky way , [she]124-esta realized that unless [she]124-esta could bring [herself]124-esta to yield to [him]149-clyde — at some time or other offer [him]149-clyde the definite reward which [she]124-esta knew [he]149-clyde craved — [she]124-esta could not hold [him]149-clyde indefinitely .

One thought that stirred [her]124-esta more than anything else was that the way [Clyde]149-clyde appeared to be willing to spend [his]149-clyde money on [her]124-esta [she]124-esta might easily get some quite expensive things from [him]149-clyde — a pretty and rather expensive dress , perhaps , or a hat , or even a fur coat such as was then being shown and worn in [the city]662-the city , to say nothing of gold earrings , or a wrist watch , all of which [she]124-esta was constantly and enviously eyeing in the different shop windows .

One day not so long after [Clyde]149-clyde 's discovery of [[his]149-clyde sister]531-his sister [Esta]124-esta , [Hortense]174-hortense , walking along [Baltimore Street]67-baltimore street near [its]67-baltimore street junction with [Fifteenth]68-fifteenth — [the smartest portion of [the shopping section of [the city]662-the city]1799-the shopping section of the city]1798-the smartest portion of the shopping section of the city — at the noon hour — with [Doris Trine]200-doris trine , [another shop girl in [[her]200-doris trine department store]1802-her department store]1801-another shop girl in her department store , saw in the window of [one of [the smaller and less exclusive fur stores of [the city]662-the city]1804-the smaller and less exclusive fur stores of the city]1803-one of the smaller and less exclusive fur stores of the city , a fur jacket of beaver that to [her]200-doris trine , viewed from the eye - point of [her]200-doris trine own particular build , coloring and temperament , was exactly what [she]200-doris trine needed to strengthen mightily [her]200-doris trine very limited personal wardrobe . It was not such an expensive coat , worth possibly a hundred dollars — but fashioned in such an individual way as to cause [her]200-doris trine to imagine that , once invested with it , [her]200-doris trine own physical charm would register more than it ever had .

Moved by this thought , [she]200-doris trine paused and exclaimed : " Oh , is n't that just the classiest , darlingest little coat [you]2629-you ever saw ! " Oh , if [I]200-doris trine could only have ' oo . "[200-doris trine]

[She]200-doris trine clapped [her]200-doris trine hands admiringly , while [Isadore Rubenstein]201-isadore rubenstein , [the elderly son of [the proprietor]1809-the proprietor , who was standing somewhat out of the range of [her]200-doris trine gaze at the moment]1808-the elderly son of the proprietor , who was standing somewhat out of the range of her gaze at the moment , noted the gesture and [her]200-doris trine enthusiasm and decided forthwith that the coat must be worth at least twenty - five or fifty dollars more to [her]200-doris trine , anyhow , in case [she]200-doris trine inquired for it . What , say , would the poverty and vanity of [such a pretty girl as this]1811-such a pretty girl as this cause [her]1811-such a pretty girl as this to yield for such a coat ?

In the meantime , however , [Hortense]174-hortense , having gloated as long as [her]174-hortense noontime hour would permit , had gone away , still dreaming and satiating [her]174-hortense flaming vanity by thinking of how devastating [she]174-hortense would look in such a coat . But [she]174-hortense had not stopped to ask the price . Hence , the next day , feeling that [she]174-hortense must look at it once more , [she]174-hortense returned , only this time alone , and yet with no idea of being able to purchase it [herself]174-hortense . On the contrary , [she]174-hortense was only vaguely revolving the problem of how , assuming that the coat was sufficiently low in price , [she]174-hortense could get it . At the moment [she]174-hortense could think of [no one]964-no one . But seeing the coat once more , and also seeing [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein , [Jr.]203-jr. , inside eyeing [her]174-hortense in a most propitiatory and genial manner , [she]174-hortense finally ventured in .

" [You]174-hortense like the coat , eh ? "[174-hortense] was [Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein 's ingratiating comment as [she]174-hortense opened the door . "[202-mr. rubenstein] A gleam of greedy admiration was in [his]202-mr. rubenstein eye .

And noting this , and feeling that a remote and yet not wholly unfriendly air would win [her]174-hortense more consideration and courtesy than a more intimate one , [Hortense]174-hortense merely said , " Yes ? "[174-hortense]

" Yes , indeed . And [I]202-mr. rubenstein said right away , there 's [a girl that knows a really swell coat]2633-a girl that knows a really swell coat when [she]2633-a girl that knows a really swell coat sees it . "[202-mr. rubenstein]

The flattering unction soothed , in spite of [herself]174-hortense .

" Look at that ! Look at that ! "[204-mr. rubinstein] went on [Mr. Rubinstein]204-mr. rubinstein , turning the coat about and holding it before [her]174-hortense . " Where in [Kansas City]5-kansas city will [you]174-hortense find anything to equal that today ? Look at this silk lining here — genuine Mallinson silk — and these slant pockets . And the buttons . "[204-mr. rubinstein] ( [He]204-mr. rubinstein led the way to a triple mirror at the back . ) " It takes [the right person]2636-the right person to wear a coat like this — to get the best effect out of it . Let [me]204-mr. rubinstein try it on [you]174-hortense . "[204-mr. rubinstein]

And by the artificial light [Hortense]174-hortense was now privileged to see how really fetching [she]174-hortense did look in it . [She]174-hortense cocked [her]174-hortense head and twisted and turned and buried one small ear in the fur , while [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein stood by , eyeing [her]174-hortense with not a little admiration and almost rubbing [his]202-mr. rubenstein hands .

" Well , it 's really a two - hundred - dollar coat , "[202-mr. rubenstein] began [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein artfully . [He]202-mr. rubenstein beamed ingratiatingly up at [her]174-hortense , and [Hortense]174-hortense , sensing the nature of the overture and resenting it — from [him]202-mr. rubenstein — drew back slightly . [He]202-mr. rubenstein smirked and shrugged [his]202-mr. rubenstein shoulders and acted as though [he]202-mr. rubenstein were indeed doing [her]1826-she a great favor . As [Hortense]174-hortense well knew [Clyde]149-clyde was pressing more and more hungrily toward that ultimate condescension on [her]174-hortense part , which , though [she]174-hortense would never have admitted it to [him]149-clyde , was the privilege of [two others]1828-two others . [They]1829-they were never together any more without [his]149-clyde insisting upon the real depth of [her]174-hortense regard for [him]149-clyde . Why was it , if [she]174-hortense cared for [him]149-clyde the least bit , that [she]174-hortense refused to do this , that or the other — would not let [him]149-clyde kiss [her]174-hortense as much as [he]149-clyde wished , would not let [him]149-clyde hold [her]174-hortense in [his]149-clyde arms as much as [he]149-clyde would like . [She]174-hortense was always keeping dates with [other fellows]1830-other fellows and breaking [them]1830-other fellows or refusing to make [them]1830-other fellows with [him]149-clyde . What was [her]174-hortense exact relationship toward [these others]1140-these others ? Did [she]174-hortense really care more for [them]1140-these others than [she]174-hortense did for [him]149-clyde ? In fact , [they]1832-they were never together anywhere but what this problem of union was uppermost — and but thinly veiled .

And [she]174-hortense liked to think that [he]149-clyde was suffering from repressed desire for [her]174-hortense all of the time that [she]174-hortense tortured [him]149-clyde , and that the power to allay [his]149-clyde suffering lay wholly in [her]174-hortense — a sadistic trait which had for [its]1833-its soil [Clyde]149-clyde 's own masochistic yearning for [her]174-hortense .

However , in the face of [her]174-hortense desire for the coat , [his]149-clyde stature and interest for [her]174-hortense were beginning to increase . In spite of the fact that only the morning before [she]174-hortense had informed [Clyde]149-clyde , with quite a flourish , that [she]174-hortense could not possibly see [him]149-clyde until the following Monday — that all [her]174-hortense intervening nights were taken — nevertheless , the problem of the coat looming up before [her]174-hortense , [she]174-hortense now most eagerly planned to contrive an immediate engagement with [him]149-clyde without appearing too eager . For by then [she]174-hortense had definitely decided to endeavor to persuade [him]149-clyde , if possible , to buy the coat for [her]174-hortense . Only of course , [she]174-hortense would have to alter [her]174-hortense conduct toward [him]149-clyde radically . [She]174-hortense would have to be much sweeter — more enticing . Although [she]174-hortense did not actually say to [herself]174-hortense that now [she]174-hortense might even be willing to yield [herself]174-hortense to [him]149-clyde , still basically that was what was in [her]174-hortense mind .

For quite a little while [she]174-hortense was unable to think how to proceed . How was [she]174-hortense to see [him]149-clyde this day , or the next at the very latest ? How should [she]174-hortense go about putting before [him]149-clyde the need of this gift , or loan , as [she]174-hortense finally worded it to [herself]174-hortense ? [She]174-hortense might hint that [he]149-clyde could loan [her]174-hortense enough to buy the coat and that later [she]174-hortense would pay [him]149-clyde back by degrees ( yet once in possession of the coat [she]174-hortense well knew that that necessity would never confront [her]174-hortense ) . [He]149-clyde was not made unduly curious because of this sudden favor , and the next evening , promptly at six - thirty , and in the glow of the overhanging arc - lights showering their glistening radiance like rain , [she]174-hortense appeared . As [he]149-clyde noted , at once , [she]174-hortense had worn the hat [he]149-clyde liked . Also [she]174-hortense was enticingly ebullient and friendly , more so than at any time [he]149-clyde had known [her]174-hortense . And [he]149-clyde , aroused by [her]174-hortense intense interest , surveyed the coat with not a little curiosity . Unquestionably it was a pretty coat — very . To [his]149-clyde intense dismay and dissatisfaction [she]174-hortense exclaimed :

" Oh , what would n't [I]174-hortense give for a coat like that ! "[174-hortense] [She]174-hortense had not intended at the moment to put the matter so bluntly , for [she]174-hortense wanted to convey the thought that was deepest in [her]174-hortense mind to [Clyde]149-clyde tactfully .

And [Clyde]149-clyde , inexperienced as [he]149-clyde was , and not subtle by any means , was nevertheless quite able to gather the meaning of that . As [he]149-clyde thought of it , [he]149-clyde actually thrilled and trembled beside [her]174-hortense . " No - o , "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense hesitated at first , for the moment troubled as to whether to give the exact price or something higher . [Clyde]149-clyde heaved a sigh of relief . After all , it was n't two or three hundred . [He]149-clyde felt a little weak before [her]174-hortense now — a little cowardly — in the face of what [he]149-clyde assumed [her]174-hortense real affection might mean .

And [she]174-hortense on [her]174-hortense part replied that [she]174-hortense was going the very next day to see about it . And then in real gratitude to [Clyde]149-clyde [she]174-hortense whispered to [him]149-clyde , coming out of [the restaurant]1872-the restaurant and purring like a cat , that [she]174-hortense would never forget this and that [he]149-clyde would see — and that [she]174-hortense would wear it for [him]149-clyde the very first time .
