[She]174-hortense suggested that [they]1873-they go to [a certain dance hall]1836-a certain dance hall , and there [she]174-hortense clung to [him]149-clyde in the dances in a suggestive way and afterwards hinted of a mood which made [Clyde]149-clyde a little quivery and erratic .

[He]149-clyde finally went [home]533-home , dreaming of the day , satisfied that [he]149-clyde would have no trouble in bringing together the first payment , if it were so much as fifty , even . For now , under the spur of this promise , [he]149-clyde proposed to borrow as much as twenty - five from either [Ratterer]158-ratterer or [Hegglund]142-hegglund , and to repay it after the coat was paid for .

But , ah , [the beautiful Hortense]174-hortense . The charm of [her]174-hortense , the enormous , compelling , weakening delight . And to think that at last , and soon , [she]174-hortense was to be [his]149-clyde . It was , plainly , of such stuff as dreams are made of — the unbelievable become real .

True to [her]174-hortense promise , the following day [Hortense]174-hortense returned to [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein , and with all the cunning of [her]174-hortense nature placed before [him]202-mr. rubenstein , with many reservations , the nature of the dilemma which confronted [her]174-hortense . Could [she]174-hortense , by any chance , have the coat for one hundred and fifteen dollars on an easy payment plan ? [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein 's head forthwith began to wag a solemn negative . This was not an easy payment store . If [he]202-mr. rubenstein wanted to do business that way [he]202-mr. rubenstein could charge two hundred for the coat and easily get it .

" But [I]174-hortense could pay as much as fifty dollars when [I]174-hortense took the coat , "[174-hortense] argued [Hortense]174-hortense .

" Very good . But who is to guarantee that [I]174-hortense get the other sixty - five , and when ? "[174-hortense]

" Next week twenty - five , and the week after that twenty five and the next week after that fifteen . "[174-hortense]

" Of course . But supposin ' the next day after [you]202-mr. rubenstein take the coat an [automobile]2667-automobile runs [you]202-mr. rubenstein down and kills [you]202-mr. rubenstein . Then what ? How do [I]174-hortense get [my]174-hortense money ? "[174-hortense]

Now that was a poser . And there was really no way that [she]174-hortense could prove that [any one]511-any one would pay for the coat . And before that there would have to be all the bother of making out a contract , and getting [some really responsible person]1877-some really responsible person — [a banker]1878-a banker , say — to endorse it . No , no , this was not [an easy payment house]1879-an easy payment house . This was [a cash house]1880-a cash house . That was why the coat was offered to [her]174-hortense at one hundred and fifteen , but not a dollar less . Not a dollar .

[Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein sighed and talked on . And finally [Hortense]174-hortense asked [him]202-mr. rubenstein if [she]174-hortense could give [him]202-mr. rubenstein seventy - five dollars cash in hand , the other forty to be paid in one week 's time . Would [he]202-mr. rubenstein let [her]174-hortense have the coat then — to take [home]533-home with [her]174-hortense ?

" But a week — a week — what is a week then ? "[202-mr. rubenstein] argued [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein . " If [you]174-hortense can bring [me]202-mr. rubenstein seventy - five next week or to - morrow , and forty more in another week or ten days , why not wait a week and bring the whole hundred and fifteen ? [No one]964-no one can even see it then . In another week bring [me]202-mr. rubenstein the balance or in two weeks . Then it is [yours]174-hortense . "[202-mr. rubenstein] [Mr. Rubenstein]202-mr. rubenstein explained the process as though it were a difficult matter to grasp .

But the argument once made was sound enough . It really left [Hortense]174-hortense little to argue about . At the same time it reduced [her]174-hortense spirit not a little . To think of not being able to take it now . And yet , once out of [the place]576-the place , [her]174-hortense vigor revived . For , after all , the time fixed would soon pass and if [Clyde]149-clyde performed [his]149-clyde part of the agreement promptly , the coat would be [hers]174-hortense . The important thing now was to make [him]149-clyde give [her]174-hortense twenty - five or thirty dollars wherewith to bind this wonderful agreement . Only now , because of the fact that [she]174-hortense felt that [she]174-hortense needed a new hat to go with the coat , [she]174-hortense decided to say that it cost one hundred and twenty - five instead of one hundred and fifteen .

And once this conclusion was put before [Clyde]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde saw it as a very reasonable arrangement — all things considered — quite a respite from the feeling of strain that had settled upon [him]149-clyde after [his]149-clyde last conversation with [Hortense]174-hortense . For , after all , [he]149-clyde had not seen how [he]149-clyde was to raise more than thirty - five dollars this first week anyhow . The following week would be somewhat easier , for then , as [he]149-clyde told [himself]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde proposed to borrow twenty or twenty - five from [Ratterer]158-ratterer if [he]149-clyde could , which , joined with the twenty or twenty - five which [his]149-clyde tips would bring [him]149-clyde , would be quite sufficient to meet the second payment . The week following [he]149-clyde proposed to borrow at least ten or fifteen from [Hegglund]142-hegglund — maybe more — and if that did not make up the required amount to pawn [his]149-clyde watch for fifteen dollars , the watch [he]149-clyde had bought for [himself]149-clyde a few months before . It ought to bring that at least ; it cost fifty .

But , [he]149-clyde now thought , there was [Esta]124-esta in [[her]124-esta wretched room]1883-her wretched room awaiting the most unhappy result of [her]124-esta one romance . How was [she]124-esta to make out , [he]149-clyde asked [himself]149-clyde , even in the face of the fact that [he]149-clyde feared to be included in the financial problem which [Esta]124-esta as well as [the family]279-the family presented . [[His]149-clyde father]276-his father was not now , and never had been , of any real financial service to [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother . And yet , if the problem were on this account to be shifted to [him]149-clyde , how would [he]149-clyde make out ? Why need [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father always peddle clocks and rugs and preach on [the streets]376-the streets ? Why could n't [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [father]271-father give up the mission idea , anyhow ?

But , as [he]149-clyde knew , the situation was not to be solved without [his]149-clyde aid . And the proof of it came toward the end of the second week of [his]149-clyde arrangement with [Hortense]174-hortense , when , with fifty dollars in [his]149-clyde pocket , which [he]149-clyde was planning to turn over to [her]174-hortense on the following Sunday , [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother , looking into [[his]149-clyde bedroom]1892-his bedroom where [he]149-clyde was dressing , said : " [I]149-clyde 'd like to see [you]149-clyde for a minute , [Clyde]149-clyde , before [you]149-clyde go out . "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde noted [she]270-his mother was very grave as [she]270-his mother said this . As a matter of fact , for several days past , [he]149-clyde had been sensing that [she]270-his mother was undergoing a strain of some kind . At the same time [he]149-clyde had been thinking all this while that with [his]149-clyde own resources hypothecated as they were , [he]149-clyde could do nothing . Or , if [he]149-clyde did it meant the loss of [Hortense]174-hortense . [He]149-clyde dared not .

And yet what reasonable excuse could [he]149-clyde give [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother for not helping [her]270-his mother a little , considering especially the clothes [he]149-clyde wore , and the manner in which [he]149-clyde had been running here and there , always giving the excuse of working , but probably not deceiving [her]270-his mother as much as [he]149-clyde thought . To be sure , only two months before , [he]149-clyde had obligated [himself]149-clyde to pay [her]270-his mother ten dollars a week more for five weeks , and had . But that only proved to [her]270-his mother very likely that [he]149-clyde had so much extra to give , even though [he]149-clyde had tried to make it clear at the time that [he]149-clyde was pinching [himself]149-clyde to do it . And yet , however much [he]149-clyde chose to waver in [her]270-his mother favor , [he]149-clyde could not , with [his]149-clyde desire for [Hortense]174-hortense directly confronting [him]149-clyde .

[He]149-clyde went out into [the living - room]1894-the living - room after a time , and as usual [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother at once led the way to one of the benches in [the mission]581-the mission — [a cheerless , cold room]1897-a cheerless , cold room these days .

" [I]1898-i did n't think [I]1898-i 'd have to speak to [you]149-clyde about this , [Clyde]149-clyde , but [I]1898-i do n't see any other way out of it . [I]1898-i do n't want [them]264-the others to know . But [Esta]124-esta 's back here in [Kansas City]5-kansas city and in trouble , and [I]1898-i do n't know quite what to do about [her]124-esta . [I]1898-i have so very little money to do with , and [[your]149-clyde father]2598-your father 's not very much of a help to [me]1898-i any more . "[1898-i]

[She]1898-i passed a weary , reflective hand across [her]1898-i forehead and [Clyde]149-clyde knew what was coming . [His]149-clyde first thought was to pretend that [he]149-clyde did not know that [Esta]124-esta was in [the city]662-the city , since [he]149-clyde had been pretending this way for so long . "[149-clyde]

" [You]149-clyde know ? "[270-his mother] queried [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother , surprised .

" Yes , [I]149-clyde know , "[149-clyde] [Clyde]149-clyde repeated . " Tst ! Tst ! Tst ! "[270-his mother] clicked [Mrs. Griffiths]126-mrs. griffiths , with [her]270-his mother tongue . " Then [you]149-clyde know what the trouble is . "[126-mrs. griffiths]

" Yes , "[149-clyde] replied [Clyde]149-clyde .

" Well , what is to be will be , "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother said resignedly . " [You]149-clyde have n't mentioned it to [Frank]134-frank or [Julia]133-julia , have [you]149-clyde ? "[270-his mother]

" No , "[149-clyde] replied [Clyde]149-clyde , thoughtfully , thinking of what a failure [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother had made of [her]270-his mother attempt to be secretive . " Well , [you]149-clyde must n't , "[270-his mother] cautioned [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother solemnly . " It is n't best for [them]2676-them to know , [I]270-his mother think . " And to think , "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother added , after a moment , [her]270-his mother eyes filling with a sad , all - enveloping gray mist , " [she]270-his mother should have brought all this on [herself]270-his mother and on [us]2677-us . ' The way of [the transgressor]2678-the transgressor — ' "[270-his mother]

[She]270-his mother shook [her]270-his mother head and put [her]270-his mother two large hands together and gripped them firmly , while [Clyde]149-clyde stared , thinking of the situation and all that it might mean to [him]149-clyde .

[She]270-his mother sat there , quite reduced and bewildered by [her]270-his mother own peculiar part in all this . [She]270-his mother had been as deceiving as [any one]511-any one , really . And here was [Clyde]149-clyde , now , fully informed as to [her]270-his mother falsehoods and strategy , and [herself]270-his mother looking foolish and untrue . But had [she]270-his mother not been trying to save [him]149-clyde from all this — [him]149-clyde and [the others]264-the others ? And [he]149-clyde was old enough to understand that now . Yet [she]270-his mother now proceeded to explain why , and to say how dreadful [she]270-his mother felt it all to be . At the same time , as [she]270-his mother also explained , now [she]270-his mother was compelled to come to [him]149-clyde for aid in connection with it .

" [Esta]124-esta 's about to be very sick , "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother went on suddenly and stiffly , not being able , or at least willing , apparently , to look at [Clyde]149-clyde as [she]270-his mother said it , and yet determined to be as frank as possible . " [She]124-esta 'll need [a doctor]2679-a doctor very shortly and [some one]2296-some one to be with [her]124-esta all the time when [I]270-his mother 'm not [there]443-there . [She]1909-her looked at [Clyde]149-clyde so tensely , so urgently , that [he]149-clyde felt quite shaken by the force of the cogency of the request . And before [he]149-clyde could add anything to the nervous gloom which shadowed [her]1909-her face , [she]1909-her added : " That other money was for [her]1909-her , [you]149-clyde know , to bring [her]1909-her back here after [her]1909-her — [her"—she]1909-her[1909-her] hesitated over the appropriate word but finally added—"husband left [her]1909-her there in [Pittsburgh]66-pittsburgh . " Yes , [she]1909-her did , "[149-clyde] replied [Clyde]149-clyde , heavily and sadly . For after all , [Esta]124-esta 's condition was plainly critical , which was something that [he]149-clyde had not stopped to meditate on before .

" Gee , [Ma]2685-ma , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde exclaimed , the thought of the fifty dollars in [his]149-clyde pocket and its intended destination troubling [him]149-clyde considerably — the very sum [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother was seeking . " [I]149-clyde do n't know whether [I]149-clyde can do that or not . [I]149-clyde do n't know [any of [the boys down there]2687-the boys down there]2686-any of the boys down there well enough for that . And [they]2687-the boys down there do n't make any more than [I]149-clyde do , either . [I]149-clyde might borrow a little something , but it wo n't look very good . "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde choked and swallowed a little , for lying to [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother in this way was not easy . In fact , [he]149-clyde had never had occasion to lie in connection with anything so trying — and so despicably . For here was fifty dollars in [his]149-clyde pocket at the moment , with [Hortense]174-hortense on the one hand and [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother and [sister]1226-sister on the other , and the money would solve [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother 's problem as fully as it would [Hortense]174-hortense 's , and more respectably . How terrible it was not to help [her]270-his mother . How could [he]149-clyde refuse [her]270-his mother , really ? Nervously [he]149-clyde licked [his]149-clyde lips and passed a hand over [his]149-clyde brow , for a nervous moisture had broken out upon [his]149-clyde face . [He]149-clyde felt strained and mean and incompetent under the circumstances .

" And [you]149-clyde have n't any money of [your]149-clyde own right now that [you]149-clyde could let [me]270-his mother have , have [you]149-clyde ? "[270-his mother] [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother half pleaded . For there were a number of things in connection with [Esta]124-esta 's condition which required immediate cash and [she]270-his mother had so little .

" No , [I]149-clyde have n't , [Ma]183-ma , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde said , looking at [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother shamefacedly , for a moment , then away , and if it had not been that [she]270-his mother [herself]270-his mother was so distrait , [she]270-his mother might have seen the falsehood on [his]149-clyde face . As it was , [he]149-clyde suffered a pang of commingled self - commiseration and self - contempt , based on the distress [he]149-clyde felt for [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother . [He]149-clyde could not bring [himself]149-clyde to think of losing [Hortense]174-hortense . [He]149-clyde must have [her]270-his mother . And yet [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother looked so lone and so resourceless . It was shameful . [He]149-clyde was low , really mean . Might [he]149-clyde not , later , be punished for a thing like this ?

[He]149-clyde tried to think of some other way — some way of getting a little money over and above the fifty that might help . If only [he]149-clyde had a little more time — a few weeks longer . If only [Hortense]174-hortense had not brought up this coat idea just now .

" [I]149-clyde 'll tell [you]270-his mother what [I]149-clyde might do , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde went on , quite foolishly and dully the while [[his]149-clyde mother]270-his mother gave vent to a helpless " Tst ! " And [I]149-clyde 'll see what [I]149-clyde can do next week . [I]149-clyde might let [you]270-his mother have ten then . [I]149-clyde ca n't say for sure . "[149-clyde]

[[His]149-clyde mother]270-his mother sighed , thinking of the misery of having to fall back on [[her]270-his mother one son]1921-her one son thus far . And just when [he]149-clyde was trying to get a start , too . What would [he]149-clyde think of all this in after years ? What would [he]149-clyde think of [her]270-his mother — of [Esta]124-esta — [the family]279-the family ? For , for all [his]149-clyde ambition and courage and desire to be out and doing , [Clyde]149-clyde always struck [her]270-his mother as one who was not any too powerful physically or rock - ribbed morally or mentally . So far as [his]149-clyde nerves and emotions were concerned , at times [he]149-clyde seemed to take after [[his]149-clyde father]276-his father more than [he]149-clyde did after [her]270-his mother . And for the most part it was so easy to excite [him]149-clyde — to cause [him]149-clyde to show tenseness and strain — as though [he]149-clyde were not so very well fitted for either . And it was [she]270-his mother , because of [Esta]124-esta and [[her]124-esta husband]593-her husband and [their]1925-their joint and unfortunate lives , that was and had been heaping the greater part of this strain on [him]149-clyde .

" Well , if [you]149-clyde ca n't , [you]149-clyde ca n't , "[270-his mother] [she]270-his mother said . " [I]270-his mother must try and think of some other way . "[270-his mother] But [she]270-his mother saw no clear way at the moment .

In connection with the automobile ride suggested and arranged for the following Sunday by [Hegglund]142-hegglund through [[his]142-hegglund chauffeur friend]1926-his chauffeur friend , a change of plan was announced . [The car]974-the car — [an expensive Packard]1928-an expensive packard , no less — could not be had for that day , but must be used by this Thursday or Friday , or not at all . For , as had been previously explained to all , but not with the strictest adherence to the truth , [the car]974-the car belonged to [a certain [Mr. Kimbark]209-mr. kimbark]1930-a certain mr. kimbark , [an elderly and very wealthy man who at the time was traveling in [Asia]79-asia]1931-an elderly and very wealthy man who at the time was traveling in asia . Also , what was not true was that [this particular youth]1932-this particular youth was not [[Mr. Kimbark]209-mr. kimbark 's chauffeur]1933-mr. kimbark 's chauffeur at all , but rather [the rakish , ne'er - do - well son of [Sparser]210-sparser]1934-the rakish , ne'er - do - well son of sparser , [the superintendent of one of [[Mr. Kimbark]209-mr. kimbark 's stock farms]1936-mr. kimbark 's stock farms]1935-the superintendent of one of mr. kimbark 's stock farms . [This son]1937-this son being anxious to pose as something more than [the son of [a superintendent of [a farm]1940-a farm]1939-a superintendent of a farm]1938-the son of a superintendent of a farm , and as [an occasional watchman]1941-an occasional watchman , having access to [the cars]1068-the cars , had decided to take the very finest of [them]1068-the cars and ride in it .

It was [Hegglund]142-hegglund who proposed that [he]142-hegglund and [[his]142-hegglund hotel friends]1943-his hotel friends be included on some interesting trip . But since the general invitation had been given , word had come that within the next few weeks [Mr. Kimbark]209-mr. kimbark was likely to return . And because of this , [Willard Sparser]210-sparser had decided at once that it might be best not to use [the car]974-the car any more . [He]210-sparser might be taken unawares , perhaps , by [Mr. Kimbark]209-mr. kimbark 's unexpected arrival . Laying this difficulty before [Hegglund]142-hegglund , who was eager for the trip , [the latter]898-the latter had scouted the idea . Why not use it once more anyhow ? [He]142-hegglund had stirred up the interest of [all of [[his]142-hegglund friends]1947-his friends]1946-all of his friends in this and now hated to disappoint [them]1946-all of his friends . The following Friday , between noon and six o'clock , was fixed upon as the day . And since [Hortense]174-hortense had changed in [her]174-hortense plans [she]174-hortense now decided to accompany [Clyde]149-clyde , who had been invited , of course .

But as [Hegglund]142-hegglund had explained to [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Higby]162-higby since it was being used without [the owner]1948-the owner 's consent , [they]1949-they must meet rather far out — [the men in one of [the quiet streets near [Seventeenth]80-seventeenth and [West Prospect]81-west prospect]1951-the quiet streets near seventeenth and west prospect , from which point [they]1949-they could proceed to [a meeting place more convenient for [the girls]1412-the girls , namely , [Twentieth]82-twentieth and [Washington]83-washington]1952-a meeting place more convenient for the girls , namely , twentieth and washington]1950-the men in one of the quiet streets near seventeenth and west prospect , from which point they could proceed to a meeting place more convenient for the girls , namely , twentieth and washington . From thence [they]1949-they would speed via [the west Parkway]1954-the west parkway and [the Hannibal Bridge]1955-the hannibal bridge north and east to [Harlem]84-harlem , [North Kansas City]85-north kansas city , [Minaville]86-minaville and so through [Liberty]87-liberty and [Moseby]88-moseby to [Excelsior Springs]73-excelsior springs . [Their]1949-they chief objective there was [a little inn]1956-a little inn — [the Wigwam]90-the wigwam — a mile or two this side of [Excelsior]91-excelsior which was open the year around . [It]1956-a little inn was really a combination of [restaurant and dancing parlor and hotel]1957-restaurant and dancing parlor and hotel . [A Victrola and Wurlitzer player - piano]1958-a victrola and wurlitzer player - piano furnished the necessary music . [Such groups as this]1959-such groups as this were not infrequent , and [Hegglund]142-hegglund as well as [Higby]162-higby , who had been [there]443-there on several occasions , described it as dandy . The food was good and the road to [it]443-there excellent . There was [a little river just below [it]1961-a little river just below it where in the summer time at least there was rowing and fishing where in the summer time at least there was rowing and fishing]1961-a little river just below it where in the summer time at least there was rowing and fishing . In winter [some people]1962-some people skated when there was ice . To be sure , at this time — January — [the road]1963-the road was heavily packed with snow , but easy to get over , and the scenery fine . There was [a little lake]1964-a little lake , not so far from [Excelsior]91-excelsior , at this time of year also frozen over , and according to [Hegglund]142-hegglund , who was always unduly imaginative and high - spirited , [they]1962-some people might go there and skate .

" Will [you]2689-you listen to who 's talkin ' about skatin ' on a trip like this ? "[158-ratterer] commented [Ratterer]158-ratterer , rather cynically , for to [his]158-ratterer way of thinking this was no occasion for any such side athletics , but for love - making exclusively .

" Aw , hell , ca n't [a fellow]2690-a fellow have a funny idea even widout bein ' roasted for it ? "[1965-the author of the idea] retorted [the author of the idea]1965-the author of the idea .

The only one , apart from [Sparser]210-sparser , who suffered any qualms in connection with all this was [Clyde]149-clyde [himself]149-clyde . For to [him]149-clyde , from the first , the fact that [the car]974-the car to be used did not belong to [Sparser]210-sparser , but to [[his]149-clyde employer]1967-his employer , was disturbing , almost irritatingly so . [He]149-clyde did not like the idea of taking anything that belonged to [any one else]454-any one else , even for temporary use . Something might happen . [They]1969-they might be found out .

" Do n't [you]158-ratterer think it 's dangerous for [us]2691-us to be going out in [this car]2692-this car ? "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde asked of [Ratterer]158-ratterer a few days before the trip and when [he]149-clyde fully understood the nature of the source of [the car]974-the car .

" Oh , [I]158-ratterer do n't know , "[158-ratterer] replied [Ratterer]158-ratterer , who being accustomed to such ideas and devices as this was not much disturbed by [them]1969-they . " [I]158-ratterer 'm not taking [the car]974-the car and [you]158-ratterer 're not , are [you]158-ratterer ? If [he]149-clyde wants to take it , that 's [his]149-clyde lookout , ai n't it ? If [he]149-clyde wants [me]158-ratterer to go , [I]158-ratterer 'll go . Why would n't [I]158-ratterer ? All [I]158-ratterer want is to be brought back here on time . That 's the only thing that would ever worry [me]158-ratterer . "[158-ratterer]

[And Higby]162-higby , coming up at the moment , had voiced exactly the same sentiments . Yet [Clyde]149-clyde remained troubled . It might not work out right ; [he]149-clyde might lose [his]149-clyde job through a thing like this . But so fascinated was [he]149-clyde by the thought of riding in such [a fine car]1971-a fine car with [Hortense]174-hortense and with all [these other girls]1972-these other girls and [boys]296-boys that [he]149-clyde could not resist the temptation to go .

Immediately after noon on the Friday of this particular week [the several participants of the outing]1974-the several participants of the outing were gathered at the points agreed upon . [Hegglund]142-hegglund , [Ratterer]158-ratterer , [Higby]162-higby and [Clyde]149-clyde at [Eighteenth]92-eighteenth and [West Prospect]81-west prospect near [the railroad yards]1975-the railroad yards . [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod , [[Hegglund]142-hegglund 's girl]1976-hegglund 's girl , [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas , [a friend of [Ratterer]158-ratterer 's]1977-a friend of ratterer 's , and [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel , [a friend of [Higby]162-higby 's]1978-a friend of higby 's , also [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , [another girl who was brought by [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel to be introduced to [Sparser]210-sparser for the occasion , at [Twentieth]82-twentieth and [Washington]83-washington]1979-another girl who was brought by tina kogel to be introduced to sparser for the occasion , at twentieth and washington . Only since [Hortense]174-hortense had sent word at the last moment to [Clyde]149-clyde that [she]174-hortense had to go out to [[her]174-hortense house]1980-her house for something , and that [they]1981-they were to run out to [Forty - ninth]94-forty - ninth and [Genesee]95-genesee , where [she]174-hortense lived , [they]1981-they did so , but not without grumbling .

The day , a late January one , was inclined to be smoky with lowering clouds , especially within [the environs of [Kansas City]5-kansas city]1982-the environs of kansas city . It even threatened snow at times — a most interesting and picturesque prospect to those within . [They]1981-they liked it .

" Oh , gee , [I]213-tina kogel hope it does , "[213-tina kogel] [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel exclaimed when [some one]2296-some one commented on the possibility , and [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas added : " Oh , [I]212-lucille nickolas just love to see it snow at times . "[212-lucille nickolas] Along [the West Bluff Road]1984-the west bluff road , [Washington]83-washington and [Second Streets]96-second streets , [they]1981-they finally made [their]1981-they way across [the Hannibal Bridge]97-the hannibal bridge to [Harlem]84-harlem , and from thence along [the winding and hill - sentineled river road]1985-the winding and hill - sentineled river road to [Randolph Heights]98-randolph heights and [Minaville]86-minaville . And beyond that came [Moseby]88-moseby and [Liberty]87-liberty , to and through which [the road]1963-the road bed was better , with interesting glimpses of [small homesteads]1987-small homesteads and [the bleak snow - covered hills of [January]99-january]1988-the bleak snow - covered hills of january .

[Clyde]149-clyde , who for all [his]149-clyde years in [Kansas City]5-kansas city had never ventured much beyond [Kansas City]5-kansas city , [Kansas]39-kansas , on [the west]480-the west or [the primitive and natural woods of [Swope Park]100-swope park]1990-the primitive and natural woods of swope park on [the east]459-the east , nor farther along [the Kansas]39-kansas or [Missouri Rivers]102-missouri rivers than [Argentine]103-argentine on the one side and [Randolph Heights]98-randolph heights on the other , was quite fascinated by the idea of travel which appeared to be suggested by all this — distant travel . It was all so different from [his]149-clyde ordinary routine . And on this occasion [Hortense]174-hortense was inclined to be very genial and friendly . [She]174-hortense snuggled down beside [him]149-clyde on the seat , and when [he]149-clyde , noting that [the others]264-the others had already drawn [[their]264-the others girls]1993-their girls to [them]264-the others in affectionate embraces , put [his]149-clyde arm about [her]174-hortense and drew [her]174-hortense to [him]149-clyde , [she]174-hortense made no particular protest . Instead [she]174-hortense looked up and said : " [I]174-hortense 'll have to take [my]174-hortense hat off , [I]174-hortense guess . "[174-hortense] [The others]264-the others laughed . There was something about [her]174-hortense quick , crisp way which was amusing at times . Besides [she]174-hortense had done [her]174-hortense hair in a new way which made [her]174-hortense look decidedly prettier , and [she]174-hortense was anxious to have [the others]264-the others see it .

" Can [we]2694-we dance anywhere out here ? "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense called to [the others]264-the others , without looking around .

" Surest thing [you]174-hortense know , "[162-higby] said [Higby]162-higby , who by now had persuaded [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel to take [her]174-hortense hat off and was holding [her]174-hortense close . " [They]264-the others got a player - piano and a Victrola out there . If [I]162-higby 'd ' a ' thought , [I]162-higby 'd ' a ' brought [my]162-higby cornet . [I]162-higby can play [Dixie]216-dixie on that . "[162-higby]

[The car]974-the car was speeding at breakneck pace over [a snowy white road]1998-a snowy white road and between [white fields]1999-white fields . In fact , [Sparser]210-sparser , considering [himself]210-sparser [a master of car manipulation]2000-a master of car manipulation as well as [the real owner of it for the moment]2001-the real owner of it for the moment , was attempting to see how fast [he]210-sparser could go on [such a road]2002-such a road .

Dark vignettes of wood went by to right and left . Fields away , [sentinel hills]2003-sentinel hills rose and fell like waves . A wide - armed scarecrow fluttering in the wind , its tall decayed hat awry , stood near at hand in one place . And from near it a flock of crows rose and winged direct toward a distant wood lightly penciled against a foreground of snow .

In the front seat sat [Sparser]210-sparser , guiding [the car]974-the car beside [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe with the air of one to whom [such a magnificent car]2005-such a magnificent car was a commonplace thing . [He]210-sparser was really more interested in [Hortense]174-hortense , yet felt it incumbent on [him]210-sparser , for the time being , anyhow , to show some attention to [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe . And not to be outdone in gallantry by [the others]264-the others , [he]210-sparser now put one arm about [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe while [he]210-sparser guided [the car]974-the car with the other , a feat which troubled [Clyde]149-clyde , who was still dubious about the wisdom of taking [the car]974-the car at all . [They]2009-they might all be wrecked by such fast driving . [Hortense]174-hortense was only interested by the fact that [Sparser]210-sparser had obviously manifested [his]210-sparser interest in [her]174-hortense ; that [he]210-sparser had to pay some attention to [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe whether [he]210-sparser wanted to or not . And when [she]174-hortense saw [him]210-sparser pull [her]174-hortense to [him]210-sparser and asked [her]174-hortense grandly if [she]174-hortense had done much automobiling about [Kansas City]5-kansas city , [she]174-hortense merely smiled to [herself]174-hortense .

But [Ratterer]158-ratterer , noting the move , nudged [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas , and [she]174-hortense in turn nudged [Higby]162-higby , in order to attract [his]210-sparser attention to the affectional development ahead .

" Getting comfortable up front there , [Willard]210-sparser ? "[158-ratterer] called [Ratterer]158-ratterer , genially , in order to make friends with [him]210-sparser .

" [I]210-sparser 'll say [I]210-sparser am , "[210-sparser] replied [Sparser]210-sparser , gayly and without turning . " How about [you]174-hortense , [girlie]2695-girlie ? "[210-sparser]

" Oh , [I]214-laura sipe 'm all right , "[214-laura sipe] [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe replied .

But [Clyde]149-clyde was thinking that of all [the girls present]2010-the girls present [none]2011-none was really so pretty as [Hortense]174-hortense — not nearly . [She]174-hortense had come garbed in a red and black dress with a very dark red poke bonnet to match . And on [her]174-hortense left cheek , just below [her]174-hortense small rouged mouth , [she]174-hortense had pasted a minute square of black court plaster in imitation of some picture beauty [she]174-hortense had seen . In fact , before the outing began , [she]174-hortense had been determined to outshine [all the others present]2012-all the others present , and distinctly [she]174-hortense was now feeling that [she]174-hortense was succeeding . And [Clyde]149-clyde , for [himself]149-clyde , was agreeing with [her]174-hortense .

" [You]174-hortense 're the cutest thing here , "[149-clyde] whispered [Clyde]149-clyde , hugging [her]174-hortense fondly .

" Gee , but [you]149-clyde can pour on the molasses , [kid]2696-kid , when [you]149-clyde want to , "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense called out loud , and [the others]264-the others laughed . And [Clyde]149-clyde flushed slightly .

Beyond [Minaville]86-minaville about six miles [the car]974-the car came to a bend in [a hollow where there was [a country store]2016-a country store]2015-a hollow where there was a country store and here [Hegglund]142-hegglund , [Higby]162-higby and [Ratterer]158-ratterer got out to fetch candy , cigarettes and ice cream cones and ginger ale . And after that came [Liberty]87-liberty , and then several miles [this side of [Excelsior Springs]73-excelsior springs]2017-this side of excelsior springs , [they]2018-they sighted [the Wigwam]90-the wigwam which was nothing more than [an old two - story farmhouse]2019-an old two - story farmhouse snuggled against [a rise of ground behind [it]90-the wigwam]2020-a rise of ground behind it . There was , however , adjoining [it]90-the wigwam on one side [a newer and larger one - story addition consisting of [the dining - room]1069-the dining - room]2021-a newer and larger one - story addition consisting of the dining - room , the dance floor , and concealed by a partition at one end , a bar . An open fire flickered cheerfully here in a large fireplace . Down in [a hollow across [the road]1963-the road]2023-a hollow across the road might be seen [the Benton River]104-the benton river or [creek , now frozen solid]2025-creek , now frozen solid .

" There 's [[your]213-tina kogel river]2697-your river , "[162-higby] called [Higby]162-higby cheerfully as [he]162-higby helped [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel out of [the car]974-the car , for [he]162-higby was already very much warmed by several drinks [he]162-higby had taken en route . [They]2018-they all paused for a moment to admire [the stream]2027-the stream , winding away among the trees . " [I]142-hegglund wanted dis bunch to bring dere skates and go down dere , "[142-hegglund] sighed [Hegglund]142-hegglund , " but [dey]162-higby would n't . Well , dat 's all right . "[142-hegglund]

By then [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas , seeing a flicker of flame reflected in one of the small windows of [the inn]2028-the inn , called , " Oh , see , [they]2018-they got ta fire . "[212-lucille nickolas]

[The car]974-the car was parked , and [they]2018-they all trooped into [the inn]2028-the inn , and at once [Higby]162-higby briskly went over and started [the large , noisy , clattery , tinny Nickelodeon]2031-the large , noisy , clattery , tinny nickelodeon with a nickel . And to rival [him]162-higby , and for a prank , [Hegglund]142-hegglund ran to [the Victrola which stood in one corner]2032-the victrola which stood in one corner and put on a record of " The Grizzly Bear , "[142-hegglund] which [he]142-hegglund found lying there .

At the first sounds of this strain , which [they]2018-they all knew , [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel called : " Oh , let 's all dance to that , will [you]162-higby ? Ca n't [you]162-higby stop that other old thing ? "[213-tina kogel] [she]213-tina kogel added .

" Sure , after it runs down , "[158-ratterer] explained [Ratterer]158-ratterer , laughingly . " The only way to stop that thing is not to feed it any nickels . "[158-ratterer]

But now [a waiter]2583-a waiter coming in , [Higby]162-higby began to inquire what [everybody]858-everybody wanted . And in the meantime , to show off [her]213-tina kogel charms , [Hortense]174-hortense had taken the center of the floor and was attempting to imitate a grizzly bear walking on its hind legs , which [she]213-tina kogel could do amusingly enough — quite gracefully . And [Sparser]210-sparser , seeing [her]213-tina kogel alone in the center of the floor was anxious to interest [her]213-tina kogel now , followed [her]213-tina kogel and tried to imitate [her]213-tina kogel motions from behind . Finding [him]210-sparser clever at it , and anxious to dance , [she]213-tina kogel finally abandoned the imitation and giving [him]210-sparser [her]213-tina kogel arms went one - stepping about [the room]577-the room most vividly . At once , [Clyde]149-clyde , who was by no means as good [a dancer]2036-a dancer , became jealous — painfully so . In [his]149-clyde eagerness for [her]213-tina kogel , it seemed unfair to [him]149-clyde that [he]149-clyde should be deserted by [her]213-tina kogel so early — at the very beginning of things . But [she]213-tina kogel , becoming interested in [Sparser]210-sparser , who seemed more worldly - wise , paid no attention at all to [Clyde]149-clyde for the time being , but went dancing with [her]213-tina kogel new conquest , [his]149-clyde rhythmic skill seeming charmingly to match [her]213-tina kogel own . And then , not to be out of it , [the others]264-the others at once chose [partners]2038-partners , [Hegglund]142-hegglund dancing with [Maida]211-maida axelrod , [Ratterer]158-ratterer with [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas and [Higby]162-higby with [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel . This left [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe for [Clyde]149-clyde , who did not like [her]214-laura sipe very much . [She]214-laura sipe was not as perfect as [she]214-laura sipe might be — [a plump , pudgy - faced girl with inadequate sensual blue eyes]2039-a plump , pudgy - faced girl with inadequate sensual blue eyes — and [Clyde]149-clyde , lacking any exceptional skill , [they]2040-they danced nothing but the conventional one - step while [the others]264-the others were dipping and lurching and spinning .

In a kind of sick fury , [Clyde]149-clyde noticed that [Sparser]210-sparser , who was still with [Hortense]174-hortense , was by now holding [her]214-laura sipe close and looking straight into [her]214-laura sipe eyes . And [she]214-laura sipe was permitting [him]149-clyde . It gave [him]149-clyde a feeling of lead at the pit of [his]149-clyde stomach . Was it possible [she]214-laura sipe was beginning to like [this young upstart who had [this car]2692-this car]2042-this young upstart who had this car ? And [she]214-laura sipe had promised to like [him]149-clyde for the present . It brought to [him]149-clyde a sense of [her]214-laura sipe fickleness — the probability of [her]214-laura sipe real indifference to [him]149-clyde . [He]149-clyde wanted to do something — stop dancing and get [her]214-laura sipe away from [Sparser]210-sparser , but there was no use until this particular record ran out .

And then , just at the end of this , [the waiter]1291-the waiter returned with a tray and put down cocktails , ginger ale and sandwiches upon three small tables which had been joined together . All but [Sparser]210-sparser and [Hortense]174-hortense quit and came toward it — a fact which [Clyde]149-clyde was quick to note . [She]214-laura sipe was [a heartless flirt]2045-a heartless flirt ! [She]214-laura sipe really did not care for [him]149-clyde after all . And after making [him]149-clyde think that [she]214-laura sipe did , so recently — and getting [him]149-clyde to help [her]214-laura sipe with that coat . [She]214-laura sipe could go to the devil now . [He]149-clyde would show [her]214-laura sipe . And [he]149-clyde waiting for [her]214-laura sipe ! Was n't that the limit ? Yet , finally seeing that [the others]264-the others were gathering about the tables , which had been placed near the fire , [Hortense]174-hortense and [Sparser]210-sparser ceased dancing and approached . [Clyde]149-clyde was white and glum . [He]149-clyde stood to one side , seemingly indifferent . And [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , who had already noted [his]149-clyde rage and understood the reason now moved away from [him]149-clyde to join [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel , to whom [she]214-laura sipe explained why [he]149-clyde was so angry .

And then noting [his]149-clyde glumness , [Hortense]174-hortense came over , executing a phase of the " Grizzly "[174-hortense] as [she]174-hortense did so .

" [Gee]153-gee , was n't that swell ? "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense began . " Gee , how [I]174-hortense do love to dance to music like that ! "[174-hortense]

" Sure , it 's swell for [you]174-hortense , "[149-clyde] returned [Clyde]149-clyde , burning with envy and disappointment .

" Why , what 's the trouble ? "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense asked , in a low and almost injured tone , pretending not to guess , yet knowing quite well why [he]149-clyde was angry . " [You]149-clyde do n't mean to say that [you]149-clyde 're mad because [I]174-hortense danced with [him]149-clyde first , do [you]149-clyde ? Oh , how silly ! Why did n't [you]149-clyde come over then and dance with [me]174-hortense ? [I]174-hortense could n't refuse to dance with [him]149-clyde when [he]149-clyde was right there , could [I]174-hortense ? "[174-hortense]

" Oh , no , of course , [you]174-hortense could n't , "[149-clyde] replied [Clyde]149-clyde sarcastically , and in a low , tense tone , for [he]149-clyde , no more than [Hortense]174-hortense , wanted [the others]264-the others to hear . " But [you]174-hortense did n't have to fall all over [him]149-clyde and dream in [his]149-clyde eyes , either , did [you]174-hortense ? "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde was fairly blazing . " [You]174-hortense need n't say [you]174-hortense did n't , because [I]149-clyde saw [you]174-hortense . "[149-clyde]

At this [she]174-hortense glanced at [him]149-clyde oddly , realizing not only the sharpness of [his]149-clyde mood , but that this was the first time [he]149-clyde had shown so much daring in connection with [her]174-hortense . It must be that [he]149-clyde was getting to feel too sure of [her]174-hortense . [She]174-hortense was showing [him]149-clyde too much attention . At the same time [she]174-hortense realized that this was not the time to show [him]149-clyde that [she]174-hortense did not care for [him]149-clyde as much as [she]174-hortense would like to have [him]149-clyde believe , since [she]174-hortense wanted the coat , already agreed upon .

" Oh , gee , well , ai n't that the limit ? "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense replied angrily , yet more because [she]174-hortense was irritated by the fact that what [he]149-clyde said was true than anything else . " If [you]149-clyde are n't [the grouch]2698-the grouch . Well , [I]174-hortense ca n't help it , if [you]149-clyde 're going to be as jealous as that . [I]174-hortense did n't do anything but dance with [him]149-clyde just a little . [I]174-hortense did n't think [you]149-clyde 'd be mad . "[174-hortense] [She]174-hortense moved as if to turn away , but realizing that there was an understanding between [them]2048-them , and that [he]149-clyde must be placated if things were to go on , [she]174-hortense drew [him]149-clyde by [his]149-clyde coat lapels out of the range of the hearing of [the others , who were already looking and listening]2049-the others , who were already looking and listening , and began .

" Now , see here , [you]149-clyde . Do n't go acting like this . [I]174-hortense did n't mean anything by what [I]174-hortense did . Honest , [I]174-hortense did n't . Anyhow , [everybody]858-everybody dances like that now . And [nobody]2378-nobody means anything by it . Are n't [you]149-clyde goin' to let [me]174-hortense be nice to [you]149-clyde like [I]174-hortense said , or are [you]149-clyde ? "[174-hortense]

And now [she]174-hortense looked [him]149-clyde coaxingly and winsomely and calculatingly straight in the eye , as though [he]149-clyde were [the one person among all these present whom [she]174-hortense really did like]2050-the one person among all these present whom she really did like . And deliberately , and of a purpose , [she]174-hortense made a pursy , sensuous mouth — the kind [she]174-hortense could make — and practised a play of the lips that caused [them]2051-them to seem to want to kiss [him]149-clyde — a mouth that tempted [him]149-clyde to distraction .

" All right , "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde said , looking at [her]174-hortense weakly and yieldingly . " [I]149-clyde suppose [I]149-clyde am [a fool]1536-a fool , but [I]149-clyde saw what [you]174-hortense did , all right . [You]174-hortense know [I]149-clyde 'm crazy about [you]174-hortense , [Hortense]174-hortense — just wild ! [I]149-clyde ca n't help it . [I]149-clyde wish [I]149-clyde could sometimes . [I]149-clyde wish [I]149-clyde would n't be such [a fool]1536-a fool . "[149-clyde] And [he]149-clyde looked at [her]174-hortense and was sad . And [she]174-hortense , realizing [her]174-hortense power over [him]149-clyde and how easy it was to bring [him]149-clyde around , replied : " Oh , [you]149-clyde — [you]149-clyde do n't , either . [I]174-hortense 'll kiss [you]149-clyde after a while , when [the others]264-the others are n't looking if [you]149-clyde 'll be good . "[174-hortense] At the same time [she]174-hortense was conscious of the fact that [Sparser]210-sparser 's eyes were upon [her]174-hortense . Also that [he]149-clyde was intensely drawn to [her]174-hortense and that [she]174-hortense liked [him]149-clyde more than [any one [she]174-hortense had recently encountered]2052-any one she had recently encountered .

The climax of the afternoon was reached , however , when after several more dances and drinks , [the small river]2053-the small river and [its]2053-the small river possibilities was again brought to the attention of all by [Hegglund]142-hegglund , who , looking out of one of the windows , suddenly exclaimed : " What 's de matter wit de ice down dere ? Look at de swell ice . [I]142-hegglund dare [dis crowd]2704-dis crowd to go down dere and slide . "[142-hegglund]

[They]2054-they were off pell - mell — [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel , running hand in hand , [Sparser]210-sparser and [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas , with whom [he]149-clyde had just been dancing , [Higby]162-higby and [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , whom [he]149-clyde was finding interesting enough for a change , and [Clyde]149-clyde and [Hortense]174-hortense . But once on [the ice]2055-the ice , which was nothing more than [a narrow , winding stream]2056-a narrow , winding stream , blown clean in places by the wind , and curving among thickets of leafless trees , [the company]2057-the company were more like [young satyrs and [nymphs of an older day]2059-nymphs of an older day]2058-young satyrs and nymphs of an older day . [They]2054-they ran here and there , slipping and sliding — [Higby]162-higby , [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas and [Maida]211-maida axelrod immediately falling down , but scrambling to [their]2054-they feet with bursts of laughter .

And [Hortense]174-hortense , aided by [Clyde]149-clyde at first , minced here and there . But soon [she]174-hortense began to run and slide , squealing in pretended fear . And now , not only [Sparser]210-sparser but [Higby]162-higby , and this in spite of [Clyde]149-clyde , began to show [Hortense]174-hortense attention . [They]2054-they joined [her]174-hortense in sliding , ran after [her]174-hortense and pretended to try to trip [her]174-hortense up , but caught [her]174-hortense as [she]174-hortense fell . And [Sparser]210-sparser , taking [her]174-hortense by the hand , dragged [her]174-hortense , seemingly in spite of [herself]174-hortense and [the others]264-the others , far upstream and about a curve where [they]2054-they could not be seen . Determined not to show further watchfulness or jealousy [Clyde]149-clyde remained behind . But [he]149-clyde could not help feeling that [Sparser]210-sparser might be taking this occasion to make a date , even to kiss [her]174-hortense . [She]174-hortense was not incapable of letting [him]149-clyde , even though [she]174-hortense might pretend to [him]149-clyde that [she]174-hortense did not want [him]149-clyde to . It was agonizing .

In spite of [himself]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde began to tingle with helpless pain — to begin to wish that [he]149-clyde could see [them]2054-they . But [Hegglund]142-hegglund , having called [every one to join hands and crack the whip]2061-every one to join hands and crack the whip , [he]142-hegglund took the hand of [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas , who was holding on to [Hegglund]142-hegglund 's , and gave [his]142-hegglund other free hand to [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod , who in turn gave [her]211-maida axelrod free hand to [Ratterer]158-ratterer . And [Higby]162-higby and [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe were about to make up the tail when [Sparser]210-sparser and [Hortense]174-hortense came gliding back — [he]210-sparser holding [her]174-hortense by the hand . And [they]2054-they now tacked on at the foot . Then [Hegglund]142-hegglund and [the others]264-the others began running and doubling back and forth until all beyond [Maida]211-maida axelrod had fallen and let go . And , as [Clyde]149-clyde noted , [Hortense]174-hortense and [Sparser]210-sparser , in falling , skidded and rolled against [each other]605-each other to the edge of [the shore where were snow]2064-the shore where were snow and leaves and twigs . And [Hortense]174-hortense 's skirts , becoming awry in some way , moved up to above [her]174-hortense knees . But instead of showing any embarrassment , as [Clyde]149-clyde thought and wished [she]174-hortense might , [she]174-hortense sat there for a few moments without shame and even laughing heartily — and [Sparser]210-sparser with [her]174-hortense and still holding [her]174-hortense hand . And [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , having fallen in such a way as to trip [Higby]162-higby , who had fallen across [her]214-laura sipe , [they]2054-they also lay there laughing and yet in a most suggestive position , as [Clyde]149-clyde thought . [He]149-clyde noted , too , that [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe 's skirts had been worked above [her]214-laura sipe knees . And [Sparser]210-sparser , now sitting up , was pointing to [her]214-laura sipe pretty legs and laughing loudly , showing most of [his]210-sparser teeth . And [all the others]1301-all the others were emitting peals and squeals of laughter .

" Hang it all ! "[149-clyde] thought [Clyde]149-clyde . " Why [the deuce]2705-the deuce does [he]210-sparser always have to be hanging about [her]214-laura sipe ? Why did n't [he]210-sparser bring [a girl of [his]210-sparser own]1461-a girl of his own if [he]210-sparser wanted to have a good time ? What right have [they]2054-they got to go where [they]2054-they ca n't be seen ? And [she]214-laura sipe thinks [I]149-clyde think [she]214-laura sipe means nothing by all this . [She]214-laura sipe never laughs that heartily with [me]149-clyde , [you]2707-you bet . What does [she]214-laura sipe think [I]149-clyde am that [she]214-laura sipe can put that stuff over on [me]149-clyde , anyhow ? "[149-clyde] [He]149-clyde glowered darkly for the moment , but in spite of [his]149-clyde thoughts the line or whip was soon re - formed and this time with [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas still holding [his]149-clyde hand . Sparser and [Hortense]174-hortense at the tail end again . But [Hegglund]142-hegglund , unconscious of the mood of [Clyde]149-clyde and thinking only of the sport , called : " Better let [some one else]2429-some one else take de end dere , hadn'tcha ? "[142-hegglund] And feeling the fairness of this , [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod and [Clyde]149-clyde and [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas now moved down with [Higby]162-higby and [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe and [Hortense]174-hortense and [Sparser]210-sparser above [them]2066-them . Only , as [Clyde]149-clyde noted , [Hortense]174-hortense still held [Sparser]210-sparser by the hand , yet [she]174-hortense moved just above [him]149-clyde and took [his]149-clyde hand , [he]149-clyde being to the right , with [Sparser]210-sparser next above to [her]174-hortense left , holding [her]174-hortense other hand firmly , which infuriated [Clyde]149-clyde . Why could n't [he]149-clyde stick to [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , [the girl brought out here for [him]149-clyde]2067-the girl brought out here for him ? And [Hortense]174-hortense was encouraging [him]149-clyde .

[He]149-clyde was very sad , and [he]149-clyde felt so angry and bitter that [he]149-clyde could scarcely play the game . [He]149-clyde wanted to stop and quarrel with [Sparser]210-sparser . But so brisk and eager was [Hegglund]142-hegglund that [they]2068-they were off before [he]142-hegglund could even think of doing so .

And then , try as [he]142-hegglund would , to keep [his]142-hegglund balance in the face of this , [he]142-hegglund and [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas and [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod were thrown down and spun around on the ice like curling irons . And [Hortense]174-hortense , letting go of [him]149-clyde at the right moment , seemed to prefer deliberately to hang on to [Sparser]210-sparser . Entangled with [these others]1140-these others , [Clyde]149-clyde and [they]2068-they spun across forty feet of smooth , green ice and piled against a snow bank . At the finish , as [he]149-clyde found , [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas was lying across [his]149-clyde knees face down in such a spanking position that [he]149-clyde was compelled to laugh . And [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod was on [her]211-maida axelrod back , next to [Ratterer]158-ratterer , [her]211-maida axelrod legs straight up in the air ; on purpose [he]149-clyde thought . [She]211-maida axelrod was too coarse and bold for [him]149-clyde . And there followed , of course , squeals and guffaws of delight — so loud that they could be heard for half a mile . [Hegglund]142-hegglund , intensely susceptible to humor at all times , doubled to the knees , slapped [his]142-hegglund thighs and bawled . And [Sparser]210-sparser opened [his]210-sparser big mouth and chortled and grimaced until [he]210-sparser was scarlet . So infectious was the result that for the time being [Clyde]149-clyde forgot [his]149-clyde jealousy . [He]149-clyde too looked and laughed . But [Clyde]149-clyde 's mood had not changed really . [He]149-clyde still felt that [she]211-maida axelrod was n't playing fair .

At the end of all this playing [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas and [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel being tired , dropped out . And [Hortense]174-hortense , also . [Clyde]149-clyde at once left [the group]262-the group to join [her]211-maida axelrod . [Ratterer]158-ratterer then followed [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas . Then [the others]264-the others separating , [Hegglund]142-hegglund pushed [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod before [him]142-hegglund down stream out of sight around a bend . [Higby]162-higby , seemingly taking [his]162-higby cue from this , pulled [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel up stream , and [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas , seeming to see something of interest , struck into a thicket , laughing and talking as [they]2072-they went . Even [Sparser]210-sparser and [Laura]214-laura sipe , left to [themselves]210-sparser , now wandered off , leaving [Clyde]149-clyde and [Hortense]174-hortense alone .

And then , as [these two]1478-these two wandered toward a fallen log which here paralleled [the stream]2027-the stream , [she]211-maida axelrod sat down . But [Clyde]149-clyde , smarting from [his]149-clyde fancied wounds , stood silent for the time being , while [she]211-maida axelrod , sensing as much , took [him]149-clyde by the belt of [his]149-clyde coat and began to pull at [him]149-clyde .
