" Gee , but [you]2083-you 're mean , "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense persisted , affecting an injured air . " It 's the [God]122-god 's truth . Believe [me]174-hortense or not , [I]174-hortense swear it . Honest it is . "[174-hortense]

[Clyde]149-clyde stood there . In the face of this small trick there was really nothing much to say as [he]149-clyde saw it . [He]149-clyde could not force [her]174-hortense to do anything . If [she]174-hortense wanted to lie and pretend , [he]149-clyde would have to pretend to believe [her]174-hortense . And yet a great sadness settled down upon [him]149-clyde . [He]149-clyde was not to win [her]174-hortense after all — that was plain . [He]2083-you turned , and [she]174-hortense , being convinced that [he]2083-you felt that [she]174-hortense was lying now , felt it incumbent upon [herself]174-hortense to do something about it — to win [him]2083-you around to [her]174-hortense again .

" Please , [Clyde]149-clyde , please , "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense began now , most artfully , " [I]174-hortense mean that . Really , [I]174-hortense do . Wo n't [you]149-clyde believe [me]174-hortense ? But [I]174-hortense will next week , sure . Honest , [I]174-hortense will . Wo n't [you]149-clyde believe that ? [I]174-hortense meant everything [I]174-hortense said when [I]174-hortense said it . Honest , [I]174-hortense did . [I]174-hortense do like [you]149-clyde — a lot . Wo n't [you]149-clyde believe that , too — please ? "[174-hortense]

And [Clyde]149-clyde , thrilled from head to toe by this latest phase of [her]174-hortense artistry , agreed that [he]149-clyde would . And once more [he]149-clyde began to smile and recover [his]149-clyde gayety . And by the time [they]2088-they reached [the car]974-the car , to which [they]2088-they were all called a few minutes after by [Hegglund]142-hegglund , because of the time , and [he]149-clyde had held [her]174-hortense hand and kissed [her]174-hortense often , [he]149-clyde was quite convinced that the dream [he]149-clyde had been dreaming was as certain of fulfillment as anything could be . Oh , the glory of it when it should come true !

For the major portion of the return trip to [Kansas City]5-kansas city , there was nothing to mar the very agreeable illusion under which [Clyde]149-clyde rested . [He]149-clyde sat beside [Hortense]174-hortense , who leaned [her]174-hortense head against [his]149-clyde shoulder . And although [Sparser]210-sparser , who had waited for [the others]264-the others to step in before taking the wheel , had squeezed [her]174-hortense arm and received an answering and promising look , [Clyde]149-clyde had not seen that .

But the hour being late and the admonitions of [Hegglund]142-hegglund , [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Higby]162-higby being all for speed , and the mood of [Sparser]210-sparser , because of the looks bestowed upon [him]149-clyde by [Hortense]174-hortense , being the gayest and most drunken , it was not long before the outlying lamps of [the environs]2091-the environs began to show .

For [the car]974-the car was rushed along [the road]1963-the road at break - neck speed . At one point , however , where one of [the eastern trunk lines]2094-the eastern trunk lines approached [the city]662-the city , there was a long and unexpected and disturbing wait at [a grade crossing where [two freight trains]2097-two freight trains met and passed]2096-a grade crossing where two freight trains met and passed . Farther in , at [North Kansas City]85-north kansas city , it began to snow , great soft slushy flakes , feathering down and coating [the road]1963-the road surface with a slippery layer of mud which required more caution than had been thus far displayed . It was then half past five . Ordinarily , an additional eight minutes at high speed would have served to bring [the car]974-the car within a block or two of [the hotel]769-the hotel . But now , with another delay near [Hannibal Bridge]97-the hannibal bridge owing to [grade crossing]2101-grade crossing , it was twenty minutes to six before [the bridge]2102-the bridge was crossed and [Wyandotte Street]106-wyandotte street reached . And already [all four of [these youths]1155-these youths]2103-all four of these youths had lost all sense of the delight of the trip and the pleasure the companionship of [these girls]696-these girls had given [them]2103-all four of these youths . For already [they]2103-all four of these youths were worrying as to the probability of [their]2103-all four of these youths reaching [the hotel]769-the hotel in time . The smug and martinetish figure of [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires loomed before [them]2103-all four of these youths all .

" [Gee]153-gee , if [we]2103-all four of these youths do n't do better than this , "[158-ratterer] observed [Ratterer]158-ratterer to [Higby]162-higby , who was nervously fumbling with [his]162-higby watch , " [we]2103-all four of these youths 're not goin' to make it . [We]2103-all four of these youths 'll hardly have time , as it is , to change . "[158-ratterer]

[Clyde]149-clyde , hearing [him]158-ratterer , exclaimed : " Oh , crickets ! [I]149-clyde wish [we]2103-all four of these youths could hurry a little . [Gee]153-gee , [I]149-clyde wish now [we]2103-all four of these youths had n't come to - day . It 'll be tough if [we]2103-all four of these youths do n't get there on time . "[149-clyde]

And [Hortense]174-hortense , noting [his]158-ratterer sudden tenseness and unrest , added : " Do n't [you]158-ratterer think [you]158-ratterer 'll make it all right ? "[174-hortense]

" Not this way , "[158-ratterer] [he]158-ratterer said . But [Hegglund]142-hegglund , who had been studying the flaked air outside , a world that seemed dotted with falling bits of cotton , called : " Eh , dere [Willard]210-sparser . [We]2103-all four of these youths certainly got ta do better dan dis . It means de razoo for [us]2103-all four of these youths if [we]2103-all four of these youths do n't get dere on time . "[142-hegglund]

And [Higby]162-higby , for once stirred out of [a gambler - like effrontery and calm]2107-a gambler - like effrontery and calm , added : " [We]2103-all four of these youths 'll walk the plank all right unless [we]2103-all four of these youths can put up some good yarn . Ca n't [anybody]860-anybody think of anything ? "[162-higby] As for [Clyde]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde merely sighed nervously .

And then , as though to torture [them]2108-them the more , an unexpected crush of [vehicles]233-vehicles appeared at nearly [every intersection]2110-every intersection . And [Sparser]210-sparser , who was irritated by this particular predicament , was contemplating with impatience the warning hand of [a traffic policeman]2111-a traffic policeman , which , at [the intersection of [Ninth]107-ninth and [Wyandotte]53-wyandotte]2112-the intersection of ninth and wyandotte , had been raised against [him]210-sparser . " There goes [his]210-sparser mit again , "[210-sparser] [he]210-sparser exclaimed . " What can [I]210-sparser do about that ! [I]210-sparser might turn over to [Washington]83-washington , but [I]210-sparser do n't know whether [we]2732-we 'll save any time by going over there . "[210-sparser]

A full minute passed before [he]210-sparser was signaled to go forward . Then swiftly [he]210-sparser swung [the car]974-the car to the right and three blocks over into [Washington Street]108-washington street .

But here the conditions were no better . [Two heavy lines of traffic]2114-two heavy lines of traffic moved in opposite directions . And at each succeeding corner several precious moments were lost as the cross - traffic went by . Then [the car]974-the car would tear on to the next corner , weaving its way in and out as best it could .

At [Fifteenth]68-fifteenth and [Washington]83-washington , [Clyde]149-clyde exclaimed to [Ratterer]158-ratterer : " How would it do if [we]2732-we got out at [Seventeenth]80-seventeenth and walked over ? "[149-clyde]

" [You]158-ratterer wo n't save any time if [I]210-sparser can turn over there , "[210-sparser] called [Sparser]210-sparser . " [I]210-sparser can get over there quicker than [you]158-ratterer can . "[210-sparser]

[He]210-sparser crowded [the other cars]2116-the other cars for every inch of [available space]2117-available space . At [Sixteenth]110-sixteenth and [Washington]83-washington , seeing what [he]210-sparser considered a fairly clear block to the left , [he]210-sparser turned [the car]974-the car and tore along [that thoroughfare]2119-that thoroughfare to as far as [Wyandotte]53-wyandotte once more . Just as [he]210-sparser neared the corner and was about to turn at high speed , swinging in close to the curb to do so , [a little girl of about nine]2120-a little girl of about nine , who was running toward the crossing , jumped directly in front of the moving machine . And because there was no opportunity given [him]210-sparser to turn and avoid [her]2120-a little girl of about nine , [she]2120-a little girl of about nine was struck and dragged a number of feet before the machine could be halted . At the same time , there arose piercing screams from at least [half a dozen women]2121-half a dozen women , and shouts from as many [men who had witnessed the accident]2122-men who had witnessed the accident .

Instantly [they]2122-men who had witnessed the accident all rushed toward [the child , who had been thrown under and passed over by the wheels]2123-the child , who had been thrown under and passed over by the wheels . And Sparser , looking out and seeing [them]2122-men who had witnessed the accident gathering about [the fallen figure]2124-the fallen figure , was seized with an uninterpretable mental panic which conjured up [the police]583-the police , [jail]2126-jail , [[his]210-sparser father]276-his father , [the owner of [the car]974-the car]2128-the owner of the car , severe punishment in many forms . And though by now [all the others in [the car]974-the car]2130-all the others in the car were up and giving vent to anguished exclamations such as " Oh , [God]122-god ! [He]210-sparser hit [a little girl]2733-a little girl "[210-sparser] ; " Oh , gee , [he]210-sparser 's killed [a kid]2581-a kid ! "[210-sparser] " Oh , mercy ! "[210-sparser] " Oh , [Lord]2735-lord ! "[210-sparser] " Oh , heavens , what 'll [we]2736-we do now ? "[210-sparser] [he]210-sparser turned and exclaimed : " [Jesus]121-jesus , [the cops]2737-the cops ! [I]210-sparser got ta get outa this with [this car]2692-this car . "[210-sparser]

And , without consulting [the others , who were still half standing , but almost speechless with fear]2132-the others , who were still half standing , but almost speechless with fear , [he]210-sparser shot the lever into first , second and then high , and giving the engine all the gas it would endure , sped with [it]2133-it to [the next corner beyond]2134-the next corner beyond .

But there , as at the other corners in [this vicinity]2135-this vicinity , [a policeman]2136-a policeman was stationed , and having already seen some commotion at [the corner west of [him]2136-a policeman]2137-the corner west of him , had already started to leave [his]2136-a policeman post in order to ascertain what it was . As [he]2136-a policeman did so , cries of " Stop [that car]2739-that car "[1240-a man] — " Stop that car"—reached[1240-a man] [his]210-sparser ears . And [a man]1240-a man , running toward [the sedan]2139-the sedan from the scene of the accident , pointed to it , and called : " Stop [that car]2739-that car , stop [that car]2739-that car . [They]2742-they 've killed [a child]1716-a child . "[1240-a man]

Then gathering what was meant , [he]1240-a man turned toward [the car]974-the car , putting [his]1240-a man police whistle to [his]1240-a man mouth as [he]1240-a man did so . But [Sparser]210-sparser , having by this time heard the cries and seen [the policeman]2141-the policeman leaving , dashed swiftly past [him]1240-a man into [Seventeenth Street]111-seventeenth street , along which [he]1240-a man sped at almost forty miles an hour , grazing the hub of [a truck]2142-a truck in one instance , scraping the fender of [an automobile]2143-an automobile in another , and missing by inches and quarter inches vehicles or [pedestrians]236-pedestrians , while [those behind [him]1240-a man in [the car]974-the car]2145-those behind him in the car were for the most part sitting bolt upright and tense , [their]2145-those behind him in the car eyes wide , [their]2145-those behind him in the car hands clenched , [their]2145-those behind him in the car faces and lips set — or , as in the case of [Hortense]174-hortense and [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas and [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel , giving voice to repeated , " Oh , Gods ! "[213-tina kogel] " Oh , what 's going to happen now ? "[213-tina kogel]

But [the police]583-the police and [those who had started to pursue]2148-those who had started to pursue were not to be outdone so quickly . Unable to make out the license plate number and seeing from the first motions of [the car]974-the car that it had no intention of stopping , [the officer]2150-the officer blew a loud and long blast on [his]2150-the officer police whistle . And [the policeman at the next corner]2151-the policeman at the next corner seeing [the car]974-the car speed by and realizing what it meant , blew on [his]2151-the policeman at the next corner whistle , then stopped , and springing on the running board of [a passing touring car]2153-a passing touring car ordered it to give chase . And at this , seeing what was amiss or awind , [three other cars , driven by adventurous spirits]2154-three other cars , driven by adventurous spirits , joined in the chase , all honking loudly as [they]2154-three other cars , driven by adventurous spirits came .

But [the Packard]72-a packard had far more speed in it than [any of [its]72-a packard pursuers]2155-any of its pursuers , and although for the first few blocks of the pursuit there were cries of " Stop [that car]2739-that car ! "[2154-three other cars , driven by adventurous spirits] " Stop [that car]2739-that car ! "[2154-three other cars , driven by adventurous spirits] still , owing to the much greater speed of [the car]974-the car , these soon died away , giving place to the long wild shrieks of distant horns in full cry .

Sparser by now having won a fair lead and realizing that a straight course was the least baffling to pursue , turned swiftly into [McGee]113-mcgee , [a comparatively quiet thoroughfare along which [he]2150-the officer tore for a few blocks]2157-a comparatively quiet thoroughfare along which he tore for a few blocks to [the wide and winding [Gillham Parkway]114-gillham parkway]2158-the wide and winding gillham parkway , whose course was southward . But having followed that at terrific speed for a short distance , [he]2150-the officer again — at [Thirty - first]115-thirty - first — decided to turn — the houses in the distance confusing [him]2150-the officer and [the suburban country to the north]2159-the suburban country to the north seeming to offer the best opportunity for evading [[his]2150-the officer pursuers]2160-his pursuers . And so now [he]2150-the officer swung [the car]974-the car to the left into [that thoroughfare]2119-that thoroughfare , [his]2150-the officer thought here being that amid [these comparatively quiet streets]2163-these comparatively quiet streets it was possible to wind in and out and so shake off pursuit — at least long enough to drop [[his]2150-the officer passengers]2164-his passengers somewhere and return [the car]974-the car to [the garage]2166-the garage .

And this [he]2150-the officer would have been able to do had it not been for the fact that in turning into [one of [the more outlying streets of [this region]2169-this region , where there were scarcely any [houses]2170-houses and [no pedestrians]2171-no pedestrians visible]2168-the more outlying streets of this region , where there were scarcely any houses and no pedestrians visible]2167-one of the more outlying streets of this region , where there were scarcely any houses and no pedestrians visible , [he]2150-the officer decided to turn off [his]2150-the officer lights , the better to conceal the whereabouts of [the car]974-the car . Then , still speeding east , north , and east and south by turns , [he]2150-the officer finally dashed into [one street]2173-one street where , after a few hundred feet , [the pavement]2174-the pavement suddenly ended . But because [another cross street]2175-another cross street was visible a hundred feet or so further on , and [he]2150-the officer imagined that by turning into that [he]2150-the officer might find [a paved thoroughfare]2176-a paved thoroughfare again , [he]2150-the officer sped on and then swung sharply to the left , only to crash roughly into a pile of paving stones left by [a contractor who was preparing to pave the way]2177-a contractor who was preparing to pave the way . In the absence of lights [he]2150-the officer had failed to distinguish this . And diagonally opposite to these , lengthwise of [a prospective sidewalk]2178-a prospective sidewalk , had been laid a pile of lumber for [a house]2608-a house .

Striking the edge of the paving stones at high speed , [he]2150-the officer caromed , and all but upsetting [the car]974-the car , made directly for the lumber pile opposite , into which [he]2150-the officer crashed . Only instead of striking it head on , [the car]974-the car struck one end , causing it to give way and spread out , but only sufficiently to permit the right wheels to mount high upon it and so throw [the car]974-the car completely over onto its left side in the grass and snow beyond the walk . Then there , amid a crash of glass and the impacts of [their]2183-their own bodies , [the occupants]2184-the occupants were thrown down in a heap , forward and to the left .

What happened afterwards is more or less of a mystery and a matter of confusion , not only to [Clyde]149-clyde , but to [all the others]1301-all the others . For [Sparser]210-sparser and [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , being in front , were dashed against the wind - shield and the roof and knocked senseless , Sparser , having [his]210-sparser shoulder , hip and left knee wrenched in such a way as to make it necessary to let [him]210-sparser lie in [the car]974-the car as [he]210-sparser was until [an ambulance]2187-an ambulance arrived . [He]210-sparser could not possibly be lifted out through the door , which was in the roof as [the car]974-the car now lay . And in the second seat , [Clyde]149-clyde , being nearest the door to the left and next to [him]149-clyde [Hortense]174-hortense , [Lucille Nickolas]212-lucille nickolas and [Ratterer]158-ratterer , was pinioned under and yet not crushed by [their]2183-their combined weights . For [Hortense]174-hortense in falling had been thrown completely over [him]149-clyde on [her]174-hortense side against the roof , which was now the left wall . And [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas , next above [her]174-hortense , fell in such a way as to lie across [Clyde]149-clyde 's shoulders only , while [Ratterer]158-ratterer , now topmost of the four , had , in falling , been thrown over the seat in front of [him]149-clyde . But grasping the steering wheel in front of [him]149-clyde as [he]149-clyde fell , the same having been wrenched from [Sparser]210-sparser 's hands , [he]149-clyde had broken [his]149-clyde fall in part by clinging to it . But even so , [his]149-clyde face and hands were cut and bruised and [his]149-clyde shoulder , arm and hip slightly wrenched , yet not sufficiently to prevent [his]149-clyde being of assistance to [the others]264-the others . For at once , realizing the plight of [the others]264-the others as well as [his]149-clyde own , and stirred by [their]264-the others screams , [Ratterer]158-ratterer was moved to draw [himself]158-ratterer up and out through the top or side door which [he]158-ratterer now succeeded in opening , scrambling over [the others]264-the others to reach it .

Once out , [he]158-ratterer climbed upon the chassis beam of [the toppled car]2192-the toppled car , and , reaching down , caught hold of the struggling and moaning [Lucille]212-lucille nickolas , who like [the others]264-the others was trying to climb up but could not . And exerting all [his]158-ratterer strength and exclaiming , " Be still , now , [honey]2746-honey , [I]158-ratterer gotcha . [You]2746-honey 're all right , [I]158-ratterer 'll getcha out , "[158-ratterer] [he]158-ratterer lifted [her]212-lucille nickolas to a sitting position on the side of the door , then down in the snow , where [he]158-ratterer placed [her]212-lucille nickolas and where [she]212-lucille nickolas sat crying and feeling [her]212-lucille nickolas arms and [her]212-lucille nickolas head . And after [her]212-lucille nickolas [he]158-ratterer helped [Hortense]174-hortense , [her]174-hortense left cheek and forehead and both hands badly bruised and bleeding , but not seriously , although [she]174-hortense did not know that at the time . [She]174-hortense was whimpering and shivering and shaking — a nervous chill having succeeded the dazed and almost unconscious state which had followed the first crash .

At that moment , [Clyde]149-clyde , lifting [his]149-clyde bewildered head above the side door of [the car]974-the car , [his]149-clyde left cheek , shoulder and arm bruised , but not otherwise injured , was thinking that [he]149-clyde too must get out of this as quickly as possible . [A child]1716-a child had been killed ; [a car]1137-a car stolen and wrecked ; [his]149-clyde job was most certainly lost ; [the police]583-the police were in pursuit and might even find [them]583-the police there at any minute . And below [him]149-clyde in [the car]974-the car was [Sparser]210-sparser , prone where [he]210-sparser fell , but already being looked to by [Ratterer]158-ratterer . And beside [him]149-clyde [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , also unconscious . [He]149-clyde felt called upon to do something — to assist [Ratterer]158-ratterer , who was reaching down and trying to lay hold of [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe without injuring [her]214-laura sipe . But so confused were [his]149-clyde thoughts that [he]149-clyde would have stood there without helping [any one]511-any one had it not been for [Ratterer]158-ratterer , who called most irritably , " Give [us]2747-us a hand here , [Clyde]149-clyde , will [you]149-clyde ? Let 's see if [we]2747-us can get [her]214-laura sipe out . [She]214-laura sipe 's fainted . "[158-ratterer] And [Clyde]149-clyde , turning now instead of trying to climb out , began to seek to lift [her]214-laura sipe from within , standing on the broken glass window of the side beneath [his]149-clyde feet and attempting to draw [her]214-laura sipe body back and up off the body of [Sparser]210-sparser . But this was not possible . [She]214-laura sipe was too limp — too heavy . [He]149-clyde could only draw [her]214-laura sipe back — off the body of [Sparser]210-sparser — and then let [her]214-laura sipe rest there , between the second and first seats on [the car]974-the car 's side .

But , meanwhile , at the back [Hegglund]142-hegglund , being nearest the top and only slightly stunned , had managed to reach the door nearest [him]142-hegglund and throw it back . Thus , by reason of [his]142-hegglund athletic body , [he]142-hegglund was able to draw [himself]142-hegglund up and out , saying as [he]142-hegglund did so : " Oh , [Jesus]121-jesus , what a finish ! Oh , [Christ]123-christ , dis is de limit ! Oh , [Jesus]121-jesus , [we]2748-we better beat it outa dis before [de cops]2749-de cops git here . "[142-hegglund]

At the same time , however , seeing the others below [him]142-hegglund and hearing [their]2201-their cries , [he]142-hegglund could not contemplate anything so desperate as desertion . Instead , once out , [he]142-hegglund turned and making out [[Maida]211-maida axelrod below [him]142-hegglund]2202-maida below him , exclaimed : " Here , for Christ 's sake , gimme [your]211-maida axelrod hand . [We]2748-we got ta get outa dis and dam quick , [I]211-maida axelrod tell [ya]211-maida axelrod . "[211-maida axelrod] Then turning from [Maida]211-maida axelrod , who for the moment was feeling [her]211-maida axelrod wounded and aching head , [he]142-hegglund mounted the top chassis beam again and , reaching down , caught hold of [Tina Kogel]213-tina kogel , who , only stunned , was trying to push [herself]213-tina kogel to a sitting position while resting heavily on top of [Higby]162-higby . But [he]142-hegglund , relieved of the weight of [the others]264-the others , was already kneeling , and feeling [his]142-hegglund head and face with [his]142-hegglund hands .

" Gimme [your]211-maida axelrod hand , [Dave]217-dave , "[142-hegglund] called [Hegglund]142-hegglund . " Hurry ! For Christ 's sake ! [We]2748-we ai n't got no time to lose around here . Are [ya]211-maida axelrod hurt ? Christ , [we]2748-we got ta git outa here , [I]142-hegglund tellya . [I]142-hegglund see a guy comin ' acrost dere now an ' [I]142-hegglund doughno wedder [he]142-hegglund 's [a cop]2750-a cop or not . "[142-hegglund] [He]142-hegglund started to lay hold of [Higby]162-higby 's left hand , but as [he]142-hegglund did so [Higby]162-higby repulsed [him]142-hegglund .

" Huh , uh , "[142-hegglund] [he]142-hegglund exclaimed . " Do n't pull . [I]142-hegglund 'm all right . [I]142-hegglund 'll get out by [myself]142-hegglund . Help [the others]264-the others . "[142-hegglund] And standing up , [his]142-hegglund head above the level of the door , [he]142-hegglund began to look about within [the car]974-the car for something on which to place [his]142-hegglund foot . The back cushion having fallen out and forward , [he]142-hegglund got [his]142-hegglund foot on that and raised [himself]142-hegglund up to the door level on which [he]142-hegglund sat and drew out [his]142-hegglund leg . Then looking about , and seeing [Hegglund]142-hegglund attempting to assist [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [Clyde]149-clyde with [Sparser]210-sparser , [he]142-hegglund went to [their]2205-their aid .

Outside , some odd and confusing incidents had already occurred . For [Hortense]174-hortense , who had been lifted out before [Clyde]149-clyde , and had suddenly begun to feel [her]174-hortense face , had as suddenly realized that [her]174-hortense left cheek and forehead were not only scraped but bleeding . And being seized by the notion that [her]174-hortense beauty might have been permanently marred by this accident , [she]174-hortense was at once thrown into a state of selfish panic which caused [her]174-hortense to become completely oblivious , not only to the misery and injury of [the others]264-the others , but to the danger of discovery by [the police]583-the police , the injury to [the child]2208-the child , the wreck of [this expensive car]2209-this expensive car — in fact everything but [herself]174-hortense and the probability or possibility that [her]174-hortense beauty had been destroyed . [She]174-hortense began to whimper on the instant and wave [her]174-hortense hands up and down . " Oh , goodness , goodness , goodness ! "[174-hortense] [she]174-hortense exclaimed desperately . " Oh , how dreadful ! Oh , how terrible ! Oh , [my]174-hortense face is all cut . "[174-hortense] And feeling an urgent compulsion to do something about it , [she]174-hortense suddenly set off ( and without a word to [any one]511-any one and while [Clyde]149-clyde was still inside helping [Ratterer]158-ratterer ) south along [35th Street]22-14th street , toward [the city]662-the city where were lights and [more populated streets]2212-more populated streets . [Her]174-hortense one thought was to reach [[her]174-hortense own home]2213-her own home as speedily as possible in order that [she]174-hortense might do something for [herself]174-hortense .

Of [Clyde]149-clyde , [Sparser]210-sparser , [Ratterer]158-ratterer and [the other girls]2592-the other girls — [she]174-hortense really thought nothing . What were [they]2592-the other girls now ? It was only intermittently and between thoughts of [her]174-hortense marred beauty that [she]174-hortense could even bring [herself]174-hortense to think of [the injured child]2215-the injured child — the horror of which as well as the pursuit by [the police]583-the police , maybe , the fact that [the car]974-the car did not belong to [Sparser]210-sparser or that it was wrecked , and that [they]2592-the other girls were all liable to arrest in consequence , affecting [her]174-hortense but slightly . [Her]174-hortense one thought in regard to [Clyde]149-clyde was that [he]149-clyde was the one who had invited [her]174-hortense to this ill - fated journey — hence that [he]149-clyde was to blame , really . [Those beastly boys]2218-those beastly boys — to think [they]2218-those beastly boys should have gotten [her]174-hortense into this and then did n't have brains enough to manage better .

[The other girls]2592-the other girls , apart from [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe , were not seriously injured — any of [them]2592-the other girls . [They]2592-the other girls were more frightened than anything else , but now that this had happened [they]2592-the other girls were in a panic , lest [they]2592-the other girls be overtaken by [the police]583-the police , arrested , exposed and punished . And accordingly [they]2592-the other girls stood about , exclaiming " Oh , gee , hurry , ca n't [you]142-hegglund ? Oh , dear , [we]2592-the other girls ought all of [us]2592-the other girls to get away from here . Oh , it 's all so terrible . "[2592-the other girls] Until at last [Hegglund]142-hegglund exclaimed : " For Christ 's sake , keep quiet , [cantcha]2468-cantcha ? [We]2592-the other girls 're doing de best [we]2592-the other girls can , cantcha see ? [You]142-hegglund 'll have [de cops]2749-de cops down on [us]2592-the other girls in a minute as it is . "[142-hegglund]

And then , as if in answer to [his]142-hegglund comment , [a lone suburbanite who lived some four blocks from the scene across [the fields]2222-the fields]2221-a lone suburbanite who lived some four blocks from the scene across the fields and [who , hearing the crash and the cries in the night]2223-who , hearing the crash and the cries in the night , had ambled across to see what the trouble was , now drew near and stood curiously looking at [the stricken group]2224-the stricken group and [the car]974-the car .

" Had an accident , eh ? "[142-hegglund] [he]142-hegglund exclaimed , genially enough . " [Any one]511-any one badly hurt ? Gee , that 's too bad . And that 's [a swell car]2755-a swell car , too . Can [I]142-hegglund help any ? "[142-hegglund]

[Clyde]149-clyde , hearing [him]142-hegglund talk and looking out and not seeing [Hortense]174-hortense anywhere , and not being able to do more for [Sparser]210-sparser than stretch [him]210-sparser in the bottom of [the car]974-the car , glanced agonizingly about . For the thought of [the police]583-the police and [their]583-the police certain pursuit was strong upon [him]142-hegglund . [He]142-hegglund must get out of this . [He]142-hegglund must not be caught [here]2282-here . Think of what would happen to [him]142-hegglund if [he]142-hegglund were caught — how [he]142-hegglund would be disgraced and punished probably — all [his]142-hegglund fine world stripped from [him]142-hegglund before [he]142-hegglund could say a word really . [[His]142-hegglund mother]270-his mother would hear — [Mr. Squires]140-mr. squires — [everybody]858-everybody . Most certainly [he]142-hegglund would go to [jail]2126-jail . Oh , how terrible that thought was — grinding really like a macerating wheel to [his]142-hegglund flesh . [They]583-the police could do nothing more for [Sparser]210-sparser , and [they]583-the police only laid [themselves]583-the police open to being caught by lingering . So asking , " Where 'd [Miss Briggs]190-miss briggs go ? "[142-hegglund] [he]142-hegglund now began to climb out , then started looking about [the dark and snowy fields]2232-the dark and snowy fields for [her]2233-her . [His]142-hegglund thought was that [he]142-hegglund would first assist [her]2233-her to wherever [she]2233-her might desire to go .

But just then in the distance was heard the horns and the hum of at least [two motorcycles]2234-two motorcycles speeding swiftly in the direction of [this very spot]2235-this very spot . For already [the wife of [the suburbanite , on hearing the crash and the cries in the distance]2237-the suburbanite , on hearing the crash and the cries in the distance]2236-the wife of the suburbanite , on hearing the crash and the cries in the distance , had telephoned [the police]583-the police that an accident had occurred here . And now [the suburbanite]2239-the suburbanite was explaining : " That 's [them]2243-these approaching machines . [I]2239-the suburbanite told [the wife]1031-the wife to telephone for [an ambulance]2187-an ambulance . "[2239-the suburbanite] And hearing this , [all these others]2240-all these others now began to run , for [they]2240-all these others all realized what that meant . And in addition , looking across [the fields]2222-the fields [one]2242-one could see the lights of [these approaching machines]2243-these approaching machines . [They]2240-all these others reached [Thirty - first]115-thirty - first and [Cleveland]41-cleveland together . Then [one]489-one turned south toward [this very spot]2235-this very spot , along [Cleveland Avenue]117-cleveland avenue . And the other continued east on [Thirty - first]115-thirty - first , reconnoitering for the accident .

" Beat it , for God 's sake , [all of [youse]2758-all of youse]2758-all of youse , "[142-hegglund] whispered [Hegglund]142-hegglund , excitedly . " Scatter ! "[142-hegglund] And forthwith , seizing [Maida Axelrod]211-maida axelrod by the hand , [he]142-hegglund started to run east along [Thirty - fifth Street]118-thirty - fifth street , in which [the car]974-the car then lay — along [the outlying eastern suburbs]2247-the outlying eastern suburbs . But after a moment , deciding that that would not do either , that it would be too easy to pursue [him]142-hegglund along [a street]2612-a street , [he]142-hegglund cut northeast , directly across [the open fields]2249-the open fields and away from [the city]662-the city .

And now , [Clyde]149-clyde , as suddenly sensing what capture would mean — how all [his]149-clyde fine thoughts of pleasure would most certainly end in disgrace and probably prison , began running also . Only in [his]149-clyde case , instead of following [Hegglund]142-hegglund or [any of [the others]264-the others]1162-any of the others , [he]149-clyde turned south along [Cleveland Avenue]117-cleveland avenue toward [the southern limits of [the city]662-the city]2253-the southern limits of the city . But like [Hegglund]142-hegglund , realizing that that meant an easy avenue of pursuit for [any one who chose to follow]2255-any one who chose to follow , [he]149-clyde too took to [the open fields]2249-the open fields . Only instead of running away from [the city]662-the city as before , [he]149-clyde now turned southwest and ran toward [those streets which lay to the south of [Fortieth]119-fortieth]2258-those streets which lay to the south of fortieth . Only much open space being before [him]149-clyde before [he]149-clyde should reach [them]2258-those streets which lay to the south of fortieth , and a clump of bushes showing in the near distance , and the light of [the motorcycle]2259-the motorcycle already sweeping [the road]1963-the road behind [him]149-clyde , [he]149-clyde ran to that and for the moment dropped behind [it]2261-it .

Only Sparser and [Laura Sipe]214-laura sipe were left within [the car]974-the car , [she]214-laura sipe at that moment beginning to recover consciousness . And [the visiting stranger]2263-the visiting stranger , much astounded , was left standing outside .

" Why , the very idea ! "[149-clyde] [he]149-clyde suddenly said to [himself]149-clyde . " [They]2759-they must have stolen [that car]2739-that car . It could n't have belonged to [them]2759-they at all . "[149-clyde]

And just then the first motorcycle reaching [the scene]2264-the scene , [Clyde]149-clyde from [[his]149-clyde not too distant hiding place]2265-his not too distant hiding place was able to overhear . " Well , [you]149-clyde did n't get away with it after all , did [you]149-clyde ? [You]149-clyde thought [you]149-clyde were pretty slick , but [you]149-clyde did n't make it . [You]149-clyde 're the one [we]2761-we want , and what 's become of [the rest of [the gang]2763-the gang]2762-the rest of the gang , eh ? Where are [they]2762-the rest of the gang , eh ? "[149-clyde]

And hearing [the suburbanite]2239-the suburbanite declare quite definitely that [he]149-clyde had nothing to do with it , that [the real occupants of]2267-the real occupants of [the car]974-the car had but then run away and might yet be caught if [the police]583-the police wished , [Clyde]149-clyde , who was still within earshot of what was being said , began crawling upon [his]149-clyde hands and knees at first in [the snow south]2270-the snow south , south and west , always toward some of [those distant streets]2271-those distant streets which , lamplit and faintly glowing , [he]149-clyde saw to [the southwest of [him]149-clyde]2272-the southwest of him , and among which presently , if [he]149-clyde were not captured , [he]149-clyde hoped to hide — to lose [himself]149-clyde and so escape — if the fates were only kind — the misery and the punishment and the unending dissatisfaction and disappointment which now , most definitely , it all represented to [him]149-clyde .
